I gave, I gave My life for thee,
What hast thou giv’n for Me?
stanza2: I spent long years for thee
In weariness and woe,
That an eternity
Of joy thou mightest know:
I spent, I spent long years for thee;
Hast thou spent one for Me?
stanza3: My Father’s home of light,
My glory-circled throne
I left for earthly night
For wand’rings sad and lone;
I left, I left it all for thee,
Hast thou left aught for Me?
stanza4: I suffered much for thee,
More than thy tongue can tell,
Of bitt’rest agony -
To rescue thee from hell;
I’ve borne, I’ve borne it all for thee,
What hast thou borne for Me?
stanza5: Lord, let my life be given,
And every moment spent,
For God, for souls, for heaven,
And all earth’s ties be rent
Thou gav’st, Thou gav’st Thyself for me,
Now I give all for Thee.

generalIndex.title: GHS 232
generalIndex.subtitle: BLEST BE THE TIE THAT BINDS
stanza1: Blest be the tie that binds
Our hearts in Christian love;
The fellowship of kindred minds
Is like to that above.
stanza2: Before our Father’s throne,
We pour our ardent prayers;
Our fears, our hopes, our aims are one,
Our comforts and our cares.
stanza3: We share our mutual woes,
Our mutual burdens bear;
And often for each other flows
The sympathizing tear.
stanza4: When we asunder part,
It gives us inward pain:
But we shall still be joined in heart,
And hope to meet again.

generalIndex.title: GHS 245
generalIndex.subtitle: IS YOUR LIFE A CHANNEL OF BLESSING?
stanza1: Is your life a channel of blessing?
Is the love of God flowing thro’ you?
Are you telling the lost of the Saviour?
Are you ready His service to do?
stanza2: Is your life a channel of blessing?
Are you burdened for those that are lost?
Have you urged upon those who are straying,
The Saviour who died on the cross?
stanza3: Is your life a channel of blessing?
Is it daily telling for Him?
Have you spoken the word of salvation
To those who are dying in sin?
stanza4: We cannot be channels of blessing
If our lives are not free from all sin;
We will barriers be and a hindrance
To those we are trying to win.
chorus1: Make me a channel of blessing today,
Make me a channel of blessing, I pray;
My life possessing, My service blessing,
Make me a channel of blessing today.
chorus2: Make me a channel of blessing today,
Make me a channel of blessing, I pray;
My life possessing, My service blessing,
Make me a channel of blessing today.
chorus3: Make me a channel of blessing today,
Make me a channel of blessing, I pray;
My life possessing, My service blessing,
Make me a channel of blessing today.
chorus4: Make me a channel of blessing today,
Make me a channel of blessing, I pray;
My life possessing, My service blessing,
Make me a channel of blessing today.

generalIndex.title: GHS 259
generalIndex.subtitle: MORE LIKE THE MASTER
stanza1: More like the Master I would ever be,
More of His meekness, more humility;
More zeal to labour, more courage to be true
More consecration for work He bids me do.
stanza2: More like the Master is my daily prayer;
More strength to carry crosses I must bear;
More earnest effort to bring His kingdom in;
More of His Spirit, the wanderer to win.
stanza3: More like the Master I would live and
grow;
More of His love to others I would show;
More self denial, like His in Galilee,
More like the Master I long to ever be.
chorus1: Take Thou my heart, I would be Thine alone;
Take Thou my heart, and make it all thine
own.
Purge me from sin, O Lord, I now implore,
Wash me and keep me Thine forevermore
chorus2: Take Thou my heart, I would be Thine alone;
Take Thou my heart, and make it all thine
own.
Purge me from sin, O Lord, I now implore,
Wash me and keep me Thine forevermore
chorus3: Take Thou my heart, I would be Thine alone;
Take Thou my heart, and make it all thine
own.
Purge me from sin, O Lord, I now implore,
Wash me and keep me Thine forevermore

generalIndex.title: GHS 53
generalIndex.subtitle: SO SEND I YOU
stanza1: So send I you - to labour unrewarded,
To serve unpaid, unloved, unsought, unknown,
To bear rebuke, to suffer scorn and scoffing
So send I you - to toil for Me alone.
stanza2: So send I you -to bind the bruised and broken,
O’er wand’ring souls to work, to weep, to wake,
To bear the burdens of a world a-weary
So send I you - to suffer for My sake.
stanza3: So send I you - to loneliness and longing
With heart a-hung’ring for the loved and known,
Forsaking home and kindred, friend and dear one
So send I you - to know My love alone.
stanza4: So send I you - to leave your life’s ambition,
To die to dear desire, self-will resign,
To labour long and love where men revile you
So send I you - to loose your life in Mine.
stanza5: So send I you - to hearts made hard by hatred,
To eyes made blind because they will not see,
To spend, tho’ it be blood to spend and spare not
So send I you - to taste of Calvary.
chorus1: “As the Father hath sent Me,
So send I you.”
chorus2: “As the Father hath sent Me,
So send I you.”
chorus3: “As the Father hath sent Me,
So send I you.”
chorus4: “As the Father hath sent Me,
So send I you.”
chorus5: “As the Father hath sent Me,
So send I you.”

generalIndex.title: GHS 54
generalIndex.subtitle: I AM READY FOR SERVICE
stanza1: Listen to the Master’s pleadings,
There is urgent work for all,
Heed the Spirit’s interceding,
Give this answer to the call:
stanza2: There’s a voice to you now calling,
Will you heed the earnest word,
On the ear it’s gently calling,
Give this answer to your Lord:
stanza3: Many souls in sins are dying,
Haste to help them while you may,
For the time is swiftly flying,
Will you now to Jesus say:
chorus1: I am ready for service for Thee, dear Lord,
Here am I - send me,
I am willing to be what You’d have me be,
I will go to where You want me to go.
I am ready for Service for Thee, dear Lord,
Here am I, send me,
Tho’ the pathway seems dark
For Thee I’ll do or die, I am ready for service Lord.
chorus2: I am ready for service for Thee, dear Lord,
Here am I - send me,
I am willing to be what You’d have me be,
I will go to where You want me to go.
I am ready for Service for Thee, dear Lord,
Here am I, send me,
Tho’ the pathway seems dark
For Thee I’ll do or die, I am ready for service Lord.
chorus3: I am ready for service for Thee, dear Lord,
Here am I - send me,
I am willing to be what You’d have me be,
I will go to where You want me to go.
I am ready for Service for Thee, dear Lord,
Here am I, send me,
Tho’ the pathway seems dark
For Thee I’ll do or die, I am ready for service Lord.

generalIndex.title: GHS 55
generalIndex.subtitle: ANYWHERE WITH JESUS
stanza1: Anywhere with Jesus I can safely go;
Anywhere He leads me in this world below;
Anywhere without Him dearest joys would fade;
Anywhere with Jesus, I am not afraid.
stanza2: Anywhere with Jesus I am not alone;
Other friends may fail me, He is still my own;
Tho’ His hand may lead me over dreariest ways,
Anywhere with Jesus is a house of praise.
stanza3: Anywhere with Jesus over land and sea,
Telling souls in darkness of salvation free;
Ready as He summons me to go or stay,
Anywhere with Jesus when He points the way.
stanza4: Anywhere with Jesus I can go to sleep,
When the dark’ning shadows round about me creep;
Knowing I shall waken never more to roam,
Anywhere with Jesus will be home, sweet home.
chorus1: Anywhere! anywhere!
Fear I cannot know;
Anywhere with Jesus
I can safely go.
chorus2: Anywhere! anywhere!
Fear I cannot know;
Anywhere with Jesus
I can safely go.
chorus3: Anywhere! anywhere!
Fear I cannot know;
Anywhere with Jesus
I can safely go.
chorus4: Anywhere! anywhere!
Fear I cannot know;
Anywhere with Jesus
I can safely go.

generalIndex.title: GHS 56
generalIndex.subtitle: I LOVE, I LOVE MY MASTER
stanza1: I love, I love my Master,
I will not go out free!
For He is my Redeemer;
He paid the price for me.
I would not leave His service,
It is so sweet and blest;
And in the weariest moments
He gives the truest rest.
stanza2: My Master shed His life-blood
My vassal life to win,
And save me from the bondage
Of tyrant self and sin.
He chose me for His service,
And gave me power to choose
That blessed, perfect freedom,
Which I shall never lose.
stanza3: I would not halve my service,
His only it must be!
His only - Who so loved me,
And gave Himself for me.
Rejoicing and adoring,
Henceforth my song shall be -
“I love, I love my Master,
I will not go out free!”

generalIndex.title: GHS 57
generalIndex.subtitle: THEY THAT WAIT UPON THE LORD
stanza1: Ho, reapers in the whitened harvest!
Oft feeble, faint, and few;
Come, wait upon the blessed Master,
Our strength He will renew.
stanza2: Too oft a-weary and discouraged,
We pour a sad complaint;
Believing in a living Saviour,
Why should we ever faint?
stanza3: Rejoice! for He is with us alway,
Lo, even to the end!
Look up! take courage and go forward -
All needed grace He’ll send!
chorus1: For “they that wait upon the Lord... shall
renew... their strength, they shall mount up
with wings, they shall mount up with wings as eagles:
They shall run... and not be weary; they shall
walk and not faint;
They shall run... and not be weary; they
shall walk and not faint;
They shall run and not be weary, shall walk
and not faint.”
chorus2: For “they that wait upon the Lord... shall
renew... their strength, they shall mount up
with wings, they shall mount up with wings as eagles:
They shall run... and not be weary; they shall
walk and not faint;
They shall run... and not be weary; they
shall walk and not faint;
They shall run and not be weary, shall walk
and not faint.”
chorus3: For “they that wait upon the Lord... shall
renew... their strength, they shall mount up
with wings, they shall mount up with wings as eagles:
They shall run... and not be weary; they shall
walk and not faint;
They shall run... and not be weary; they
shall walk and not faint;
They shall run and not be weary, shall walk
and not faint.”

generalIndex.title: GHS 58
generalIndex.subtitle: THE LAST MILE OF THE WAY
stanza1: If I walk in the pathway of duty,
If I work till the close of the day;
I shall see the great King in His beauty,
When I’ve gone the last mile of the way.
stanza2: If for Christ I proclaim the glad story,
If I seek for His sheep gone astray,
I am sure He will show me His glory,
When I’ve gone the last mile of the way.
stanza3: Here the dearest of ties we must sever,
Tears of sorrow are seen ev’ry day;
But no sickness, no sighing forever,
When I’ve gone the last mile of the way.
stanza4: And if here I have earnestly striven,
And have tried all His will to obey,
Christian Service & Reward
’Twill enhance all the rapture of heaven,
When I’ve gone the last mile of the way.
chorus1: When I’ve gone the last mile of the way,...
I will rest at the close of the day,...
And I know there are joys that await me,
When I’ve gone the last mile of the way.
chorus2: When I’ve gone the last mile of the way,...
I will rest at the close of the day,...
And I know there are joys that await me,
When I’ve gone the last mile of the way.
chorus3: When I’ve gone the last mile of the way,...
I will rest at the close of the day,...
And I know there are joys that await me,
When I’ve gone the last mile of the way.
chorus4: When I’ve gone the last mile of the way,...
I will rest at the close of the day,...
And I know there are joys that await me,
When I’ve gone the last mile of the way.

generalIndex.title: GHS 59
generalIndex.subtitle: LITTLE IS MUCH WHEN GOD IS IN IT
stanza1: In the harvest field now ripened
There’s a work for all to do;
Hark! the voice of God is calling,
To the harvest calling you.
stanza2: Does the place you’re called to labour
Seem so small and little known?
It is great if God is in it,
And He’ll not forget His own.
stanza3: Are you laid aside from service,
Body worn from toil and care?
You can still be in the battle
In the sacred place of pray’r.
stanza4: When the conflict here is ended
And our race on earth is run,
He will say, if we are faithful,
“Welcome home, my child - well done.”
chorus1: Little is much, when God is in it!
Labour not for wealth or fame;
There’s a crown and you can win it
If you’ll go in Jesus’ name.
chorus2: Little is much, when God is in it!
Labour not for wealth or fame;
There’s a crown and you can win it
If you’ll go in Jesus’ name.
chorus3: Little is much, when God is in it!
Labour not for wealth or fame;
There’s a crown and you can win it
If you’ll go in Jesus’ name.
chorus4: Little is much, when God is in it!
Labour not for wealth or fame;
There’s a crown and you can win it
If you’ll go in Jesus’ name.

generalIndex.title: GHS 60
generalIndex.subtitle: WHERE COULD I GO?
stanza1: Living below in this old sinful world,
Hardly a comfort can afford;
Striving alone to face temptations sore,
Where could I go but to the Lord?
stanza2: Neighbours are kind, I love them ev’ry one,
We get along in sweet accord;
But when my soul needs manna from above,
Where could I go but to the Lord?
stanza3: Life here is grand with friends I love so dear,
Comfort I get from God’s own Word;
Yet when I face the chilling hand of death,
Where could I go but to the Lord?
chorus1: Where could I go, O where could I go,
Seeking a refuge for my soul?
Needing a friend to help me in the end,
Where could I go but to the Lord?
chorus2: Where could I go, O where could I go,
Seeking a refuge for my soul?
Needing a friend to help me in the end,
Where could I go but to the Lord?
chorus3: Where could I go, O where could I go,
Seeking a refuge for my soul?
Needing a friend to help me in the end,
Where could I go but to the Lord?

generalIndex.title: GHS 61
generalIndex.subtitle: LORD, SPEAK TO ME, THAT I MAY SPEAK
stanza1: Lord, speak to me, that I may speak
In living echoes of thy tone;
As Thou hast sought, so let me seek
Thy erring children lost and lone.
stanza2: Oh, lead me, Lord, that I may lead
The wandering and the wavering feet;
O, feed me, Lord, that I may feed
Thy hungering ones with manna sweet.
stanza3: Oh, strengthen me, that while I stand
Firm on the Rock, and strong in Thee,
I may stretch out a loving hand
To wrestlers with the troubled sea.
stanza4: Oh, teach me, Lord, that I may teach
The precious things Thou dost impart;
And wing my words, that they may reach
The hidden depths of many a heart.
stanza5: Oh, give Thine own sweet rest to me,
That I may speak with soothing power
A word in season, as from Thee,
To weary ones in needful hour.
stanza6: Oh, fill me with Thy fulness, Lord,
In kindling thought, and glowing word,
Thy love to tell, Thy praise to show.
stanza7: Oh, use me, Lord, use even me,
Just as Thou wilt, and how, and where;
Until Thy blessed face I see,
Thy rest, Thy joy, Thy glory share.

generalIndex.title: GHS 62
generalIndex.subtitle: GO, LABOUR ON
stanza1: Go, labour on, spend, and be spent,
Thy joy to do the Father’s will;
It is the way the Master went,
Should not the servant tread it still?
stanza2: Go, labour on; ’tis not for nought,
Thy earthly loss is heav’nly gain.
Men heed thee, love thee, praise thee not,
The Master praises, what are men?
stanza3: Men die in darkness at your side,
Without a hope to cheer the tomb:
Take up the torch, and wave it wide,
The torch that lights times thickest gloom.
stanza4: Toil on, and in thy toil rejoice,
For toil comes rest, for exile home;
Soon shalt thou hear the Bridegroom’s voice,
The midnight peal, “Behold, I come!”

generalIndex.title: GHS 63
generalIndex.subtitle: WILL THERE BE ANY STARS?
stanza1: I am thinking today of that beautiful land
I shall reach when the sun goeth down;
When thro’ wonderful grace by my Saviour I stand,
Will there be any stars in my crown?
stanza2: In the strength of the Lord let me labour and pray,
Let me watch as a winner of souls;
That bright stars may be mine in the glorious day,
When His praise like the sea billows roll.
stanza3: O what joy will it be when His face I behold,
Living gems at His feet to lay down;
It would sweeten my bliss in the city of gold,
Should there be any stars in my crown?
chorus1: Will there be any stars, any stars in my crown,
When at evening the sun goeth down?
When I wake with the blest, in the mansions of rest,
Will there be any stars in my crown?
chorus2: Will there be any stars, any stars in my crown,
When at evening the sun goeth down?
When I wake with the blest, in the mansions of rest,
Will there be any stars in my crown?
chorus3: Will there be any stars, any stars in my crown,
When at evening the sun goeth down?
When I wake with the blest, in the mansions of rest,
Will there be any stars in my crown?

generalIndex.title: GHS 251
generalIndex.subtitle: ONLY REMEMBERED
stanza1: Fading away like the stars of
the morning,
Losing their light in the glorious
sun-
Thus would we pass from the earth
and its toiling,
Only remembered by what we have
done.
stanza2: Shall we be missed, tho'  by others
succeeded,
Reaping the fields we in spring time
have sown?
Yes, but the sowers must pass from
their labours,
Ever remembered by what they have
done.
stanza3: Only the truth that in life we have
spoken,
Only the seed that on earth we have
sown;
These shall pass onward when we are
forgotten,
Fruits of the harvest and what we have
done.
stanza4: Oh, when the saviour shall make up
His jewels,
When the bright crowns of rejoicing
are won,
Then shall His weary and faithful
disciples
All be remembered by what they have
done.
chorus1: Only remembered, only remembered,
Only remembered by what we have
done;
Thus would we pass from the eatrth
and its toiling,
Only remembered  by what we have
done.
chorus2: Only remembered, only remembered,
Only remembered by what we have
done;
Thus would we pass from the eatrth
and its toiling,
Only remembered  by what we have
done.
chorus3: Only remembered, only remembered,
Only remembered by what we have
done;
Thus would we pass from the eatrth
and its toiling,
Only remembered  by what we have
done.
chorus4: Only remembered, only remembered,
Only remembered by what we have
done;
Thus would we pass from the eatrth
and its toiling,
Only remembered  by what we have
done.

generalIndex.title: GHS 64
generalIndex.subtitle: THE OLD RUGGED CROSS
stanza1: On a hill far away stood an old rugged cross,
The emblem of suff’ring and shame;
And I love that old cross where the dearest and best
For a world of lost sinners was slain.
stanza2: O, that old rugged cross, so despised by the world,
Has a wondrous attraction for me;
For the dear Lamb of God left His glory above,
To bear it to dark Calvary.
stanza3: In the old rugged cross, stained with blood so divine,
A wondrous beauty I see;
For ’twas on that old cross Jesus suffered and died,
To pardon and sanctify me.
stanza4: To the old rugged cross I will ever be true,
Its shame and reproach gladly bear;
Then He’ll call me some day to my home far away,
Where His glory forever I’ll share.
chorus1: So I’ll cherish the old rugged cross,
Till my trophies at last I lay down;
I will cling to the old rugged cross,...
And exchange it some day for a crown.
chorus2: So I’ll cherish the old rugged cross,
Till my trophies at last I lay down;
I will cling to the old rugged cross,...
And exchange it some day for a crown.
chorus3: So I’ll cherish the old rugged cross,
Till my trophies at last I lay down;
I will cling to the old rugged cross,...
And exchange it some day for a crown.
chorus4: So I’ll cherish the old rugged cross,
Till my trophies at last I lay down;
I will cling to the old rugged cross,...
And exchange it some day for a crown.

generalIndex.title: GHS 65
generalIndex.subtitle: O HOW I LOVE JESUS
stanza1: There is a name I love to hear,
I love to sing its worth;
It sounds like music in mine ear,
The sweetest name on earth.
stanza2: It tells me of a Saviour’s love,
Who died to set me free;
It tells me of His precious blood,
The sinner’s perfect plea.
stanza3: It tells me what my Father hath
In store for ev’ry day,
And tho I tread a dark-some path,
Yields sunshine all the way.
stanza4: It tells of One whose loving heart
Can feel my deepest woe,
Who in each sorrow bears a part
That none can bear below.
chorus1: O how I love Jesus,
O how I love Jesus,
O how I love Jesus,
Because He first loved me!
chorus2: O how I love Jesus,
O how I love Jesus,
O how I love Jesus,
Because He first loved me!
chorus3: O how I love Jesus,
O how I love Jesus,
O how I love Jesus,
Because He first loved me!
chorus4: O how I love Jesus,
O how I love Jesus,
O how I love Jesus,
Because He first loved me!

generalIndex.title: GHS 66
generalIndex.subtitle: JESUS IS THE SWEETEST NAME I KNOW
stanza1: There have been names that I have loved to hear,
But never has there been a name so dear
To this heart of mine, as the name divine,
The precious, precious name of Jesus.
stanza2: There is no name in earth or Heav’n above,
That we should give such honour and such love,
As the blessed name, let us all acclaim,
That wondrous, glorious name of Jesus.
stanza3: And someday I shall see Him face to face,
To thank and praise Him for His wondrous grace,
Which He gave to me, when He made me free,
The blessed Son of God named Jesus.
chorus1: Jesus is the sweetest name I know,
And He’s just the same as His lovely name,
And that’s the reason why I love Him so;
Oh, Jesus is the sweetest name I know.
chorus2: Jesus is the sweetest name I know,
And He’s just the same as His lovely name,
And that’s the reason why I love Him so;
Oh, Jesus is the sweetest name I know.
chorus3: Jesus is the sweetest name I know,
And He’s just the same as His lovely name,
And that’s the reason why I love Him so;
Oh, Jesus is the sweetest name I know.

generalIndex.title: GHS 67
generalIndex.subtitle: MY JESUS I LOVE THEE
stanza1: My Jesus I love Thee, I know Thou art mine;
For Thee all the follies of sin I resign;
My gracious Redeemer, my Saviour art Thou;
If ever I loved Thee, my Jesus ’tis now.
stanza2: I love Thee because Thou hast first loved me,
And purchased my pardon on Calvary’s tree;
I love Thee for wearing the thorns on Thy brow;
If ever I loved Thee, my Jesus ’tis now.
stanza3: I’ll love Thee in life, I will love Thee in death,
And praise Thee as long as Thou lendest me breath;
And say when the death-dew lies cold on my brow;
If ever I loved Thee, my Jesus, ’tis now.
stanza4: In mansions of glory and endless delight,
I’ll ever adore Thee in Heaven so bright;
I’ll sing with the glittering crown on my brow;
If ever I loved Thee, my Jesus ’tis now.

generalIndex.title: GHS 68
generalIndex.subtitle: SAVIOUR, LIKE A SHEPHERD LEAD US
stanza1: Saviour, like a shepherd lead us,
Much we need Thy tender care;
In Thy pleasant pastures feed us,
For our use Thy folds prepare;
Blessed Jesus, Blessed Jesus,
Thou hast bought us, Thine we are;
Blessed Jesus, Blessed Jesus,
Thou hast bought us, Thine we are.
stanza2: We are Thine, do Thou befriend us,
Be the Guardian of our way;
Keep Thy flock, from sin defend us,
Seek us when we go astray;
Blessed Jesus, Blessed Jesus,
Hear, O hear us when we pray;
Blessed Jesus, Blessed Jesus,
Hear, O hear us when we pray.
stanza3: Thou hast promised to receive us,
Poor and sinful tho’ we be;
Thou hast mercy to relieve us,
Grace to cleanse and pow’r to free;
Blessed Jesus, Blessed Jesus,
Early let us turn to Thee,
Blessed Jesus, Blessed Jesus,
Early let us turn to Thee.
stanza4: Early let us seek Thy favour,
Early let us do Thy will;
Blessed Lord and only Saviour,
With Thy love our bossoms fill:
Blessed Jesus, Blessed Jesus,
Thou hast loved us, love us still;
Blessed Jesus, Blessed Jesus,
Thou hast loved us, love us still.
stanza5: Like a shepherd come receive us,
When Thou comest in the air,
In Thine arms wilt Thou now take us
To that joyful union there;
Blessed Jesus Blessed Jesus,
In that land beyond compare;
Blessed Jesus, Blessed Jesus,
In that land beyond compare.

generalIndex.title: GHS 69
generalIndex.subtitle: CHRIST BE BESIDE ME
stanza1: Christ be beside me, Christ be before me,
Christ be behind me - King of my heart;
Christ be within me, Christ be below me,
Christ be above me - never to part.
stanza2: Christ on my right hand, Christ on my left hand,
Christ all around me - shield in the strife;
Christ in my sleeping, Christ in my sitting,
Christ in my rising - Light of my life.
stanza3: Christ be in all hearts thinking about me,
Christ be on all tongues telling of me;
Christ be the vision in eyes that see me,
In ears that hear me Christ ever be.
stanza4: Christ be beside me, Christ be before me,
Christ be behind me - King of my heart;
Christ be within me, Christ be below me,
Christ be above me - never to part.

generalIndex.title: GHS 70
generalIndex.subtitle: HAVE YOU ANY ROOM FOR JESUS?
stanza1: Have you any room for Jesus,
He who bore your load of sin?
As He knocks and asks admission,
Sinners, will you let Him in?
stanza2: Room for pleasure, room for business,
But for Christ the crucified;
Not a place that He can enter,
In your heart for which He died?
stanza3: Have you any time for Jesus,
As in grace He calls again?
O today is time accepted,
Tomorrow you may call in vain.
stanza4: Room and time now give to Jesus,
Soon will pass God’s day of grace;
Soon thy heart left cold and silent,
And thy Saviour’s pleading cease.
chorus1: Room for Jesus, King of glory,
Hasten now, His word obey,
Swing the heart’s door widely open,
Bid Him enter while you may.
chorus2: Room for Jesus, King of glory,
Hasten now, His word obey,
Swing the heart’s door widely open,
Bid Him enter while you may.
chorus3: Room for Jesus, King of glory,
Hasten now, His word obey,
Swing the heart’s door widely open,
Bid Him enter while you may.
chorus4: Room for Jesus, King of glory,
Hasten now, His word obey,
Swing the heart’s door widely open,
Bid Him enter while you may.

generalIndex.title: GHS 71
generalIndex.subtitle: I WANT TO SEE JESUS, DON’T YOU?
stanza1: There is One loved me so that for me He died,
He’s my dear, precious Saviour so true;
On the cross for my sins He was crucified;
I want to see Jesus, don’t you?
stanza2: When I’m weary and faint He is always near,
With His joy He my strength doth renew;
And He comforts my heart, speaking words of cheer:
I want to see Jesus, don’t you?
stanza3: Holy angels keep watch o’er me thro’ the night,
And each morning He guards me anew;
In the smile of His love doth my soul delight;
I want to see Jesus, don’t you?
stanza4: He is fairer than lily or rose to me,
And His blessings fall soft as the dew;
O my heart, how it longs His dear face to see:
I want to see Jesus, don’t you?
stanza5: There’s a place for my soul that He doth prepare,
And its beauty by faith I can view;
First of all, when I enter that mansion fair,
I want to see Jesus, don’t you?
chorus1: I want to see Jesus, don’t you?
My Saviour so faithful and true;...
When I reach the strand of that love-bright land,
O I want to see Jesus, don’t you?.
chorus2: I want to see Jesus, don’t you?
My Saviour so faithful and true;...
When I reach the strand of that love-bright land,
O I want to see Jesus, don’t you?.
chorus3: I want to see Jesus, don’t you?
My Saviour so faithful and true;...
When I reach the strand of that love-bright land,
O I want to see Jesus, don’t you?.
chorus4: I want to see Jesus, don’t you?
My Saviour so faithful and true;...
When I reach the strand of that love-bright land,
O I want to see Jesus, don’t you?.
chorus5: I want to see Jesus, don’t you?
My Saviour so faithful and true;...
When I reach the strand of that love-bright land,
O I want to see Jesus, don’t you?.

generalIndex.title: GHS 72
generalIndex.subtitle: THE SOLID ROCK
stanza1: My hope is built on nothing less,
Than Jesus’ blood and righteousness,
I dare not trust the sweetest frame,
But wholly lean on Jesus’ name.
stanza2: When darkness seems to hide His face,
I rest on His unchanging grace;
In every high and stormy gale,
My anchor holds within the vale.
stanza3: His oath, His covenant, His blood,
Support me in the whelming flood;
When all around my soul gives way,
He then is all my hope and stay.
stanza4: When He shall come with trumpet sound,
Oh, may I then in Him be found;
Dressed in His righteousness alone,
Faultless to stand before the throne.
chorus1: On Christ, the solid Rock, I stand;
All other ground is sinking sand,
All other ground is sinking sand.
chorus2: On Christ, the solid Rock, I stand;
All other ground is sinking sand,
All other ground is sinking sand.
chorus3: On Christ, the solid Rock, I stand;
All other ground is sinking sand,
All other ground is sinking sand.
chorus4: On Christ, the solid Rock, I stand;
All other ground is sinking sand,
All other ground is sinking sand.

generalIndex.title: GHS 73
generalIndex.subtitle: JESUS ONLY IS OUR MESSAGE
stanza1: Jesus only is our Message,
Jesus all our topicalIndex shall be,
We will lift up Jesus ever,
Jesus only will we see.
stanza2: Jesus only is our Saviour,
All our guilt He bore away,
All our righteousness He gives us,
All our strength from day to day.
stanza3: Jesus is our Sanctifier,
Cleansing us from self and sin,
And with all His Spirit’s fulness,
Filling all our hearts within.
stanza4: Jesus only is our Healer,
All our sicknesses He bare,
And His risen life and fulness,
All His members still may share.
stanza5: Jesus only is our Power,
His the gift of Pentecost,
Jesus, breathe Thy Power upon us,
Fill us with the Holy Ghost.
stanza6: And for Jesus we are waiting
Then it will be us and Jesus,
chorus1: Jesus only, Jesus ever,
Jesus all in all we sing;
Saviour, Sanctifier, Healer,
Baptizer and coming King.
chorus2: Jesus only, Jesus ever,
Jesus all in all we sing;
Saviour, Sanctifier, Healer,
Baptizer and coming King.
chorus3: Jesus only, Jesus ever,
Jesus all in all we sing;
Saviour, Sanctifier, Healer,
Baptizer and coming King.
chorus4: Jesus only, Jesus ever,
Jesus all in all we sing;
Saviour, Sanctifier, Healer,
Baptizer and coming King.
chorus5: Jesus only, Jesus ever,
Jesus all in all we sing;
Saviour, Sanctifier, Healer,
Baptizer and coming King.
chorus6: Jesus all in all we sing;

generalIndex.title: GHS 74
generalIndex.subtitle: THE HEART THAT WAS BROKEN FOR ME
stanza1: There came from the skies in the days long ago
The Lord with a message of love;
The world knew Him not; He was treated with scorn -
This wonderful gift from above.
stanza2: He came to His own - to the ones that He loved;
The sheep that had wandered astray;
They heard not His voice, but the Friend of mankind
Was hated and driven away.
stanza3: The birds have their nests, and the foxes have holes,
But He had no place for His head;
A pallet of stone on the cold mountain side,
Was all that He had for His bed.
stanza4: I cannot reject such a Saviour as He;
Dishonour and wound Him again;
I’ll go to His feet and repent of my sin,
Be willing to suffer the pain.
interlude1: He was smitten and nailed to the tree,
But the pain in His heart was the hardest to bear,
The heart that was broken for me...
interlude2: He was smitten and nailed to the tree,
But the pain in His heart was the hardest to bear,
The heart that was broken for me...
interlude3: He was smitten and nailed to the tree,
But the pain in His heart was the hardest to bear,
The heart that was broken for me...
interlude4: I’ll take up my cross, I will walk by His side,
For the pathway of duty I see,
I will follow my Lord and abide in His heart,
The heart that was broken for me...

generalIndex.title: GHS 75
generalIndex.subtitle: THE CHURCH’S ONE FOUNDATION
stanza1: The Church’s one foundation,
Is Jesus Christ her Lord:
She is His new creation
By water and the word;
From heav’n He came and sought her
To be His holy bride;
With His own blood He bought her,
And for her life He died.
stanza2: Elect from every nation,
Yet one o’er all the earth,
Her charter of salvation
One Lord, one faith, one birth,
One holy name she blesses,
Partakes one holy food,
And to one hope she presses,
With every grace endued.
stanza3: Though with a scornful wonder
Men see her sore oppressed,
By schisms rent asunder,
By heresies distressed,
Yet saints their watch are keeping,
Their cry goes up, “how long?”
And soon the night of weeping
Shall be the morn of song.
stanza4: ’Mid toil and tribulation,
And tumult of her war,
She waits the consummation
Of peace for evermore.
Till with the vision glorious
Her longing eyes are blest,
And the great Church victorious
Shall be the Church at rest.
stanza5: Yet she on earth hath union
With God the Three in One,
And mystic sweet communion
With those whose rest is won.
O happy ones and holy!
Lord, give us grace that we
Like them, the meek and lowly,
On high may dwell with Thee.

generalIndex.title: GHS 238
generalIndex.subtitle: THOU HIDDEN SOURCE OF CALM REPOSE
stanza1: Thou hidden Source of calm repose,
Thou all sufficient love divine;
My help and refuge from my foes,
Secure I am, if Thou art mine,
From sin and grief, from guilt and shame:
I hide me, Jesus, in Thy name.
stanza2: Thy mighty Name salvation is,
And keeps my happy soul above;
Comfort it brings, and power and peace,
And joy and everlasting love;
To me, with Thy dear Name, are given
Pardon and holiness and heaven.
stanza3: Jesus, my all in all Thou art,
My rest in toil, mine ease in pain;
The med’cine of my broken heart;
In war, my peace; in loss, my gain:
My smile beneath the tyrant’s frown;
In shame, my glory and my crown.
stanza4: In want, my plentiful supply;
In weakness, mine almighty power;
In bonds, my perfect liberty;
My light in Satan’s darkest hour;
In grief, my joy unspeakable;
My life in death; my heaven, my all.

generalIndex.title: GHS 239
generalIndex.subtitle: ONE THERE IS ABOVE ALL OTHERS
stanza1: One there is above all others,
Well deserves the name of Friend;
His is love beyond a brother’s,
Costly, free, and knows no end:
They who once His kindness prove,
Find it everlasting love.
stanza2: Which of all our friends, to save us,
Could or would have shed his blood?
But our Jesus died to have us
Reconciled in Him to God:
This was boundless love indeed;
Jesus is a Friend in need.
stanza3: When He lived on earth abased
“Friend of sinners” was His name;
Now above all glories raised,
He rejoices in the same;
Still He calls them brethren, friends,
And to all their wants attends.
stanza4: O, for grace our hearts to soften!
Teach us, Lord, at length to love;
We, alas! forget too often
What a Friend we have above;
But when home our souls are brought
We shall love Thee as we ought.

generalIndex.title: GHS 76
generalIndex.subtitle: IN TIMES LIKE THESE
stanza1: In times like these, you need a Saviour,
In times like these, you need an anchor;
Be very sure, Be very sure,
Your anchor holds, and grips the Solid Rock!
stanza2: In times like these, you need the Bible,
In times like these, O, be not idle;
Be very sure, be very sure,
Your anchor holds and grips the Solid Rock!
stanza3: In times like these, I have a Saviour,
In times like these, I have an anchor;
I’m very sure, I’m very sure,
My anchor holds, and grips the Solid Rock!
interlude1: This Rock is Jesus, Yes He’s the One,
This Rock is Jesus, the only One;
Be very sure, be very sure,
Your anchor holds, and grips the Solid Rock
interlude2: This Rock is Jesus, Yes He’s the One,
This Rock is Jesus, the only One;
Be very sure, be very sure,
Your anchor holds, and grips the Solid Rock
interlude3: This Rock is Jesus, Yes He’s the One,
This Rock is Jesus, the only One;
I’m very sure, I’m very sure,
My anchor holds, and grips the Solid Rock

generalIndex.title: GHS 77
generalIndex.subtitle: I HAVE DECIDED TO FOLLOW JESUS
stanza1: I have decided to follow Jesus,
I have decided to follow Jesus,
I have decided to follow Jesus -
No turning back, (No turning back)
No turning back!
stanza2: Tho’ no one joins me, still I will follow,
Tho’ no one joins me, still I will follow,
Tho’ no one joins me, still I will follow,
No turning back, (No turning back)
No turning back!
stanza3: The world behind me, the cross before me,
The world behind me, the cross before me,
The world behind me, the cross before me,
No turning back, (No turning back)
No turning back!

generalIndex.title: GHS 78
generalIndex.subtitle: FAITH OF OUR FATHERS
stanza1: Faith of our fathers! living still
In spite of dungeon, fire and sword,
O how our hearts beat high with joy
Whene’er we hear that glorious word!
Faith of our fathers, holy faith!
We will be true to Thee till death.
stanza2: Faith of our fathers! we will strive
To win all nations unto Thee,
And through the truth that comes from God
Mankind shall then be truly free;
Faith of our fathers, holy faith!
We will be true to Thee till death.
stanza3: Faith of our fathers! we will love
Both friend and foe in all our strife,
And preach Thee, too, as love knows how
By kindly words and virtuous life;
Faith of our fathers, holy faith!
We will be true to Thee till death.

generalIndex.title: GHS 79
generalIndex.subtitle: THE WAY OF THE CROSS LEADS HOME
stanza1: I must needs go home by the way of the cross,
There’s no other way but this;
I shall ne’er get sight of the Gates of Light
If the way of the cross I miss.
stanza2: I must needs go on in the blood-sprinkled way,
The path that the Saviour trod;
If I ever climb to the heights sublime,
Where the soul is at home with God.
stanza3: Then I bid farewell to the way of the world,
To walk in it never more;
For my Lord says “Come”, and I seek my home,
Where He waits at the open door.
chorus1: The way of the cross leads home, leads home,
The way of the cross leads home, leads home;
It is sweet to know, as I onward go,
The way of the cross leads home.
chorus2: The way of the cross leads home, leads home,
The way of the cross leads home, leads home;
It is sweet to know, as I onward go,
The way of the cross leads home.
chorus3: The way of the cross leads home, leads home,
The way of the cross leads home, leads home;
It is sweet to know, as I onward go,
The way of the cross leads home.

generalIndex.title: GHS 80
generalIndex.subtitle: AT THE CROSS
stanza1: Alas, and did my Saviour bleed?
And did my Sovereign die?
Would He devote that sacred head
For such a worm as I?
stanza2: Was it for crimes that I have done,
He groaned upon the tree?
Amazing pity! grace unknown!
And love beyond degree!
stanza3: Well might the sun in darkness hide,
And shut his glories in,
When Christ, the mighty Maker, died
For man the creature’s sin.
stanza4: But drops of grief can ne’er repay
The debt of love I owe:
Here, Lord, I gave myself away,
’Tis all that I can do!
chorus1: At the cross, at the cross where I first saw the light,
And the burden of my heart rolled away (rolled away),
It was there by faith I received my sight,
And now I am happy all the day!
chorus2: At the cross, at the cross where I first saw the light,
And the burden of my heart rolled away (rolled away),
It was there by faith I received my sight,
And now I am happy all the day!
chorus3: At the cross, at the cross where I first saw the light,
And the burden of my heart rolled away (rolled away),
It was there by faith I received my sight,
And now I am happy all the day!
chorus4: At the cross, at the cross where I first saw the light,
And the burden of my heart rolled away (rolled away),
It was there by faith I received my sight,
And now I am happy all the day!

generalIndex.title: GHS 81
generalIndex.subtitle: LEAD ME TO CALVARY
stanza1: King of my life, I crown Thee now,
Thine shall the glory be;
Lest I forget Thy thorn-crowned brow,
Lead me to Calvary.
stanza2: Show me the tomb where Thou wast laid,
Tenderly mourned and wept;
Angels in robes of light arrayed
Guarded Thee whilst Thou slept.
stanza3: Let me like Mary, thro’ the gloom,
Come with a gift to Thee;
Show to me now the empty tomb,
Lead me to Calvary.
stanza4: May I be willing, Lord, to bear
Daily my cross for Thee;
Even Thy cup of grief to share,
Thou hast borne all for me.
chorus1: Lest I forget Gethsemane;
Lest I forget Thine agony;
Lest I forget Thy love for me,
Lead me to Calvary.
chorus2: Lest I forget Gethsemane;
Lest I forget Thine agony;
Lest I forget Thy love for me,
Lead me to Calvary.
chorus3: Lest I forget Gethsemane;
Lest I forget Thine agony;
Lest I forget Thy love for me,
Lead me to Calvary.
chorus4: Lest I forget Gethsemane;
Lest I forget Thine agony;
Lest I forget Thy love for me,
Lead me to Calvary.

generalIndex.title: GHS 82
generalIndex.subtitle: WHEN I SURVEY THE WONDROUS CROSS
stanza1: When I survey the wondrous cross
On which the Prince of glory died,
My richest gain I count but loss,
And pour contempt on all my pride.
stanza2: Forbid it, Lord, that I should boast,
Save in the death of Christ my God:
All the vain things that charm me most,
I sacrifice them to His blood.
stanza3: See, from His head, His hands, His feet,
Sorrow and love flow mingled down;
Did e’er such love and sorrow meet,
Or thorns compose so rich a crown?
stanza4: Were the whole realm of nature mine,
That were an offering far too small;
Love so amazing, so divine,
Demands my soul, my life, my all.

generalIndex.title: GHS 83
generalIndex.subtitle: THY WORD HAVE I HID IN MY HEART
stanza1: Thy Word is a lamp to my feet,
A light to my path alway;
To guide and to save me from sin,
And show me the heavenly way.
stanza2: Forever, O Lord, is Thy word
Established and fixed on high;
Thy faithfulness unto all men
Abideth forever nigh.
stanza3: At morning, at noon and at night
I ever will give Thee praise;
For Thou art my portion,O Lord,
And shall be through all my days!
stanza4: Thro’ Him whom Thy Word hath foretold,
The Saviour and Morning Star,
Salvation and peace have been bro’t
To those who have strayed afar.
chorus1: Thy word have I hid in my heart,...
That I might not sin against Thee,...
That I might not sin, that I might not sin
Thy word have I hid in my heart.
chorus2: Thy word have I hid in my heart,...
That I might not sin against Thee,...
That I might not sin, that I might not sin
Thy word have I hid in my heart.
chorus3: Thy word have I hid in my heart,...
That I might not sin against Thee,...
That I might not sin, that I might not sin
Thy word have I hid in my heart.
chorus4: Thy word have I hid in my heart,...
That I might not sin against Thee,...
That I might not sin, that I might not sin
Thy word have I hid in my heart.

generalIndex.title: GHS 84
generalIndex.subtitle: DEEPER, DEEPER IN THE LOVE OF JESUS
stanza1: Deeper, deeper, in the love of Jesus,
Daily let me go;
Higher, higher in the school of wisdom,
More of grace to know.
stanza2: Deeper, deeper! blessed Holy Spirit,
Take me deeper still,
Till my life is wholly lost in Jesus
And His perfect will.
stanza3: Deeper, deeper! though it cost hard trials,
Deeper let me go!
Rooted in the holy love of Jesus,
Let me fruitful grow.
stanza4: Deeper, higher every day in Jesus,
Till all conflict past,
Finds me conqu’ror, and in His own image
Perfected at last .
chorus1: O deep --- er yet I pray,---
And high---er every day---
And wis---er, blessed Lord,
In Thy precious, holy word.
chorus2: O deep --- er yet I pray,---
And high---er every day---
And wis---er, blessed Lord,
In Thy precious, holy word.
chorus3: O deep --- er yet I pray,---
And high---er every day---
And wis---er, blessed Lord,
In Thy precious, holy word.
chorus4: O deep --- er yet I pray,---
And high---er every day---
And wis---er, blessed Lord,
In Thy precious, holy word.

generalIndex.title: GHS 85
generalIndex.subtitle: GIVE OF YOUR BEST TO THE MASTER
stanza1: Give of your best to the Master;
Give of the strength of your youth;
Throw your soul’s fresh, glowing ardor
Into the battle for truth .
Jesus has set the example;
Dauntless was He, young and brave;
Give Him your loyal devotion,
Give Him the best that you have.
stanza2: Give of your best to the Master;
Give Him first place in your heart;
Give Him first place in your service,
Consecrate ev’ry part.
Give, and to you shall be given
God His beloved Son gave;
Gratefully seeking to serve Him,
Give Him the best that you have.
stanza3: Give of your best to the Master;
Naught else is worthy His love;
He gave Himself for your ransom,
Gave up His glory above:
Laid down His life without murmur,
You from sin’s ruin to save;
Give Him your heart’s adoration,
Give Him the best that you have.
chorus1: Give of your best to the Master;
Give of the strength of your youth;
Clad in salvation’s full armour,
Join in the battle for truth.
chorus2: Give of your best to the Master;
Give of the strength of your youth;
Clad in salvation’s full armour,
Join in the battle for truth.
chorus3: Give of your best to the Master;
Give of the strength of your youth;
Clad in salvation’s full armour,
Join in the battle for truth.

generalIndex.title: GHS 86
generalIndex.subtitle: NOTHING BETWEEN
stanza1: Nothing between, Lord, nothing between;
Let me Thy glory see,
Draw my soul close to Thee;
Then speak in love to me -
Nothing between, Nothing between.
stanza2: Nothing between, Lord, nothing between;
Let not earth’s din and noise
Stifle Thy still small voice;
In it let me rejoice -
Nothing between, Nothing between.
stanza3: Nothing between, Lord, nothing between;
Nothing of earthly care,
Nothing of tear or prayer,
No robe that self may wear -
Nothing between, Nothing between.
stanza4: Nothing between, Lord, nothing between;
Unbelief disappear,
Vanish each doubt and fear,
Fading when Thou art near -
Nothing between, Nothing between.
stanza5: Nothing between, Lord, nothing between;
Till Thine eternal light,
Rising on earth’s dark night,
Bursts on my open sight -
Nothing between, Nothing between.

generalIndex.title: GHS 87
generalIndex.subtitle: TAKE MY LIFE
stanza1: Take my life, and let it be
Consecrated, Lord, to Thee;
Take my moments and my days,
Let them flow in ceaseless praise.
stanza2: Take my hands, and let them move
At the impulse of Thy love;
Take my feet, and let them be
Swift and beautiful for Thee.
stanza3: Take my voice and let me sing
Always, only, for my King;
Take my lips and let them be
Filled with messages from Thee.
stanza4: Take my silver and my gold;
Not a mite would I withhold;
Take my intellect, and use
Every power as Thou shalt choose.
stanza5: Take my will and make it Thine,
It shall be no longer mine;
Take my heart, it is Thine own;
It shall be Thy royal throne.
stanza6: Take my love; my Lord, I pour
Take myself, and I will be

generalIndex.title: GHS 88
generalIndex.subtitle: WHEREVER HE LEADS I’LL GO
stanza1: “Take up thy cross and follow me,’’
I heard my Master say;
‘‘I gave My life to ransom thee
Surrender your all today.”
stanza2: He drew me closer to His side,
I sought His will to know,
And in that will I now abide,
Wherever He leads I’ll go.
stanza3: It may be thro’ the shadows dim,
Or o’er the stormy sea,
I take my cross and follow Him,
Wherever He leadeth me.
stanza4: My heart, my life, my all I bring
To Christ who loves me so;
He is my Master, Lord, and King,
Wherever He leads I’ll go.
chorus1: Wherever He leads I’ll go,
Wherever He leads I’ll go,
I’ll follow my Christ who loves me so,
Wherever He leads I’ll go.
chorus2: Wherever He leads I’ll go,
Wherever He leads I’ll go,
I’ll follow my Christ who loves me so,
Wherever He leads I’ll go.
chorus3: Wherever He leads I’ll go,
Wherever He leads I’ll go,
I’ll follow my Christ who loves me so,
Wherever He leads I’ll go.
chorus4: Wherever He leads I’ll go,
Wherever He leads I’ll go,
I’ll follow my Christ who loves me so,
Wherever He leads I’ll go.

generalIndex.title: GHS 89
generalIndex.subtitle: O JESUS, I HAVE PROMISED
stanza1: O Jesus, I have promised
To serve Thee to the end;
Be Thou for ever near me,
My Master and my Friend:
I shall not fear the battle
If Thou art by my side,
Nor wander from the pathway
If Thou wilt be my Guide.
stanza2: O let me feel Thee near me;
The world is ever near;
I see the sights that dazzle,
The tempting sounds I hear;
My foes are ever near me,
Around me and within;
But, Jesus, draw Thou nearer,
And shield my soul from sin.
stanza3: O let me hear Thee speaking
In accents clear and still,
Above the storms of passion,
The murmurs of self-will;
O speak to reassure me,
To hasten or control;
O speak and make me listen,
Thou Guardian of my soul.
stanza4: O Jesus, Thou hast promised
To all who follow Thee,
That where Thou art in glory
There shall Thy servant be;
And, Jesus, I have promised
To serve Thee to the end;
O give me grace to follow
My Master and my Friend.

generalIndex.title: GHS 90
generalIndex.subtitle: O LOVE THAT WILT NOT LET ME GO
stanza1: O Love that wilt not me go,
I rest my weary soul in Thee:
I give Thee back the life I owe,
That in Thine ocean depths its flow
May richer, fuller be.
stanza2: O Light that follow’st all my way,
I yield my flick’ring torch to Thee:
My heart restores its borrow’d ray,
That in Thy sunshine’s blaze its day
May brighter, fairer be.
stanza3: O Joy that seekest me through pain,
I cannot close my heart to Thee:
I trace the rainbow through the rain,
And feel the promise is not vain,
That morn shall tearless be.
stanza4: O Cross that liftest up my head,
I dare not ask to fly from Thee;
I lay in dust life’s glory dead,
And from the ground there blossoms red
Life that shall endless be.

generalIndex.title: GHS 91
generalIndex.subtitle: WHERE HE LEADS ME
stanza1: I can hear my Saviour calling,
I can hear my Saviour calling,
I can hear my Saviour calling,
“Take thy cross and follow, follow Me.”
stanza2: I’ll go with Him through the garden,
I’ll go with Him through the garden,
I’ll go with Him through the garden,
I’ll go with Him, with Him all the way.
stanza3: I’ll go with Him through the Judgment,
I’ll go with Him through the Judgment,
I’ll go with Him through the Judgment,
I’ll go with Him, with Him all the way.
stanza4: He will give me grace and glory,
He will give me grace and glory,
He will give me grace and glory,
And go with me, with me all the way.
chorus1: Where He leads me I will follow,
Where He leads me I will follow,
Where He leads me I will follow,
I’ll go with Him, with Him all the way.
chorus2: Where He leads me I will follow,
Where He leads me I will follow,
Where He leads me I will follow,
I’ll go with Him, with Him all the way.
chorus3: Where He leads me I will follow,
Where He leads me I will follow,
Where He leads me I will follow,
I’ll go with Him, with Him all the way.
chorus4: Where He leads me I will follow,
Where He leads me I will follow,
Where He leads me I will follow,
I’ll go with Him, with Him all the way.

generalIndex.title: GHS 92
generalIndex.subtitle: I SURRENDER ALL
stanza1: All to Jesus I surrender,
All to Him I freely give;
I will ever love and trust Him,
In His presence daily live.
stanza2: All to Jesus I surrender,
Humbly at His feet I bow;
Worldly pleasures all forsaken,
Take me, Jesus, Take me now.
stanza3: All to Jesus I surrender,
Lord, I give myself to Thee;
Fill me with Thy love and power,
Let Thy blessing fall on me.
stanza4: All to Jesus I surrender,
Now I feel the sacred flame;
O the joy of full salvation!
Glory, glory to His Name!
chorus1: I surrender all, I surrender all;
All to Thee, my blessed Saviour,
I surrender all.
chorus2: I surrender all, I surrender all;
All to Thee, my blessed Saviour,
I surrender all.
chorus3: I surrender all, I surrender all;
All to Thee, my blessed Saviour,
I surrender all.
chorus4: I surrender all, I surrender all;
All to Thee, my blessed Saviour,
I surrender all.

generalIndex.title: GHS 93
generalIndex.subtitle: MORE LOVE TO THEE
stanza1: More love to Thee, O Christ,
More love to Thee!
Hear Thou the prayer I make
On bended knee;
This is my earnest plea:
More love, O Christ, to Thee,
More love to Thee,
More love to Thee!
stanza2: Once earthly joy I craved,
Sought peace and rest;
Now Thee alone I seek,
Give what is best;
This all my prayer shall be;
More love, O Christ, to Thee,
More love to Thee,
More love to Thee!
stanza3: Then shall my latest breath
Whisper Thy praise;
This be the parting cry
My heart shall raise;
This still its prayer shall be:
More love, O Christ, to Thee,
More love to Thee,
More love to Thee!

generalIndex.title: GHS 94
generalIndex.subtitle: DRAW ME NEARER, BLESSED LORD
stanza1: I am Thine, O Lord, I have heard Thy voice,
And it told Thy love to me;
But I long to rise in the arms of faith,
And be closer drawn to Thee.
stanza2: Consecrate me now to Thy service, Lord,
By the pow’r of grace divine;
Let my soul look up with a steadfast hope,
And my will be lost in Thine.
stanza3: Oh, the pure delight of a single hour,
That before Thy throne I spend,
When I kneel in prayer, and with Thee my God,
I commune as friend with friend!
stanza4: There are depths of love that I cannot know
Till I cross the narrow sea;
There are heights of joy that I may not reach
Till I rest in peace with Thee.
chorus1: Draw me nearer, nearer blessed Lord,
To the cross where Thou hast died;
Draw me nearer, nearer, nearer, blessed Lord,
To Thy precious, bleeding side.
chorus2: Draw me nearer, nearer blessed Lord,
To the cross where Thou hast died;
Draw me nearer, nearer, nearer, blessed Lord,
To Thy precious, bleeding side.
chorus3: Draw me nearer, nearer blessed Lord,
To the cross where Thou hast died;
Draw me nearer, nearer, nearer, blessed Lord,
To Thy precious, bleeding side.
chorus4: Draw me nearer, nearer blessed Lord,
To the cross where Thou hast died;
Draw me nearer, nearer, nearer, blessed Lord,
To Thy precious, bleeding side.

generalIndex.title: GHS 95
generalIndex.subtitle: COME, SAVIOUR JESUS FROM ABOVE
stanza1: Come, Saviour, Jesus, from above!
Assist me with Thy heavenly grace;
Empty my heart of earthly love,
And for Thyself prepare the place.
stanza2: O let Thy sacred presence fill,
And set my longing spirit free!
Which pants to have no other will,
But day and night to feast on Thee.
stanza3: While in this region here below,
No other good will I pursue;
I’ll bid this world of noise and show,
With all its glittering snares, adieu!
stanza4: That path with humble speed I’ll seek,
In which my Saviour’s footsteps shine;
Nor will I hear, nor will I speak,
Of any other love but Thine.
stanza5: Henceforth may no profane delight
Divide this consecrated soul;
Possess it Thou, who hast the right
As Lord and Master of the whole.
stanza6: Wealth, honour, pleasure, and what else,
Tempt as ye will, my soul repels,
To Christ alone resolved to live.
stanza7: Thee I can love, and Thee alone,
With pure delight and inward bliss:
To know Thou tak’st me for Thine own,
O what a happiness is this!
stanza8: Nothing on earth do I desire
But Thy pure love within my breast:
This, only this, will I require,
And freely give up all the rest.

generalIndex.title: GHS 210
generalIndex.subtitle: OPEN MY EYES THAT I MAY SEE
stanza1: Open my eyes, that I may see
Glimpses of truth Thou hast for me;
Place in my hands the wonderful key
That shall unclasp and set me free,
Silently now I wait for Thee,
Ready, my God, Thy will to see;
Open my eyes, illumine me,
Spirit Divine!
stanza2: Open my ears, that I may hear
Voices of truth Thou sendest clear;
And while the wave-notes fall on my ear,
Everything false will disappear.
Silently now I wait for Thee,
Ready, my God, Thy will to see;
Open my ears, illumine me,
Spirit Divine!
stanza3: Open my mouth, and let me bear
Gladly the warm truth everywhere,
Open my heart and let me prepare,
Love with Thy children thus to share,
Silently now I wait for Thee,
Ready, my God, Thy will to see;
Open my heart, illumine me,
Spirit Divine!
stanza4: Open my mind, that I may read
More of Thy love in word and deed;
What shall I fear while yet Thou dost lead?
Only for light from Thee I plead,
Silently now I wait for Thee,
Ready, my God, Thy will to see;
Open my mind, illumine me,
Spirit Divine!
stanza5: Open my way, that I may bring
Trophies of grace to Thee, my King;
Echoed in love Thy word shall out ring
Sweet as the note that angels sing,
Silently now I wait for Thee,
Ready, my God, Thy will to see;
Open my way, illumine me,
Spirit Divine!

generalIndex.title: GHS 216
generalIndex.subtitle: MORE ABOUT JESUS WOULD I KNOW
stanza1: More about Jesus would I know,
More of His grace to others show;
More of His saving fulness see,
More of His love who died for me.
stanza2: More about Jesus let me learn,
More of His holy will discern;
Spirit of God, my Teacher be,
Showing the things of Christ to me.
stanza3: More about Jesus, in His Word,
Holding communion with my Lord;
Hearing His voice in every line,
Making each faithful saying mine.
stanza4: More about Jesus, on His throne,
Riches in glory all His own:
More of His kingdom’s sure increase;
More of His coming, Prince of Peace.
chorus1: More, more about Jesus,
More, more about Jesus:
More of His saving fulness see,
More of His love who died for me.
chorus2: More, more about Jesus,
More, more about Jesus:
More of His saving fulness see,
More of His love who died for me.
chorus3: More, more about Jesus,
More, more about Jesus:
More of His saving fulness see,
More of His love who died for me.
chorus4: More, more about Jesus,
More, more about Jesus:
More of His saving fulness see,
More of His love who died for me.

generalIndex.title: GHS 226
generalIndex.subtitle: THY BLESSED WILL DIVINE
stanza1: I want my life to be all filled with praise to Thee,
My precious Lord divine who died for me,
Let all my will be Thine, controlled by love divine,
Live out in me Thy life, O mighty Saviour.
stanza2: A pilgrim born anew, a stranger going through,
Not of this world am I, since I am Thine.
Weaned from its passing show, transformed Thy love to know,
Hold Thou my hand in Thine, O mighty Saviour.
stanza3: When evil foes assail and almost would prevail,
In that dark hour be Thou my strength and shield.
Lend then Thy strong embrace, uphold me by Thy grace,
In weakness be my strength, O mighty Saviour.
stanza4: Yea, choose the path for me, although I may not see
The reason Thou dost will to lead me so.
I know the toilsome way will lead to realms of day.
Where I shall dwell with Thee, O mighty Saviour.
chorus1: Thy blessed will divine, with joy I make it mine
My heart shall be Thy throne, and Thine alone,
Choose Thou the path I tread and whither I am led,
Help me to follow on, O mighty Saviour.
chorus2: Thy blessed will divine, with joy I make it mine
My heart shall be Thy throne, and Thine alone,
Choose Thou the path I tread and whither I am led,
Help me to follow on, O mighty Saviour.
chorus3: Thy blessed will divine, with joy I make it mine
My heart shall be Thy throne, and Thine alone,
Choose Thou the path I tread and whither I am led,
Help me to follow on, O mighty Saviour.
chorus4: Thy blessed will divine, with joy I make it mine
My heart shall be Thy throne, and Thine alone,
Choose Thou the path I tread and whither I am led,
Help me to follow on, O mighty Saviour.

generalIndex.title: GHS 227
generalIndex.subtitle: NEARER, MY GOD TO THEE
stanza1: Nearer, my God, to Thee, nearer to Thee!
E’en though it be a cross that raiseth me;
Still all my song shall be,
Nearer, my God, to Thee, nearer to Thee!
stanza2: Though like the wanderer, the sun gone down,
Darkness be over me, my rest a stone,
Yet in my dreams I’d be
Nearer, my God, to Thee, nearer to Thee!
stanza3: There let the way appear, steps unto heaven;
All that Thou sendest me, in mercy giv’n:
Angels to beckon me
Nearer, my God, to Thee, nearer to Thee!
stanza4: Then with my waking thoughts, bright with Thy praise,
Out of my stony griefs, Bethel I’ll raise;
So by my woes to be
Nearer, my God, to Thee, nearer to Thee!
stanza5: Or if on joyful wing, cleaving the sky,
Sun, moon, and stars forgot, upward I fly,
Still all my song shall be,
Nearer, my God, to Thee, nearer to Thee!

generalIndex.title: GHS 253
generalIndex.subtitle: MY PORTION FOREVER
stanza1: All, all to Jesus, I consecrate anew;
He is my portion forever,
Only His glory henceforth will I pursue:
He is my portion forever.
stanza2: All, all to Jesus, my trusting heart can say:
He is my portion forever.
Led by His mercy, I’m walking ev’ry day:
He is my portion forever.
stanza3: Though He may try me, this blessed truth I know:
He is my portion forever,
He will not leave me, His promise tells me so;
He is my portion forever.
stanza4: All, all to Jesus, I cheerfully resign:
He is my portion forever;
I have the witness that He, my Lord, is mine;
He is my portion forever.
chorus1: Take, take the world, with all its gilded toys,
Take, take the world, I covet not its joys,
Mine is a wealth no moth nor rust destroys;
He is my portion forever.
chorus2: Take, take the world, with all its gilded toys,
Take, take the world, I covet not its joys,
Mine is a wealth no moth nor rust destroys;
He is my portion forever.
chorus3: Take, take the world, with all its gilded toys,
Take, take the world, I covet not its joys,
Mine is a wealth no moth nor rust destroys;
He is my portion forever.
chorus4: Take, take the world, with all its gilded toys,
Take, take the world, I covet not its joys,
Mine is a wealth no moth nor rust destroys;
He is my portion forever.

generalIndex.title: GHS 96
generalIndex.subtitle: PEACE! BE STILL
stanza1: Master, the tempest is raging!
The billows are tossing high!
The sky is o’er-shadowed with blackness,
No shelter or help is nigh:
“Carest Thou not that we perish?”
How canst Thou lie asleep,
When each moment so madly is threatening
A grave in the angry deep?
stanza2: Master, with anguish of spirit
I bow in my grief today;
The depths of my sad heart are troubled;
O waken and save, I pray!
Torrents of sin and of anguish
Sweep o’er my sinking soul !
And I perish! I perish, dear Master;
O hasten, and take control !
stanza3: Master, the terror is over,
The elements sweetly rest;
Earth’s sun in the calm lake is mirrored,
And heaven’s within my breast.
Linger, O blessed Redeemer,
Leave me alone no more;
And with joy I shall make the blest harbour,
And rest on the blissful shore.
chorus1: “The winds and the waves shall obey My will,
Peace, be still!”
Whether the wrath of the storm-tossed sea,
Or demons, or men, or whatever it be,
No water can swallow the ship where lies
The Master of ocean and earth and skies;
They all shall sweetly obey My will;
Peace be still! peace, be still !
They all shall sweetly obey My will:
Peace, Peace, be still !
chorus2: “The winds and the waves shall obey My will,
Peace, be still!”
Whether the wrath of the storm-tossed sea,
Or demons, or men, or whatever it be,
No water can swallow the ship where lies
The Master of ocean and earth and skies;
They all shall sweetly obey My will;
Peace be still! peace, be still !
They all shall sweetly obey My will:
Peace, Peace, be still !
chorus3: “The winds and the waves shall obey My will,
Peace, be still!”
Whether the wrath of the storm-tossed sea,
Or demons, or men, or whatever it be,
No water can swallow the ship where lies
The Master of ocean and earth and skies;
They all shall sweetly obey My will;
Peace be still! peace, be still !
They all shall sweetly obey My will:
Peace, Peace, be still !

generalIndex.title: GHS 97
generalIndex.subtitle: OFT IN DANGER, OFT IN WOE
stanza1: Oft in danger, oft in woe,
Onward, Christians, onward go;
Fight the fight, maintain the strife,
Strengthened with the Bread of Life.
stanza2: Shrink not, Christians: will ye yield?
Will ye quit the painful field?
Will ye flee in danger’s hour?
Know ye not your Captain’s power?
stanza3: Let your drooping hearts be glad;
March in heavenly armour clad:
Fight, nor think the battle long;
Soon shall victory tune your song.
stanza4: Let not sorrow dim your eye,
Soon shall every tear be dry;
Let not fears your course impede,
Great your strength if great your need.
stanza5: Onward then to glory move,
More than conquerors ye shall prove;
Though opposed by many a foe,
Christian soldiers, onward go.

generalIndex.title: GHS 98
generalIndex.subtitle: THE SONG OF THE SOLDIER
stanza1: Rise, ye children of salvation,
All who cleave to Christ the Head;
Wake, arise! O mighty nation,
Ere the foe on Zion tread.
stanza2: Saints and heroes long before us
Firmly on this ground have stood;
See their banners waving o’er us
Conquerors through Jesus’ blood.
stanza3: Deathless we are all unfearing,
Life laid up with Christ in God;
In the morn of His appearing
Floweth forth a glory flood.
stanza4: Soon we all shall stand before Him,
See and know our glorious Lord;
Soon in joy and light adore Him,
Each receiving his reward.
chorus1: Pour it forth ... a mighty anthem,
Like the thun ... ders of the sea; ...
Thro’ the blood of Christ our ransom,
More than conquerors are we,...
More than con...querors are we,...
More than con...querors are we,...
Thro’ the blood of Christ our ransom,
More than conquerors are we.
chorus2: Pour it forth ... a mighty anthem,
Like the thun ... ders of the sea; ...
Thro’ the blood of Christ our ransom,
More than conquerors are we,...
More than con...querors are we,...
More than con...querors are we,...
Thro’ the blood of Christ our ransom,
More than conquerors are we.
chorus3: Pour it forth ... a mighty anthem,
Like the thun ... ders of the sea; ...
Thro’ the blood of Christ our ransom,
More than conquerors are we,...
More than con...querors are we,...
More than con...querors are we,...
Thro’ the blood of Christ our ransom,
More than conquerors are we.
chorus4: Pour it forth ... a mighty anthem,
Like the thun ... ders of the sea; ...
Thro’ the blood of Christ our ransom,
More than conquerors are we,...
More than con...querors are we,...
More than con...querors are we,...
Thro’ the blood of Christ our ransom,
More than conquerors are we.

generalIndex.title: GHS 99
generalIndex.subtitle: THERE IS VICTORY WITHIN MY SOUL
stanza1: There is vict’ry within my soul
For the Spirit with me abides,
Let the waves of temptation roll,
Jesus keeps me whate’er betides.
stanza2: Tho’ the conflict be fierce and long,
Tho’ the tempter my heart assail,
In my weakness yet I am strong,
For with Jesus I’ll e’er prevail.
stanza3: I have victory over sin,
I have victory o’er grave;
Even death now has lost its sting,
Halleluyah I know I’m saved.
chorus1: Victory, Victory, Vict’ry in my soul,
I have glorious victory
Since Jesus took control,
Victory, Victory, sweeping like a flood,
I have glorious victory thro’ Jesus’ blood.
chorus2: Victory, Victory, Vict’ry in my soul,
I have glorious victory
Since Jesus took control,
Victory, Victory, sweeping like a flood,
I have glorious victory thro’ Jesus’ blood.
chorus3: Victory, Victory, Vict’ry in my soul,
I have glorious victory
Since Jesus took control,
Victory, Victory, sweeping like a flood,
I have glorious victory thro’ Jesus’ blood.

generalIndex.title: GHS 100
generalIndex.subtitle: CHRIST, OUR MIGHTY CAPTAIN
stanza1: Christ, our mighty Captain, leads against the foe;
We will never falter when He bids us go;
Tho’ His righteous purpose we may never know,
Yet we’ll follow all the way.
stanza2: Satan’s fearful onslaughts cannot make us yield,
While we trust in Christ, our Buckler and our Shield;
Pressing ever on - the Spirit’s sword we wield,
And we follow all the way.
stanza3: Let our glorious banner ever be unfurled-
From its mighty stronghold evil shall be hurled;
Christ, our mighty Captain, overcomes the world,
And we follow all the way.
stanza4: Fierce the battle rages, but ‘twill not be long,
Then triumphant - shall we join the blessed throng,
Joyfully uniting in the victor’s song-
If we follow all the way.
chorus1: Forward! forward! ’tis the Lord’s command,
Forward! forward! to the promised land;
Forward! forward! let the chorus1 ring:
We are sure to win with Christ our King!
chorus2: Forward! forward! ’tis the Lord’s command,
Forward! forward! to the promised land;
Forward! forward! let the chorus1 ring:
We are sure to win with Christ our King!
chorus3: Forward! forward! ’tis the Lord’s command,
Forward! forward! to the promised land;
Forward! forward! let the chorus1 ring:
We are sure to win with Christ our King!
chorus4: Forward! forward! ’tis the Lord’s command,
Forward! forward! to the promised land;
Forward! forward! let the chorus1 ring:
We are sure to win with Christ our King!

generalIndex.title: GHS 101
generalIndex.subtitle: MY FATHER KNOWS
stanza1: He knows the bitter, weary way,
The endless striving day by day,
The souls that weep, the souls that pray;
My Father knows, my Father knows.
stanza2: He knows when faint and worn we sink,
How deep the pain, how near the brink
Of dark despair we pause and shrink;
My Father knows, my Father knows
stanza3: He knows how hard the fight has been,
The clouds that come our lives between,
The wounds the world has never seen;
My Father knows, my Father knows.
stanza4: He knows! O heart, take up thy cross,
And know earth’s treasures are but dross,
And all will prove as gain, not loss;
My Father knows, my Father knows.

generalIndex.title: GHS 229
generalIndex.subtitle: HOLD THE FORT
stanza1: Ho, my comrades! see the signal
Waving in the sky!
Reinforcements now appearing,
Victory is nigh.
stanza2: See the mighty host advancing,
Satan leading on:
Mighty men around us falling,
Courage almost gone!
stanza3: See the glorious banner waving!
Hear the trumpet blow!
In our Leader’s name we’ll triumph
Over every foe!
stanza4: Fierce and long the battle rages,
But our help is near:
Onward comes our great Commander,
Cheer, my comrades, cheer!
chorus1: “Hold the fort, for I am coming,”
Jesus signals still;
Wave the answer back to heaven ,
“By Thy grace we will.”
chorus2: “Hold the fort, for I am coming,”
Jesus signals still;
Wave the answer back to heaven ,
“By Thy grace we will.”
chorus3: “Hold the fort, for I am coming,”
Jesus signals still;
Wave the answer back to heaven ,
“By Thy grace we will.”
chorus4: “Hold the fort, for I am coming,”
Jesus signals still;
Wave the answer back to heaven ,
“By Thy grace we will.”

generalIndex.title: GHS 233
generalIndex.subtitle: STAND UP, STAND UP FOR JESUS
stanza1: Stand up! stand up for Jesus!
Ye soldiers of the cross;
Lift high His royal banner,
It must not suffer loss:
From vict’ry unto vict’ry
His army shall He lead,
Till every foe is vanquished
And Christ is Lord indeed.
stanza2: Stand up! stand up for Jesus!
The trumpet call obey;
Forth to the mighty conflict,
In this His glorious day:
Ye that are men now serve Him
Against unnumbered foes;
Let courage rise with danger,
And strength to strength oppose.
stanza3: Stand up! stand up for Jesus!
Stand in His strength alone;
The arm of flesh will fail you,
Ye dare not trust your own:
Put on the gospel armour,
And watching unto prayer;
Where duty calls, or danger,
Be never wanting there.
stanza4: Stand up! stand up for Jesus!
The strife will not be long;
This day the noise of battle,
The next the victor’s song:
To him that overcometh,
A crown of life shall be;
He with the King of glory
Shall reign eternally.

generalIndex.title: GHS 237
generalIndex.subtitle: PEACE! PERFECT PEACE!
stanza1: Peace, perfect peace, in this dark world of sin?
The blood of Jesus whispers peace within.
stanza2: Peace, perfect peace, by thronging duties pressed?
To do the will of Jesus, this is rest.
stanza3: Peace, perfect peace, with sorrows surging round?
On Jesus’ bosom naught but calm is found.
stanza4: Peace, perfect peace, with loved ones far away?
In Jesus’ keeping we are safe and they.
stanza5: Peace, perfect peace, our future all unknown?
Jesus we know, and He is on the throne.
stanza6: Peace, perfect peace, death shadowing us and ours?
Jesus has vanquished death and all its powers.
stanza7: It is enough; earth’s struggles soon shall cease,
And Jesus call to heaven’s perfect peace.

generalIndex.title: GHS 246
generalIndex.subtitle: O BROTHER, LIFE’S JOURNEY BEGINNING
stanza1: O brother, life’s journey beginning,
With courage and firmness arise!
Look well to the course thou art choosing;
Be earnest, be watchful, and wise!
Remember-two paths are before thee,
And both thy attention invite;
But one leadeth on to destruction,
The other to joy and delight.
stanza2: O brother, yield not to the tempter,
No matter what others may do;
Stand firm in the strength of the Master,
Be loyal, be faithful, and true!
Each trial will make you the stronger,
If you, in the name of the Lord,
Fight manfully under your Leader
Obeying the voice of His word.
stanza3: O brother, the Saviour is calling!
Beware of the danger of sin;
Resist not the voice of the Spirit,
That whispers so gently within.
God calls you to enter His service -
To live for Him here, day by day;
And share by and by in the glory
That never shall vanish away.
chorus1: God help you to follow His banner,
And serve Him wherever you go;
And when you are tempted, my brother,
God give you the grace to say “No!”
chorus2: God help you to follow His banner,
And serve Him wherever you go;
And when you are tempted, my brother,
God give you the grace to say “No!”
chorus3: God help you to follow His banner,
And serve Him wherever you go;
And when you are tempted, my brother,
God give you the grace to say “No!”

generalIndex.title: GHS 248
generalIndex.subtitle: THE MERCY SEAT
stanza1: From ev’ry stormy wind that blows
From ev’ry swell-ing tide of woes;
There is a calm, a sure retreat;
‘Tis found beneath the mercy seat.
stanza2: There is a place where Jesus sheds
The oil of gladness on our heads;
A place than all beside more sweet;
It is the blood-stained mercy seat.
stanza3: There is a scene where spirits blend
And friend holds fellowship with friend,
Though sundered far, by faith we meet;
Around one common mercy seat.
stanza4: There, there on eagle wing we soar
And time and sense seem all no more;
And heaven comes down our souls to greet;
And glory crowns the mercy seat.

generalIndex.title: GHS 102
generalIndex.subtitle: THE HEALER
stanza1: On the Cross crucified,
In great sorrow He died;
The Giver of life was He -
Yet my Lord was despised and rejected of men,
This Jesus of Calvary.
stanza2: Price for healing was paid,
As those cruel stripes were made,
Within Pilate’s judgment hall-
Now His suff’ring afford perfect healing for all,
This wonderful Healer’s mine.
stanza3: Came the leper to Christ,
Saying “Surely I know,
That Thou, Lord, canst make me whole.”-
When his great faith was seen Jesus said, “Yes, I will.”
And touched him and made him clean.
stanza4: He has healed my sick soul,
Made me ev’ry whit whole,
And He’ll do the same to you -
He’s the same yesterday and today and for ever,
This Healer of men today.
chorus1: He was wounded for our transgressions,
He was bruised for our iniquities;
Surely He bore our sorrows,
And by His stripes we are healed.
chorus2: He was wounded for our transgressions,
He was bruised for our iniquities;
Surely He bore our sorrows,
And by His stripes we are healed.
chorus3: He was wounded for our transgressions,
He was bruised for our iniquities;
Surely He bore our sorrows,
And by His stripes we are healed.
chorus4: He was wounded for our transgressions,
He was bruised for our iniquities;
Surely He bore our sorrows,
And by His stripes we are healed.

generalIndex.title: GHS 103
generalIndex.subtitle: HE HEALED THEM ALL
stanza1: He healed them all --- the blind, the lame, the palsied,
The sick in body and the weak in mind,
Whoever came, no matter how afflicted,
Were sure a sovereign remedy to find.
stanza2: His word gave health, His touch restored the vigour,
To every weary pain-exhausted frame;
And all He asked before He gave the blessing
Was simple faith in Him from those who came.
stanza3: And is our Lord, the kind, the good, the tender,
Less loving now than in those days of old?
Or is it that our faith is growing feeble,
And Christian energy is waxing cold?
stanza4: Why do we not with equal expectation,
Now bring our sick ones to the Lord in prayer
Right through the throng of unbelieving scruples
Up to His very side and leave them there?
stanza5: He never health refused in bygone ages,
Nor feared to take the “chastisement” away;
Then why not ask it now, instead of praying
For “patience” to endure from day to day?

generalIndex.title: GHS 104
generalIndex.subtitle: TELL SOMEBODY
stanza1: Are you trusting the love of the Saviour divine,
Does His smile make the darkest day bright?
Are you laying on Him all the burdens that fret,
Does the cross that He gave you seem light? . . .
stanza2: Are you resting today ’neath the sheltering Rock,
Have you given your Lord full control?
Are you glad in the love that redeemed you from sin,
Has He spoken His peace to your soul? . . .
stanza3: Is there victory now where there once was defeat,
Blessed triumph thro’ Jesus alone?
Tell somebody today of a Master and Friend,
And His wonderful mercy make known...
chorus1: Tell somebody, tell somebody
All of the wonderful love you know;
Tell somebody, tell somebody,
Christ and His goodness show.
chorus2: Tell somebody, tell somebody
All of the wonderful love you know;
Tell somebody, tell somebody,
Christ and His goodness show.
chorus3: Tell somebody, tell somebody
All of the wonderful love you know;
Tell somebody, tell somebody,
Christ and His goodness show.

generalIndex.title: GHS 105
generalIndex.subtitle: I’LL TELL THE WORLD
stanza1: I’ll tell the world that I’m a Christian -
I’m not ashamed His name to bear;
I’ll tell the world that I’m a Christian
I’ll take Him with me anywhere.
I’ll tell the world how Jesus saved me,
And how He gave me a life brand-new;
And I know that if you trust Him
That all He gave me He’ll give to you,
I’ll tell the world that He’s my Saviour,
No other one could love me so;
My life, my all is His forever,
And where He leads me I will go.
stanza2: I’ll tell the world that He is coming -
It may be near or far away;
But we must live as if His coming
Would be tomorrow or today.
For when He comes and life is over,
For those who love Him there’s more to be;
Eyes have never seen the wonders
That He’s preparing for you and me.
O tell the world that you’re a Christian,
Be not ashamed His name to bear;
O tell the world that you’re a Christian,
And take Him with you ev’ry where.

generalIndex.title: GHS 106
generalIndex.subtitle: TELL THE WHOLE WIDE WORLD
stanza1: Tell the whole wide world of Jesus,
Bear the news from shore to shore;
Telling sinners of the Saviour,
Let the light spread more and more.
stanza2: Send abroad the gospel heralds,
Let them take the blessed light
Into every land of darkness,
Piercing through the shades of night.
stanza3: Yes, we’ll send the joyful message
Over mountain, over wave,
Telling everywhere of Jesus,
And His mighty power to save.
stanza4: While we pray for other nations,
Send them help with willing hand,
Let us not forget the home fields -
Jesus for our native land!
chorus1: Tell the world, the whole wide world;
Bear the news from shore to shore;
Tell the whole wide world of Jesus,
Praise His name for ever more !
chorus2: Tell the world, the whole wide world;
Bear the news from shore to shore;
Tell the whole wide world of Jesus,
Praise His name for ever more !
chorus3: Tell the world, the whole wide world;
Bear the news from shore to shore;
Tell the whole wide world of Jesus,
Praise His name for ever more !
chorus4: Tell the world, the whole wide world;
Bear the news from shore to shore;
Tell the whole wide world of Jesus,
Praise His name for ever more !

generalIndex.title: GHS 107
generalIndex.subtitle: GO AND TELL THEM
stanza1: Send the gospel of salvation,
To a world of dying men;
Tell it out to ev’ry nation,
’Till the Lord shall come again.
stanza2: ’Tis the church’s great commission,
’Tis the Master’s last command;
Christ has died for every creature,
Tell it out in every land.
stanza3: Christ is gathering out a people,
To His name from every race;
Haste to give the invitation
Ere shall end the day of grace.
stanza4: Give the gospel as a witness,
To a world of sinful men;
Till the Bride shall be completed,
And the Lord shall come again.
chorus1: Go and tell them, go and tell them,
Jesus died for sinful men.
Go and tell them, go and tell them,
He is coming, He is coming,
He is coming back again.
chorus2: Go and tell them, go and tell them,
Jesus died for sinful men.
Go and tell them, go and tell them,
He is coming, He is coming,
He is coming back again.
chorus3: Go and tell them, go and tell them,
Jesus died for sinful men.
Go and tell them, go and tell them,
He is coming, He is coming,
He is coming back again.
chorus4: Go and tell them, go and tell them,
Jesus died for sinful men.
