Go and tell them, go and tell them,
He is coming, He is coming,
He is coming back again.

generalIndex.title: GHS 108
generalIndex.subtitle: MUST I GO AND EMPTY-HANDED?
stanza1: “Must I go, and empty-handed,”
Thus my dear Redeemer meet?
Not one day of service give Him,
Lay no trophy at His feet?
stanza2: Not at death I shrink nor falter,
For my Saviour saves me now;
But to meet Him empty-handed,
Thought of that now clouds my brow.
stanza3: O the years in sinning wasted,
Could I but recall them now,
I would give them to my Saviour,
To His will I’d gladly bow.
stanza4: O ye saints, arouse, be earnest,
Up and work while yet ’tis day;
Ere the night of death o’er take thee,
Strive for souls while still you may.
chorus1: “Must I go, and empty-handed?”
Must I meet my Saviour so?
Not one soul with which to greet Him:
Must I empty-handed go?
chorus2: “Must I go, and empty-handed?”
Must I meet my Saviour so?
Not one soul with which to greet Him:
Must I empty-handed go?
chorus3: “Must I go, and empty-handed?”
Must I meet my Saviour so?
Not one soul with which to greet Him:
Must I empty-handed go?
chorus4: “Must I go, and empty-handed?”
Must I meet my Saviour so?
Not one soul with which to greet Him:
Must I empty-handed go?

generalIndex.title: GHS 109
generalIndex.subtitle: TO THE WORK
stanza1: To the work! to the work! we are servants of God,
Let us follow the path that our Master has trod;
With the balm of His counsel our strength to renew,
Let us do with our might what our hands find to do.
stanza2: To the work! to the work! let the hungry be fed,
To the fountain of life let the weary be led!
In the cross and its banner our glory shall be,
While we herald the tidings, “Salvation is free”!
stanza3: To the work! to the work! there is labour for all,
For the kingdom of darkness and error shall fall:
And the name of Jehovah exalted shall be,
In the loud-swelling chorus1, “Salvation is free”!
stanza4: To the work! to the work! in the strength of the Lord,
And a robe and a crown shall our labour reward,
When the home of the faithful our dwelling shall be,
And we shout with the ransomed, “Salvation is free!”
chorus1: Toiling on, toiling on, toiling on, toiling on;
Let us hope, Let us watch,
And labour till the Master comes.
chorus2: Toiling on, toiling on, toiling on, toiling on;
Let us hope, Let us watch,
And labour till the Master comes.
chorus3: Toiling on, toiling on, toiling on, toiling on;
Let us hope, Let us watch,
And labour till the Master comes.
chorus4: Toiling on, toiling on, toiling on, toiling on;
Let us hope, Let us watch,
And labour till the Master comes.

generalIndex.title: GHS 110
generalIndex.subtitle: TILL THE WHOLE WORLD KNOWS
stanza1: I’ll tell to all that God is love;
For the world has never known
The great compassion of His heart
For the wayward and the lone.
stanza2: I’ll tell of mercy’s boundless tide,
Like the waters of the sea,
That covers ev’ry sin of man;
’Tis salvation full and free.
stanza3: I’ll tell of grace that keeps the soul,
Of abiding peace within,
Of faith that overcomes the world,
With its tumult and its din.
stanza4: Eternal glory is the goal
That awaits the sons of light;
Eternal darkness, black as death,
For the children of the night.
chorus1: Till the whole world knows,
Till the whole world knows,
I will shout and sing
Of Christ my King,
Till the whole world knows.
chorus2: Till the whole world knows,
Till the whole world knows,
I will shout and sing
Of Christ my King,
Till the whole world knows.
chorus3: Till the whole world knows,
Till the whole world knows,
I will shout and sing
Of Christ my King,
Till the whole world knows.
chorus4: Till the whole world knows,
Till the whole world knows,
I will shout and sing
Of Christ my King,
Till the whole world knows.

generalIndex.title: GHS 111
generalIndex.subtitle: RESCUE THE PERISHING
stanza1: Rescue the perishing, Care for the dying,
Snatch them in pity from sin and the grave;
Weep o’er the erring one, Lift up the fallen,
Tell them of Jesus, the Mighty to save.
stanza2: Though they are slighting Him, Still He is waiting,
Waiting the penitent child to receive.
Plead with them earnestly, plead with them gently,
He will forgive if they only believe.
stanza3: Down in the human heart, Crushed by the tempter,
Feelings lie buried that grace can restore;
Touched by a loving hand, Wakened by kindness,
Chords that were broken will vibrate once more.
stanza4: Rescue the perishing, Duty demands it;
Strength for thy labour the Lord will provide;
Back to the narrow way Patiently win them;
Tell the poor wanderer a Saviour has died.
chorus1: Rescue the perishing,
Care for the dying;
Jesus is merciful,
Jesus will save.
chorus2: Rescue the perishing,
Care for the dying;
Jesus is merciful,
Jesus will save.
chorus3: Rescue the perishing,
Care for the dying;
Jesus is merciful,
Jesus will save.
chorus4: Rescue the perishing,
Care for the dying;
Jesus is merciful,
Jesus will save.

generalIndex.title: GHS 112
generalIndex.subtitle: WIN THEM ONE BY ONE
stanza1: If to Christ our only King
Men redeemed we strive to bring,
Just one way may this be done -
We must win them one by one.
stanza2: Side by side we stand each day,
Saved are we, but lost are they;
They will come if we but dare
Speak a word backed up by prayer.
stanza3: Only cowards dare refuse,
Dare this gift of God mis-use;
Ere some friend goes to his grave,
Speak a word his soul to save.
stanza4: Not for hope of great reward
Turn men’s hearts unto the Lord;
Just to see a saved man smile
Makes the effort well worth while.
chorus1: So you bring the one next to you
And I’ll bring the one next to me;
In all kinds of weather,
We’ll all work together,
And see what can be done;
If you’ll bring the one next to you,
And I bring the one next to me,
In no time at all we’ll have them all,
So win them, win them, one by one.
chorus2: So you bring the one next to you
And I’ll bring the one next to me;
In all kinds of weather,
We’ll all work together,
And see what can be done;
If you’ll bring the one next to you,
And I bring the one next to me,
In no time at all we’ll have them all,
So win them, win them, one by one.
chorus3: So you bring the one next to you
And I’ll bring the one next to me;
In all kinds of weather,
We’ll all work together,
And see what can be done;
If you’ll bring the one next to you,
And I bring the one next to me,
In no time at all we’ll have them all,
So win them, win them, one by one.
chorus4: So you bring the one next to you
And I’ll bring the one next to me;
In all kinds of weather,
We’ll all work together,
And see what can be done;
If you’ll bring the one next to you,
And I bring the one next to me,
In no time at all we’ll have them all,
So win them, win them, one by one.

generalIndex.title: GHS 113
generalIndex.subtitle: GO AND TELL THE STORY
stanza1: Go and tell the story to thy friends to-day,
How the Lord of glory met thee on thy way;
How He cleansed thy spir-it from the stain of sin,
Driving out the foes who reigned thy heart within.
stanza2: Go and tell the story, of His pow’r to save,
Of the sinful ‘‘legion’’ sunk beneath the wave;
Tell of His compassion, of His love so true,
Of the wondrous things the Lord hath done for you.
stanza3: Go and tell the story, how He reigns above,
Winning men to glory thro’ His dying love;
How He waits to crown them kings forevermore,
In the home awaiting, on the other shore.
chorus1: Go and tell the story, tell it far and wide,
How the Lord of glory for the sinner died;
And the soul that hears it, and in faith believes,
Straightway he the cleansing from the Lord receives.
chorus2: Go and tell the story, tell it far and wide,
How the Lord of glory for the sinner died;
And the soul that hears it, and in faith believes,
Straightway he the cleansing from the Lord receives.
chorus3: Go and tell the story, tell it far and wide,
How the Lord of glory for the sinner died;
And the soul that hears it, and in faith believes,
Straightway he the cleansing from the Lord receives.

generalIndex.title: GHS 114
generalIndex.subtitle: BRIGHTEN THE CORNER WHERE YOU ARE
stanza1: Do not wait until some deed of greatness
you may do,
Do not wait to shed your light afar;
To the many duties ever near you now be true,
Brighten the corner where you are.
stanza2: Just above are clouded skies that you may
help to clear,
Let not narrow self your way debar;
Tho’ into one heart alone may fall your song of cheer,
Brighten the corner where you are.
stanza3: Here for all your talent you may surely
find a need,
Here reflect the Bright and Morning Star,
Even from your humble hand the bread of life may feed,
Brighten the corner where you are.
chorus1: Brighten the corner where you are!
Brighten the corner where you are!
Someone far from harbor you may guide
across the bar,
Brighten the corner where you are.
chorus2: Brighten the corner where you are!
Brighten the corner where you are!
Someone far from harbor you may guide
across the bar,
Brighten the corner where you are.
chorus3: Brighten the corner where you are!
Brighten the corner where you are!
Someone far from harbor you may guide
across the bar,
Brighten the corner where you are.

generalIndex.title: GHS 115
generalIndex.subtitle: LIFT HIM UP
stanza1: How to reach the masses, men of every birth,
For an answer Jesus gave the key:
“And I, if I be lifted up from the earth,
Will draw all men unto Me.”
stanza2: Oh! the world is hungry for the living bread,
Lift the Saviour up for them to see;
Trust Him, and do not doubt the words that He said,
“I’ll draw all men unto me.”
stanza3: Don’t exalt the preacher, don’t exalt the pew,
Preach the Gospel simple, full and free;
Prove Him and you will find that promise is true,
“I’ll draw all men unto me.’’
stanza4: Lift Him up by living as a Christian ought,
Let the world in you the Saviour see;
Let the world in you the Saviour see;
“I’ll draw all men unto Me.”
chorus1: Lift Him up, . ....Lift Him up,.....
Still He speaks from eternity:
“And I, if I be lifted up from the earth,
Will draw all men unto Me.”
chorus2: Lift Him up, . ....Lift Him up,.....
Still He speaks from eternity:
“And I, if I be lifted up from the earth,
Will draw all men unto Me.”
chorus3: Lift Him up, . ....Lift Him up,.....
Still He speaks from eternity:
“And I, if I be lifted up from the earth,
Will draw all men unto Me.”
chorus4: Lift Him up, . ....Lift Him up,.....
Still He speaks from eternity:
“And I, if I be lifted up from the earth,
Will draw all men unto Me.”

generalIndex.title: GHS 116
generalIndex.subtitle: CARRY YOUR BIBLE
stanza1: Carry your Bible with you,
Let all its blessing outflow;
It will supply you each moment
Take it wherever you go!
stanza2: Carry the word of pardon,
Sweeter each day it will grow;
Somewhere some heart will be waiting
Take it wherever you go!
stanza3: Carry the wondrous story,
Tell it to hearts plung’d in woe;
This word of gracious redemption
Take it wherever you go!
stanza4: Carry the word of promise,
Sinners unpardon’d may know
God’s path from sin unto safety
Take it wherever you go!
chorus1: Take it wherever you go, (you go,)
Take it wherever you go, (you go;)
God’s message of love
Sent down from above,
Oh, take it wherever you go!
chorus2: Take it wherever you go, (you go,)
Take it wherever you go, (you go;)
God’s message of love
Sent down from above,
Oh, take it wherever you go!
chorus3: Take it wherever you go, (you go,)
Take it wherever you go, (you go;)
God’s message of love
Sent down from above,
Oh, take it wherever you go!
chorus4: Take it wherever you go, (you go,)
Take it wherever you go, (you go;)
God’s message of love
Sent down from above,
Oh, take it wherever you go!

generalIndex.title: GHS 117
generalIndex.subtitle: SHOW A LITTLE BIT OF LOVE AND KINDNESS
stanza1: Sing a song, spread some cheer,
There are sad and lonely people ev’rywhere;
Be a friend, show some love,
It will lift them from the dungeons of despair.
stanza2: Offer help, bring some hope,
To the fainting and discouraged on life’s road;
See a need, lend a hand,
There are many who are crushed beneath their load.
stanza3: Be a light, show the way,
Be a light within the night for those astray;
Speak a word, loving word,
That will bring them back to walk the narrow way.
chorus1: Show a little bit of love and kindness,
Never go along with hatred’s blindness,
Take a little time to reach for joy, and wear a
happy face;
Sing a little bit when the days are dreary,
Give a little help to a friend who’s weary-
That’s the way to make the world a happy place!
chorus2: Show a little bit of love and kindness,
Never go along with hatred’s blindness,
Take a little time to reach for joy, and wear a
happy face;
Sing a little bit when the days are dreary,
Give a little help to a friend who’s weary-
That’s the way to make the world a happy place!
chorus3: Show a little bit of love and kindness,
Never go along with hatred’s blindness,
Take a little time to reach for joy, and wear a
happy face;
Sing a little bit when the days are dreary,
Give a little help to a friend who’s weary-
That’s the way to make the world a happy place!

generalIndex.title: GHS 118
generalIndex.subtitle: I LOVE TO TELL THE STORY
stanza1: I love to tell the story of unseen things above,
Of Jesus and His glory, of Jesus and His love;
I love to tell the story because I know ’tis true,
It satisfies my longings as nothing else can do.
stanza2: I love to tell the story - ’tis pleasant to repeat
What seems, each time I tell it, more wonderfully sweet;
I love to tell the story, for some have never heard
The message of salvation from God’s own holy word.
stanza3: I love to tell the story, for those who know it best
Seem hungering and thirsting to hear it like the rest;
And when in scenes of glory, I sing the new, new song,
’Twill be the old, old story that I have love so long.
chorus1: I love to tell the story!
’Twill be my topicalIndex in glory _
To tell the old, old story
Of Jesus and His love.
chorus2: I love to tell the story!
’Twill be my topicalIndex in glory _
To tell the old, old story
Of Jesus and His love.
chorus3: I love to tell the story!
’Twill be my topicalIndex in glory _
To tell the old, old story
Of Jesus and His love.

generalIndex.title: GHS 119
generalIndex.subtitle: DO SOMETHING FOR OTHERS
stanza1: Many a soul in the battle of life
Trembles with fear at the din and the strife,
Bearing alone, amid trial and care,
Burdens and sorrows God bids you to share.
stanza2: Many in doubt or in fear of the way
Mutely appeal for your guidance today;
On your demeanour the choice may depend-
Are you concerned for the stranger or friend?
stanza3: Many, disheartened by cruel deceit,
Broken and worn by the pangs of defeat,
Doubting, despairingly, helplessly stand,
Waiting, perhaps, for your strengthening hand.
stanza4: Many are turning away from the right
Into the maze of the shadows of night;
Go to them, speak to them, over them pray,;
Help them, support them-do something today.”
chorus1: Do something for others,
Something for others today!...:
Duty demands it, and Jesus commands it!
Do something for others today.
chorus2: Do something for others,
Something for others today!...:
Duty demands it, and Jesus commands it!
Do something for others today.
chorus3: Do something for others,
Something for others today!...:
Duty demands it, and Jesus commands it!
Do something for others today.
chorus4: Do something for others,
Something for others today!...:
Duty demands it, and Jesus commands it!
Do something for others today.

generalIndex.title: GHS 120
generalIndex.subtitle: SPEAK A WORD
stanza1: Speak a word, a loving word for Jesus,
Ev’rywhere you go;
Tell poor sinners how He died to save them
From eternal woe.
stanza2: Speak a word, a tender word for Jesus,
To the sin-sick soul;
Tell him Christ, who came to save the vilest,
Waits to make him whole.
stanza3: Speak a word, a warning word for Jesus,
Speak it day by day,
Strive to lead some weak and wand’ring brother
In the narrow way.
chorus1: Speak a word for Jesus, speak it quickly,
Swiftly glides the time away,...
Daily tell the wondrous story of the Master’s glory,
Speak a loving word today.
chorus2: Speak a word for Jesus, speak it quickly,
Swiftly glides the time away,...
Daily tell the wondrous story of the Master’s glory,
Speak a loving word today.
chorus3: Speak a word for Jesus, speak it quickly,
Swiftly glides the time away,...
Daily tell the wondrous story of the Master’s glory,
Speak a loving word today.

generalIndex.title: GHS 121
generalIndex.subtitle: SOMEBODY ELSE NEEDS HIM, TOO
stanza1: If you’ve found Jesus the Friend that you need,
If He is loving and true,
If you have found Him a Saviour indeed,
Somebody else needs Him, too...
stanza2: If you are happy, and praise fills your heart,
Trust Him to carry you through;
If He His Spirit and love can impart,
Somebody else needs Him, too...
stanza3: If you have comfort in being God’s child,
If He is faithful to you,
Think, when you see those whom sin has defiled,
Somebody else needs Him, too....
stanza4: When the Lord gives you His love and His care,
Something He gives you to do;
You have the gospel with others to share,
Somebody else needs Him, too...
chorus1: Somebody somewhere perhaps at your side;
Someone is waiting for you;...
Say that for all Jesus suffered and died;
They-need Him, they need Him, too...
chorus2: Somebody somewhere perhaps at your side;
Someone is waiting for you;...
Say that for all Jesus suffered and died;
They-need Him, they need Him, too...
chorus3: Somebody somewhere perhaps at your side;
Someone is waiting for you;...
Say that for all Jesus suffered and died;
They-need Him, they need Him, too...
chorus4: Somebody somewhere perhaps at your side;
Someone is waiting for you;...
Say that for all Jesus suffered and died;
They-need Him, they need Him, too...

generalIndex.title: GHS 122
generalIndex.subtitle: SOMEBODY NEEDS YOUR LOVE
stanza1: Out in the darkness of sorrow and sin,
Somebody needs your love;
Led by the Master, that soul you may win,
Somebody needs your love.
stanza2: Many are helpless, and wait for your call,
Somebody needs your love;
Show them that Jesus is all and in all,
Somebody needs your love.
stanza3: Some one is tempted to turn from the right,
Somebody needs your love;
Longing for courage and strength for the fight,
Somebody needs your love.
stanza4: Some are down-hearted, in sorrow they roam,
Somebody needs your love;
Many are sighing for heaven and home,
Somebody needs your love.
chorus1: Somebody needs your love,
Somebody needs your love,
Someone in sadness,
Yearning for gladness,
Somebody needs your love,
chorus2: Somebody needs your love,
Somebody needs your love,
Someone in sadness,
Yearning for gladness,
Somebody needs your love,
chorus3: Somebody needs your love,
Somebody needs your love,
Someone in sadness,
Yearning for gladness,
Somebody needs your love,
chorus4: Somebody needs your love,
Somebody needs your love,
Someone in sadness,
Yearning for gladness,
Somebody needs your love,

generalIndex.title: GHS 221
generalIndex.subtitle: LET NOT THY HANDS BE SLACK
stanza1: “Let not thy hands be slack,”
Live not in vain;
Out on life’s lonely track
Men toil in pain.
Play thou a brother’s part,
Strength, love, and hope impart,
Bid thou the fainting heart
Look up again!
stanza2: “Let not thy hands be slack,”
Grip thou thy sword!
Why should’st thou courage lack?
Think of thy Lord.
Did He not fight for thee?
Stronger than all is He,
And He thy strength will be,
Rest on His word.
stanza3: “Let not thy hands be slack,”
Haste to the fray!
Dream not of turning back:
Life is not play!
Gird thou thy armour on,
Fight till the battle’s won,
Then shall thy Lord’s “Well done!”
More than repay!
stanza4: “Let not thy hands be slack!
Fear not! Be strong!”
Cease not to make attack
On every wrong.
Press on for truth and right,
Hold high the Gospel light
Expel the dirge of night
With heaven’s song!
stanza5: “Let not thy hands be slack!
The days fly fast.
Lost moments come not back
From the dark past.
Then be not slack of hand!
Help thou the weak to stand!
To God and Fatherland
Give all thou hast!

generalIndex.title: GHS 222
generalIndex.subtitle: SPEED THY SERVANTS, SAVIOUR, SPEED THEM
stanza1: Speed Thy servants, Saviour, speed them;
Thou art Lord of winds and waves;
They were bound, but Thou hast freed them,
Now they go to free the slaves.
Be Thou with them,
’Tis Thine arm alone that saves.
stanza2: Friends, and home, and all forsaking,
Lord, they go at Thy command;
As their stay Thy promise taking,
While they traverse sea and land:
O, be with them,
Lead them safely by the hand!
stanza3: When no fruit appears to cheer them,
And they seem to toil in vain,
Then in mercy, Lord, draw near them,
Then their sinking hopes sustain;
Thus supported,
Let their zeal revive again.
stanza4: In the midst of opposition,
Let them trust, O Lord, in Thee:
When success attends their mission,
Let Thy servants humble be;
Never leave them,
Till Thy face in heaven they see:
stanza5: There to reap in joy for ever
Fruit that grows from seed here sown,
There to be with Him, who never
Ceases to preserve His own,
And with gladness
Give the praise to Him alone.

generalIndex.title: GHS 231
generalIndex.subtitle: SEND THE LIGHT
stanza1: There’s a call comes ringing o’er the restless wave,
Send the light!... Send the light!
There are souls to rescue, there are souls to save,
Send the light!... Send the light!...
stanza2: We have heard the Macedonian call today,
Send the light!... Send the light!
And a golden off’ring at the cross we lay,
Send the light!... Send the light!...
stanza3: Let us pray that grace may everywhere abound,
Send the light!... Send the light!?
And a Christ-like spirit everywhere be found,
Send the light! Send the light!....
stanza4: Let us not grow weary in the work of love,
Send the light!... Send the light!
Let us gather jewels for a crown above,
Send the light!... Send the light!...
chorus1: Send the light!... the blessed gospel light,
Let it shine... from shore to shore!...
Send the light!... and let its radiant beams,
Light the world... forevermore...
chorus2: Send the light!... the blessed gospel light,
Let it shine... from shore to shore!...
Send the light!... and let its radiant beams,
Light the world... forevermore...
chorus3: Send the light!... the blessed gospel light,
Let it shine... from shore to shore!...
Send the light!... and let its radiant beams,
Light the world... forevermore...
chorus4: Send the light!... the blessed gospel light,
Let it shine... from shore to shore!...
Send the light!... and let its radiant beams,
Light the world... forevermore...

generalIndex.title: GHS 250
generalIndex.subtitle: FOR MY SAKE AND THE GOSPEL’S GO
stanza1: “For My sake and the Gospel’s, go
And tell Redemption’s story;”
His heralds answer, “Be it so,
And Thine, Lord, all the glory!”
They preach His birth, His life,
His cross, The love of His atonement,
For whom they count the world but loss,
His Easter, His enthronement.
stanza2: Hark, hark, the trump of Jubilee
Proclaims to every nation,
From pole to pole, by land and sea,
Glad tidings of salvation:
As nearer draws the day of doom,
While still the battle rages,
The heavenly dayspring, through the gloom
Breaks on the night of ages.
stanza3: Still on and on the anthems spread
Of Hallelujah voices,
In concert with he holy dead
The Warrior-Church rejoices;
Their snow-white robes are washed in blood,
Their golden harps are ringing;
Earth, and the Paradise of God,
One triumph-song are singing.
stanza4: He comes, whose Advent Trumpet drown
The last of Time’s evangels-
Emmanuel crowned with many crowns,
The Lord of saints and angels:
O Life, Light, Love, the Great I AM,
Triune, who changest never;
The throne of God and of the Lamb
Is Thine, and Thine for ever!

generalIndex.title: GHS 257
generalIndex.subtitle: JESUS SEND MORE LABOURERS
stanza1: Jesus send more labourers,
For Lord, we see the need
The land is ready for harvest
The fields are ripe indeed
stanza2: Lord, we love our country
Countless lives to be won.
Jesus bring revival
That through us Your will be done
stanza3: Lord, we sense Your moving,
Touching our lives with power.
We are ready to serve You,
To go, this day, this hour.
chorus1: Oh, Lord but start with me,
Jesus begin with me
Who will go for you, Lord;
Who will go for you, Lord;
Here I am, Lord, send ,me
Send me Lord, send me
chorus2: Oh, Lord but start with me,
Jesus begin with me
Who will go for you, Lord;
Who will go for you, Lord;
Here I am, Lord, send ,me
Send me Lord, send me
chorus3: Oh, Lord but start with me,
Jesus begin with me
Who will go for you, Lord;
Who will go for you, Lord;
Here I am, Lord, send ,me
Send me Lord, send me

generalIndex.title: GHS 123
generalIndex.subtitle: NO ONE LIKE MY SAVIOUR
stanza1: There’s no one like my Saviour;
No friend can be like Him;
My never failing sunshine
When earthly lights grow dim;
When summer flow’rs are blooming,
The brightness of my joy,
O, may His happy service
My heart and life employ.
stanza2: There’s no one like my Saviour;
In seasons of distress,
He draws me closer to Him,
To comfort and to bless;
He gives me in temptation,
The strength of His right arm;
His angels camp around me,
To keep me from all harm.
stanza3: There’s no one like my Saviour;
He pardons all my sin,
And gives His Holy Spirit,
A springing well within;
He leads me out to service,
With gentle touch and mild;
O, wonder of all wonders,
That I should be His child.
stanza4: There’s no one like my Saviour;
Come now, and find it true!
He gave His life a ransom,
His blood was shed for you;
Then when we reach the city of everlasting light,
We’ll sing with saints and angels,
All honour, power and might.
chorus1: No one, no one like my precious Saviour,
No one, no one such a friend can be;
No one, no one like my precious Saviour,
Glory, glory, Jesus cares for me.
chorus2: No one, no one like my precious Saviour,
No one, no one such a friend can be;
No one, no one like my precious Saviour,
Glory, glory, Jesus cares for me.
chorus3: No one, no one like my precious Saviour,
No one, no one such a friend can be;
No one, no one like my precious Saviour,
Glory, glory, Jesus cares for me.
chorus4: No one, no one like my precious Saviour,
No one, no one such a friend can be;
No one, no one like my precious Saviour,
Glory, glory, Jesus cares for me.

generalIndex.title: GHS 124
generalIndex.subtitle: CHRIST RECEIVETH SINFUL MEN
stanza1: Sinners Jesus will receive!
Sound this word of grace to all
Who the heav’nly pathway leave,
All who linger, all who fall!
stanza2: Come: and He will give you rest;
Trust Him; for His word is plain,
He will take the sinful-est;
Christ receiveth sinful men.
stanza3: Now my heart condemns me not,
Pure before the law I stand;
He who cleans’d me from all spot
Satisfied its last demand.
stanza4: Christ receiveth, sinful men;
Even me with all my sin;
Purg’d from ev’ry spot and stain,
Heav’n with Him I enter in.
chorus1: Sing it o’er . . . and o’er again, . . .
Christ receiv . . eth sinful men; . . .
Make the mes . . . sage clear and plain: . . .
Christ receiv . . . eth sinful men. . . .
chorus2: Sing it o’er . . . and o’er again, . . .
Christ receiv . . eth sinful men; . . .
Make the mes . . . sage clear and plain: . . .
Christ receiv . . . eth sinful men. . . .
chorus3: Sing it o’er . . . and o’er again, . . .
Christ receiv . . eth sinful men; . . .
Make the mes . . . sage clear and plain: . . .
Christ receiv . . . eth sinful men. . . .
chorus4: Sing it o’er . . . and o’er again, . . .
Christ receiv . . eth sinful men; . . .
Make the mes . . . sage clear and plain: . . .
Christ receiv . . . eth sinful men. . . .

generalIndex.title: GHS 125
generalIndex.subtitle: WONDERFUL GRACE OF JESUS
stanza1: Wonderful grace of Jesus,
Greater than all my sin;
How shall my tongue describe it,
Where shall its praise begin?
Taking away my burden,
Setting my spirit free,
For the wonderful grace of Jesus reaches me.
stanza2: Wonderful grace of Jesus,
Reaching to all the lost,
By it I have been pardoned,
Saved to the uttermost,
Chains have been torn assunder,
Giving me liberty;
For the wonderful grace of Jesus reaches me.
stanza3: Wonderful grace of Jesus,
Reaching the most defiled,
By its transforming power,
Making him God’s dear child,
Purchasing peace and heaven,
For all eternity;
And the wonderful grace of
Jesus reaches me.
chorus1: Wonderful the matchless grace of Jesus,
Deeper than the mighty rolling sea;
Wonderful grace all sufficient for me,
for even me
Broader than the scope of my trangressions,
Greater far than all my sin and shame, . . .
O magnify the precious name of Jesus,
Praise His name!
chorus2: Wonderful the matchless grace of Jesus,
Deeper than the mighty rolling sea;
Wonderful grace all sufficient for me,
for even me
Broader than the scope of my trangressions,
Greater far than all my sin and shame, . . .
O magnify the precious name of Jesus,
Praise His name!
chorus3: Wonderful the matchless grace of Jesus,
Deeper than the mighty rolling sea;
Wonderful grace all sufficient for me,
for even me
Broader than the scope of my trangressions,
Greater far than all my sin and shame, . . .
O magnify the precious name of Jesus,
Praise His name!

generalIndex.title: GHS 126
generalIndex.subtitle: GREAT GOD OF WONDERS
stanza1: Great God of wonders! all Thy ways
Display the attributes divine;
But countless acts of pard’ning grace
Beyond Thine other wonders shine:
stanza2: In wonder lost, with trembling joy
We take the pardon of our God:
Pardon for crimes of deepest dye,
A pardon bought with Jesus blood.
stanza3: Pardon - from an offended God!
Pardon - for sins of deepest dye!
Pardon - bestowed through Jesus’ blood!
Pardon - that brings the rebel nigh!
stanza4: O may this strange, this matchless grace,
This God-like miracle of love,
Fill the wide earth with grateful praise,
As now it fills the choirs above!
chorus1: Who is a pard’ning God like Thee?
Or who has grace so rich and free?
chorus2: Who is a pard’ning God like Thee?
Or who has grace so rich and free?
chorus3: Who is a pard’ning God like Thee?
Or who has grace so rich and free?
chorus4: Who is a pard’ning God like Thee?
Or who has grace so rich and free?

generalIndex.title: GHS 127
generalIndex.subtitle: ROCK OF AGES CLEFT FOR ME
stanza1: Rock of Ages, cleft for me,
Let me hide myself in Thee!
Let the water and the blood,
From Thy riven side which flowed,
Be of sin the double cure;
Cleanse me from its guilt and power.
stanza2: Not the labours of my hands,
Can fulfil Thy law’s demands;
Could my zeal no respite know,
Could my tears for ever flow,
All for sin could not atone;
Thou must save and Thou alone.
stanza3: Nothing in my hand I bring,
Simply to Thy cross I cling;
Naked, come to Thee for dress;
Helpless, look to Thee for grace:
Foul, I to the fountain fly;
Wash me, Saviour, or I die.
stanza4: While I draw this fleeting breath,
When my eyelids close in death,
When I soar to worlds unknown,
See Thee on Thy judgment throne,
Rock of Ages, cleft for me,
Let me hide myself in Thee.

generalIndex.title: GHS 128
generalIndex.subtitle: VICTORY IN JESUS
stanza1: I heard an old, old story,
How a Saviour came from glory,
How He gave His life on Calvary
To save a wretch like me;
I heard about His groaning,
Of His precious blood’s atoning,
Then I repented of my sins
And won the victory.
stanza2: I heard about His healing,
Of His cleasing pow’r revealing,
How He made the lame to walk again
And cause the blind to see;
And then I cried, “dear Jesus
Come and heal my broken spirit,”
And somehow Jesus came and bro’t
To me the victory.
stanza3: I heard about a mansion
He has built for me in glory,
And I heard about the streets of gold
Beyond the crystal sea;
About the angel singing
And the old redemption story,
And some sweet day I’ll sing up there
The song of victory.
chorus1: O victory in Jesus, my Saviour, forever,
He sought me and bought me
With His redeeming blood;
He loved me ere I knew Him,
And all my love is due Him,
He plunged me to victory
Beneath the cleansing flood.
chorus2: O victory in Jesus, my Saviour, forever,
He sought me and bought me
With His redeeming blood;
He loved me ere I knew Him,
And all my love is due Him,
He plunged me to victory
Beneath the cleansing flood.
chorus3: O victory in Jesus, my Saviour, forever,
He sought me and bought me
With His redeeming blood;
He loved me ere I knew Him,
And all my love is due Him,
He plunged me to victory
Beneath the cleansing flood.

generalIndex.title: GHS 129
generalIndex.subtitle: GRACE GREATER THAN OUR SIN
stanza1: Marvelous grace of our loving Lord,
Grace that exceeds our sin and our guilt,
Yonder on Calvary’s mount outpoured
There where the blood of the Lamb was spilt.
stanza2: Sin and despair like the sea waves cold,
Threaten the soul with infinite loss;
Grace that is greater, yes, grace untold,
Point to the Refuge, the Mighty Cross.
stanza3: Dark is the stain that we cannot hide,
What can avail to wash it away?
Look! there is flowing a crimson tide;
Whiter than snow you may be today.
stanza4: Marvelous, infinite, matchless grace,
Freely bestowed on all who believe;
You that are longing to see His face,
Will you this moment His grace receive?
chorus1: Grace, grace, God’s grace,
Grace that will pardon and cleanse within;
Grace, grace, God’s grace,
Grace that is greater than all our sin.
chorus2: Grace, grace, God’s grace,
Grace that will pardon and cleanse within;
Grace, grace, God’s grace,
Grace that is greater than all our sin.
chorus3: Grace, grace, God’s grace,
Grace that will pardon and cleanse within;
Grace, grace, God’s grace,
Grace that is greater than all our sin.
chorus4: Grace, grace, God’s grace,
Grace that will pardon and cleanse within;
Grace, grace, God’s grace,
Grace that is greater than all our sin.

generalIndex.title: GHS 130
generalIndex.subtitle: JUST AS I AM, WITHOUT ONE PLEA
stanza1: Just as I am, without one plea,
But that Thy blood was shed for me,
And that Thou bidst me come to Thee,
O Lamb of God, I come, I come.
stanza2: Just as I am, and waiting not
To rid my soul of one dark blot,
To Thee, whose blood can cleanse each spot,
O Lamb of God, I come, I come.
stanza3: Just as I am - Though tossed about,
With many a conflict, many a doubt,
Fightings and fears within, without,
O Lamb of God, I come, I come.
stanza4: Just as I am - poor, wretched, blind-
Sight, riches, healing of the mind,
Yea, all I need, in Thee to find,
O Lamb of God, I come, I come.
stanza5: Just as I am, Thou wilt receive,
Wilt welcome, pardon, cleanse, relieve;
Because Thy promise I believe,
O Lamb of God, I come, I come.
stanza6: Just as I am - Thy love unknown
Now to be Thine, yea, Thine alone,
O Lamb of God, I come, I come.
stanza7: Just as I am, of that free love
The breadth, length, depth and height to prove,
Here for a season, then above,
O Lamb of God, I come, I come.

generalIndex.title: GHS 131
generalIndex.subtitle: IN TENDERNESS HE SOUGHT ME
stanza1: In tenderness He sought me,
Weary and sick with sin,
And on His shoulders brought me
Back to His fold again.
While angels in His presence sang,
Until the courts of heaven rang.
stanza2: He washed the bleeding sin-wounds,
And poured in oil and wine;
He whispered to assure me
“I’ve found thee, thou art Mine”
I never heard a sweeter voice,
It made my aching heart rejoice!
stanza3: He pointed to the nail-prints,
For me His blood was shed,
A mocking crown so thorny,
Was placed upon His head:
I wondered what He saw in me,
To suffer such deep agony.
stanza4: I’m sitting in His presence,
The sunshine of His face,
While with adoring wonder
His blessings I retrace.
It seems as if eternal days
Are far too short to sound His praise.
stanza5: So while the hours are passing,
All now is perfect rest;
I’m waiting for the morning,
The brightest and the best,
When He will call us to His side,
To be with Him, His spotless bride.
chorus1: Oh, the love that sought me!
Oh, the blood that bought me!
Oh, the grace that brought me to the fold,
Wondrous grace that brought me to the fold!
chorus2: Oh, the love that sought me!
Oh, the blood that bought me!
Oh, the grace that brought me to the fold,
Wondrous grace that brought me to the fold!
chorus3: Oh, the love that sought me!
Oh, the blood that bought me!
Oh, the grace that brought me to the fold,
Wondrous grace that brought me to the fold!
chorus4: Oh, the love that sought me!
Oh, the blood that bought me!
Oh, the grace that brought me to the fold,
Wondrous grace that brought me to the fold!
chorus5: Oh, the love that sought me!
Oh, the blood that bought me!
Oh, the grace that brought me to the fold,
Wondrous grace that brought me to the fold!

generalIndex.title: GHS 132
generalIndex.subtitle: RUNNING OVER
stanza1: Since the Saviour came to this heart of mine,
My cup’s fill’d and running over,
Filling my poor soul with His joy divine,
My cup’s fill’d and running over.
stanza2: With my Lord so dear, I have naught to fear,
My cup’s fill’d and running over,
Tho’ my way be drear He is ever near,
My cup’s fill’d and running over.
stanza3: Even tho’ I walk thro’ death’s darksome vale,
My cup’s fill’d and running over,
Christ my Lord shall be my comfort still,
My cup’s fill’d and running over.
stanza4: Sinner, seek the Lord, trust His precious word,
While the angels round you hover,
Heaven’s bells will ring, and you then will sing,
My cup’s fill’d and running over.
chorus1: Ru. . . nning over,
Ru. . . nning over,
My cup’s fill’d and running over,
Since the Lord saved me,
I’m as happy as can be,
My cup’s fill’d and running over.
chorus2: Ru. . . nning over,
Ru. . . nning over,
My cup’s fill’d and running over,
Since the Lord saved me,
I’m as happy as can be,
My cup’s fill’d and running over.
chorus3: Ru. . . nning over,
Ru. . . nning over,
My cup’s fill’d and running over,
Since the Lord saved me,
I’m as happy as can be,
My cup’s fill’d and running over.
chorus4: Ru. . . nning over,
Ru. . . nning over,
My cup’s fill’d and running over,
Since the Lord saved me,
I’m as happy as can be,
My cup’s fill’d and running over.

generalIndex.title: GHS 133
generalIndex.subtitle: OUT OF MY BONDAGE
stanza1: Out of my bondage, sorrow and night,
Jesus I come, Jesus, I come;
Into Thy freedom, gladness and light,
Jesus I come to Thee;
Out of my sickness into Thy health,
Out of my want and into Thy wealth,
Out of my sin and into Thy-self,
Jesus, I come to Thee.
stanza2: Out of my shameful failure and loss,
Jesus, I come, Jesus, I come;
Into the glorious gain of Thy cross,
Jesus I come to Thee;
Out of earth’s sorrow into Thy balm,
Out of life’s storms and into Thy calm,
Out of distress to jubilant psalm,
Jesus, I come to Thee.
stanza3: Out of unrest and arrogant pride,
Jesus, I come, Jesus, I come;
Into Thy blessed will to abide,
Jesus, I come to Thee;
Out of myself to dwell in Thy love,
Out of despair into raptures above,
Upward for aye on wings like a dove
Jesus, I come to Thee.
stanza4: Out of the fear and dread of the tomb,
Jesus, I come, Jesus, I come;
Into the joy and light of my home,
Jesus I come to Thee;
Out of the depths of ruin untold,
Into the peace of Thy sheltering fold,
Ever Thy glorious face to behold,
Jesus, I come to Thee.

generalIndex.title: GHS 134
generalIndex.subtitle: AND CAN IT BE THAT I SHOULD GAIN
stanza1: And can it be, that I should gain
An interest in the Saviour’s blood?
Died He for me, who caused His pain?
For me, who Him to death pursued?
Amazing love! how can it be
That Thou, my God, shouldst die for me?
stanza2: ’Tis mystery all ! th’ Immortal dies!
Who can explore His strange design?
In vain the first born seraph tries
To sound the depth of love divine!
’Tis mercy all ! let earth adore,
Let angel-minds inquire no more.
stanza3: He left His Father’s throne above
So free, so infinite His grace!
Emptied Himself of all but love,
And bled for Adam’s helpless race:
’Tis mercy all, immense and free,
For, O my God, it found out me!
stanza4: Long my imprisoned spirit lay
Fast bound in sin and nature’s night;
Thine eye diffused a quickening ray,
I woke, the dungeon flamed with light:
My chains fell off, my heart was free,
I rose, went forth, and followed Thee.
stanza5: No condemnation now I dread,
Jesus, and all in Him, is mine;
Alive in Him, my living Head,
And clothed in righteousness divine,
Bold I approach the eternal throne,
And claim the crown, through Christ my own.

generalIndex.title: GHS 135
generalIndex.subtitle: TELL ME THE OLD, OLD STORY
stanza1: Tell me the old, old story,
Of unseen things above,
Of Jesus and His glory,
Of Jesus and His love;
Tell me the story simply,
As to a little child,
For I am weak and weary,
And helpless and defiled.
stanza2: Tell me the story slowly,
That I may take it in-
That wonderful redemption,
God’s remedy for sin;
Tell me the story often,
For I forget so soon,
The “early dew” of morning
Has passed away at noon.
stanza3: Tell me the story softly,
With earnest tones, and grave;
Remember I’m the sinner
Whom Jesus came to save;
Tell me the story always,
If you would really be,
In any time of trouble,
A comforter to me.
stanza4: Tell me the same old story,
When you have cause to fear
That this world’s empty glory
Is costing me too dear;
Yes, and when that world’s glory
Is dawning on my soul,
Tell me the old, old story:
“Christ Jesus makes thee whole.”
chorus1: Tell me the Old, Old Story,
Tell me the Old, Old Story,
Tell me the Old, Old Story,
Of Jesus and His love.
chorus2: Tell me the Old, Old Story,
Tell me the Old, Old Story,
Tell me the Old, Old Story,
Of Jesus and His love.
chorus3: Tell me the Old, Old Story,
Tell me the Old, Old Story,
Tell me the Old, Old Story,
Of Jesus and His love.
chorus4: Tell me the Old, Old Story,
Tell me the Old, Old Story,
Tell me the Old, Old Story,
Of Jesus and His love.

generalIndex.title: GHS 136
generalIndex.subtitle: AT CALVARY
stanza1: Years I spent in vanity and pride,
Caring not my Lord was crucified,
Knowing not it was for me He died
On Calvary
stanza2: By God’s word at last my sin I learned,
Then I trembl’d at the law I’d spurn’d,
Till my guilty soul, imploring turned
To Calvary.
stanza3: Now I’ve given to Jesus everything,
Now I gladly own Him as my King,
Now my raptured soul can only sing
Of Calvary.
stanza4: Oh! the love that drew salvation’s plan,
Oh! the grace that brought it down to man,
Oh! the mighty gulf that God did span
At Calvary.
chorus1: Mercy there was great and grace was free,
Pardon there was multiplied to me;
There my burden’d soul found liberty,
At Calvary.
chorus2: Mercy there was great and grace was free,
Pardon there was multiplied to me;
There my burden’d soul found liberty,
At Calvary.
chorus3: Mercy there was great and grace was free,
Pardon there was multiplied to me;
There my burden’d soul found liberty,
At Calvary.
chorus4: Mercy there was great and grace was free,
Pardon there was multiplied to me;
There my burden’d soul found liberty,
At Calvary.

generalIndex.title: GHS 224
generalIndex.subtitle: OH, THE BITTER SHAME AND SORROW
stanza1: Oh, the bitter shame and sorrow,
That a time could ever be,
When I let the Saviour’s pity
Plead in vain, and proudly answered,
“All of self, and none of Thee!”
stanza2: Yet He found me; I beheld Him
Bleeding on the accursed tree,
Heard Him pray, “Forgive them, Father!”
And my wistful heart said faintly-
“Some of self, and some of Thee.”
stanza3: Day by day His tender mercy,
Healing, helping, full, and free,
Sweet and strong, and, ah! so patient,
Brought me lower, while I whispered,
“Less of self, and more of Thee.”
stanza4: Higher than the highest heavens,
Deeper than the deepest sea,
Lord, Thy love at last has conquered;
Grant me now my supplication -
“None of self, and all of Thee.”

generalIndex.title: GHS 242
generalIndex.subtitle: A GOOD HIGH PRIEST IS COME
stanza1: A Good High Priest is come,
Supplying Aaron’s place,
And taking up his room,
Dispensing life and grace,
The law of Aaron’s priesthood came,
But grace and truth by Jesus’ name.
stanza2: He once temptations knew,
And woes of every kind,
That He might succour show
To every tempted mind;
In every point the Lamb was tried
Like us, and then for us He died.
stanza3: He died, but lives again,
And by the altar stands;
There shows how, He was slain,
Opening His pierced hands;
Our Priest abides, and pleads our cause,
Transgressors of His righteous laws.
stanza4: I other priests disclaim,
Their laws and offerings too;
None but the bleeding Lamb
The mighty work can do;
He shall have all the praise, for He
Hath loved and lived and died for me.

generalIndex.title: GHS 256
generalIndex.subtitle: REDEEMED
stanza1: Redeem'd how i love to proclaim it,
Redeem'd by the blood of the lamb,
Redeem'd thro' his infinite mercy,
His Child, and forever, I am.
stanza2: Redeem'd and so Happy in Jesus,
No Language my rapture can tell;
I know that the light of his presence
With me doth continually dwell.
stanza3: I think of my blessed Redeemer,
I think of Him all the day long
I sing, for I cannot be silent;
His Love is the topicalIndex of my song.
stanza4: I know I shall see in his beauty
The King in whose way i delight;
Who lovingly guard my footsteps
And giveth me songs in the night.
chorus1: Redeem'd, redeem'd,
Redeem'd by the blood of the Lamb;
Redeem'd, redeem'd,
His child, and forever, I am.
chorus2: Redeem'd, redeem'd,
Redeem'd by the blood of the Lamb;
Redeem'd, redeem'd,
His child, and forever, I am.
chorus3: Redeem'd, redeem'd,
Redeem'd by the blood of the Lamb;
Redeem'd, redeem'd,
His child, and forever, I am.
chorus4: Redeem'd, redeem'd,
Redeem'd by the blood of the Lamb;
Redeem'd, redeem'd,
His child, and forever, I am.

generalIndex.title: GHS 137
generalIndex.subtitle: HOW BEAUTIFUL HEAVEN MUST BE
stanza1: We read of a beautiful heaven,
Prepared for the pure and the free;
These truths in God’s word He has given,
How beautiful heaven must be.
stanza2: In heaven, no drooping nor pining,
No wishing for elsewhere to be;
God’s light is forever there shining,
How beautiful heaven must be.
stanza3: I’m longing to go to fair heaven,
To be with the happy and free;
To spend the long ages in singing,
How beautiful heaven must be .
stanza4: The angels so sweetly are singing,
Up there by the beautiful sea;
Sweet chords from their gold harps are ringing,
How beautiful heaven must be.
chorus1: Mercy there was great and grace was free,
Pardon there was multiplied to me;
There my burden’d soul found liberty,
At Calvary.
chorus2: Mercy there was great and grace was free,
Pardon there was multiplied to me;
There my burden’d soul found liberty,
At Calvary.
chorus3: Mercy there was great and grace was free,
Pardon there was multiplied to me;
There my burden’d soul found liberty,
At Calvary.
chorus4: Mercy there was great and grace was free,
Pardon there was multiplied to me;
There my burden’d soul found liberty,
At Calvary.

generalIndex.title: GHS 138
generalIndex.subtitle: WHEN WE ALL GET TO HEAVEN
stanza1: Sing the wondrous love of Jesus,
Sing His mercy and His grace;
In the mansion, bright and blessed,
He’ll prepare for us a place..
stanza2: While we walk the pilgrim pathway,
Clouds will overspread the sky;
But when trav’ling days are over,
Not a shadow, not a sigh.
stanza3: Let us, then, be true and faithful,
Trusting, serving every day
Just one glimpse of Him in glory,
Will the toils of life repay.
stanza4: Onward to the prize before us!
Soon His beauty we’ll behold;
Soon the pearly gates will open,
We shall tread the streets of gold.
chorus1: When we all get to heaven,
What a day of rejoicing that will be!
When we all see Jesus,
We’ll sing and shout the victory.
chorus2: When we all get to heaven,
What a day of rejoicing that will be!
When we all see Jesus,
We’ll sing and shout the victory.
chorus3: When we all get to heaven,
What a day of rejoicing that will be!
When we all see Jesus,
We’ll sing and shout the victory.
chorus4: When we all get to heaven,
What a day of rejoicing that will be!
When we all see Jesus,
We’ll sing and shout the victory.

generalIndex.title: GHS 139
generalIndex.subtitle: BEAUTIFUL HOME!
stanza1: There is a home eternal,
Beautiful and bright,
Where sweet joys supernal
Never are dimm’d by night;
White rob’d angels are singing
Ever around the bright throne;
When, oh, When shall I see thee,
Beautiful, beautiful Home?
stanza2: Flowers are ever springing
In that Home so fair;
Little children singing,
Praises to Jesus there.
How they swell the glad anthem,
Ever around the bright throne!
When, oh, when shall I see thee,
Beautiful, beautiful Home?
stanza3: Soon shall I join the ransomed,
Far beyond the sky;
Christ is my salvation,
Why should I fear to die?
Soon my eyes shall behold Him
Seated upon the bright throne;
Then, oh, then shall I see thee.
Beautiful, beautiful Home?
chorus1: Home! beautiful Home!
Bright, beautiful Home!
Bright Home of our Saviour,
Bright, beautiful Home!
chorus2: Home! beautiful Home!
Bright, beautiful Home!
Bright Home of our Saviour,
Bright, beautiful Home!
chorus3: Home! beautiful Home!
Bright, beautiful Home!
Bright Home of our Saviour,
Bright, beautiful Home!

generalIndex.title: GHS 140
generalIndex.subtitle: LAYING MY TREASURE UP THERE
stanza1: On the mountain of Zion beyond the blue sky,
Stands a city so wondrous and fair;
I expect to depart for that land, by and by,-
For I’m laying my treasure up there.
stanza2: There’s a mansion awaiting God’s people, I’m told,
Which the Saviour has gone to prepare;
There the walls are of jasper, the streets are of gold,
I am laying my treasure up there.
stanza3: All the love of my heart, and my soul, mind and strength,
And the work that with Jesus I share,
Are but some of the riches I’ll find there at length,
For I’m laying my treasure up there.
stanza4: So altho’ a poor pilgrim on earth I may roam,
Ever constant in watching and prayer,
Soon I’ll hear the glad summons to start for my home,
For I’m laying my treasure up there.
chorus1: I am laying my treasure up there, up there,
In that beautiful city so fair;...
When its glories unfold I’ll have riches untold,
For I’m laying my treasure up there.
chorus2: I am laying my treasure up there, up there,
In that beautiful city so fair;...
When its glories unfold I’ll have riches untold,
For I’m laying my treasure up there.
chorus3: I am laying my treasure up there, up there,
In that beautiful city so fair;...
When its glories unfold I’ll have riches untold,
For I’m laying my treasure up there.
chorus4: I am laying my treasure up there, up there,
In that beautiful city so fair;...
When its glories unfold I’ll have riches untold,
For I’m laying my treasure up there.

generalIndex.title: GHS 141
generalIndex.subtitle: I SHALL SEE THE KING
stanza1: I shall see the King
Where the angels sing,
I shall see the King some day,
In the better land,
On the golden strand,
And with Him shall ever stay.
stanza2: In the land of song,
In the glory throng,
Where there never comes a night,
With my Lord once slain
I shall ever reign
In the glory-land of light.
stanza3: I shall see the King,
All my tributes bring,
And shall look upon His face;
Then my song shall be
How He ransomed me
And has kept me by His grace.
chorus1: In His glory, I shall see the King,
And forever endless praises sing;
’Twas on calvary Jesus died for me;
I shall see the King some day.
chorus2: In His glory, I shall see the King,
And forever endless praises sing;
’Twas on calvary Jesus died for me;
I shall see the King some day.
chorus3: In His glory, I shall see the King,
And forever endless praises sing;
’Twas on calvary Jesus died for me;
I shall see the King some day.

generalIndex.title: GHS 142
generalIndex.subtitle: “HOLY,HOLY” IS WHAT THE ANGELS SING
stanza1: There is singing up in heaven
such as we have never known,
Where the angels sing the praises of the Lamb
upon the throne;
Their sweet harps are ever tuneful and their
voices alway clear,
O that we might be more like them while we
serve the Master here!
stanza2: But I hear another anthem,
blending voices clear and strong,
“Unto Him who hath redeemed us
and hath bought us,’’ is the song;
We have come thru tribulations
to this land so fair and bright,
In the fountain freely flowing
He hath made our garments white.
stanza3: Then the angels stand and listen,
for they cannot join that song,
Like the sound of many waters,
by that happy, blood washed throng;
For they sing about great trials,
battles fought and vict’ries won,
And they praise their great
Redeemer who hath said to them, “well done”.
stanza4: So, altho’ I’m not an angel ,
yet I know that over there
I will join a blessed chorus1 that the angels
cannot share;
I will sing about my Saviour,
who upon dark Calvary
Freely pardoned my transgression,
died to set a sinner free.
chorus1: ‘‘Holy, holy’’ is what the angels sing,
And I expect to help them make the courts of
heaven ring;
But when I sing redemption’s story they will
fold their wings,
For angels never felt the joys that
our salvation brings.
chorus2: ‘‘Holy, holy’’ is what the angels sing,
And I expect to help them make the courts of
heaven ring;
But when I sing redemption’s story they will
fold their wings,
For angels never felt the joys that
our salvation brings.
chorus3: ‘‘Holy, holy’’ is what the angels sing,
And I expect to help them make the courts of
heaven ring;
But when I sing redemption’s story they will
fold their wings,
For angels never felt the joys that
our salvation brings.
chorus4: ‘‘Holy, holy’’ is what the angels sing,
And I expect to help them make the courts of
heaven ring;
But when I sing redemption’s story they will
fold their wings,
For angels never felt the joys that
our salvation brings.

generalIndex.title: GHS 143
generalIndex.subtitle: THE END OF THE ROAD
stanza1: When I come to the end of the long, long road,
The shadows will flee away,
And I’ll stand in the glorious light of God,
Where dwelleth eternal day...
stanza2: Looking back o’er the years that were hard and drear,
The hand of the Christ I’ll see;
While my heart will go forth with a song of praise,
Because of His love for me...
stanza3: When I come to the end of the long, long, road,
And trials will all be past ,
I shall look in the face of my dearest Friend,
Safe home in His heav’n at last....
chorus1: When I come to the end, the end of the road,
To the land of eternity,
When I come to the end of life’s long road,
The face of my Lord I’ll see.
chorus2: When I come to the end, the end of the road,
To the land of eternity,
When I come to the end of life’s long road,
The face of my Lord I’ll see.
chorus3: When I come to the end, the end of the road,
To the land of eternity,
When I come to the end of life’s long road,
The face of my Lord I’ll see.

generalIndex.title: GHS 144
generalIndex.subtitle: I WON’T HAVE TO CROSS JORDAN ALONE
stanza1: When I come to the river at ending of day,
When the last winds of sorrow have blown;
There’ll be somebody waiting to show me the way,
I won’t have to cross Jordan alone.
stanza2: Often times I’m forsaken, and weary and sad,
When it seems that my friends have all gone;
There is one tho’t that cheers me and makes my heart glad,
I won’t have to cross Jordan alone.
stanza3: Tho’ the billows of sorrow and trouble may sweep,
Christ the Saviour will care for His own;
Till the end of the journey, my soul He will keep,
I won’t have to cross Jordan alone.
chorus1: I won’t have to cross Jordan alone,
Jesus died for my sins to atone;
When the darkness I see,
He’ll be waiting for me,
I won’t have to cross Jordan alone.
chorus2: I won’t have to cross Jordan alone,
Jesus died for my sins to atone;
When the darkness I see,
He’ll be waiting for me,
I won’t have to cross Jordan alone.
chorus3: I won’t have to cross Jordan alone,
Jesus died for my sins to atone;
When the darkness I see,
He’ll be waiting for me,
I won’t have to cross Jordan alone.

generalIndex.title: GHS 145
generalIndex.subtitle: WHEN THEY RING THE GOLDEN BELLS
stanza1: There’s a land beyond the river,
That we call the sweet forever,
And we only reach that shore by faith’s decree;
One by one we’ll gain the portals,
There to dwell with the immortals,
When they ring the golden bells for you and me.
stanza2: We shall know no sin or sorrow,
In that haven of tomorrow,
When our barque shall sail beyond the silver sea;
We shall only know the blessing
Of our Father’s sweet caressing,
When they ring the golden bells for you and me.
stanza3: When our days shall know their number,
When in death we sweetly slumber,
When the King commands the spirit to be free;
Nevermore with anguish laden,
We shall reach that lovely Aiden,
When they ring the golden bells for you and me.
chorus1: Don’t you hear the bells now ringing?
Don’t you here the angels singing?
’Tis the glory hallelujah Jubilee
In that far-off sweet forever,
Just beyond the shining river,
When they ring the golden bells for you and me
chorus2: Don’t you hear the bells now ringing?
Don’t you here the angels singing?
’Tis the glory hallelujah Jubilee
In that far-off sweet forever,
Just beyond the shining river,
When they ring the golden bells for you and me
chorus3: Don’t you hear the bells now ringing?
Don’t you here the angels singing?
’Tis the glory hallelujah Jubilee
In that far-off sweet forever,
Just beyond the shining river,
When they ring the golden bells for you and me

generalIndex.title: GHS 146
generalIndex.subtitle: FACE TO FACE
stanza1: Face to face with Christ, my Saviour,
Face to face -what will it be?
When with rapture I behold Him,
Jesus Christ who died for me!
stanza2: Only faintly now I see Him,
With the darkling veil between;
But a blessed day is coming,
When His glory shall be seen.
stanza3: What rejoicing in His presence,
When are banished grief and pain,
When the crooked ways are straightened
And the dark things shall be plain.
stanza4: Face to face - O blissful moment!
Face to face to see and know;
Face to face with my Redeemer,
Jesus Christ who loves me so!
chorus1: Face to face I shall behold Him,
Far beyond the starry sky;
Face to face, in all His glory,
I shall see Him by and by!
chorus2: Face to face I shall behold Him,
Far beyond the starry sky;
Face to face, in all His glory,
I shall see Him by and by!
chorus3: Face to face I shall behold Him,
Far beyond the starry sky;
Face to face, in all His glory,
I shall see Him by and by!
chorus4: Face to face I shall behold Him,
Far beyond the starry sky;
Face to face, in all His glory,
I shall see Him by and by!

generalIndex.title: GHS 147
generalIndex.subtitle: SWEET BY AND BY
stanza1: There’s a land that is fairer than day,
And by faith we can see it afar,
For the Father waits over the way
To prepare us a dwelling place there.
stanza2: We shall sing on that beautiful shore
The melodious songs of the blest;
And our spirits shall sorrow no more-
Not a sigh for the blessing of rest.
stanza3: To our bountiful Father above
We will offer our tribute of praise,
For the glorious gift of His love
And the blessings that hallow our days.
chorus1: In the sweet by and by,
We shall meet on that beautiful shore;
In the sweet by and by,
We shall meet on that beautiful shore.
chorus2: In the sweet by and by,
We shall meet on that beautiful shore;
In the sweet by and by,
We shall meet on that beautiful shore.
chorus3: In the sweet by and by,
We shall meet on that beautiful shore;
In the sweet by and by,
We shall meet on that beautiful shore.

generalIndex.title: GHS 148
generalIndex.subtitle: NO TEARS IN HEAVEN
stanza1: No tears in heaven, no sorrows given,
All will be glory in that land;
There’ll be no sadness, all will be gladness
When we shall join that happy band.
stanza2: Glory is waiting, waiting up yonder,
Where we shall spend an endless day;
There with our Saviour, we’ll be forever,
Where no more sorrow can dismay.
stanza3: Some morning yonder, we’ll cease to ponder
O’er things this life has bro’t to view;
All will be clearer, loved ones be dearer,
In heav’n where all will be made new.
chorus1: No tears, no tears, no tears up there,
Sorrow and pain will all have flown;
No tears, no tears, no tears up there,
No tears in heaven will be known.
chorus2: No tears, no tears, no tears up there,
Sorrow and pain will all have flown;
No tears, no tears, no tears up there,
No tears in heaven will be known.
chorus3: No tears, no tears, no tears up there,
Sorrow and pain will all have flown;
No tears, no tears, no tears up there,
No tears in heaven will be known.

generalIndex.title: GHS 149
generalIndex.subtitle: FARTHER ALONG
stanza1: Tempted and tried we’re oft made to wonder
Why it should be thus all the day long,
While there are others living about us,
Never molested tho’ in the wrong.
stanza2: When death has come and taken our loved ones,
It leaves our home so lonely and drear;
Then do we wonder why others prosper,
Living so wicked year after year.
stanza3: Faithful till death said our loving Master,
A few more days to labour and wait;
Toils of the road will then seem as nothing,
As we sweep thru the beautiful gate.
stanza4: When we see Jesus coming in glory,
When He comes from His home in the sky;
Then we shall meet Him in that bright mansion,
We’ll understand it all by and by.
chorus1: Farther along we’ll know all about it,
Farther along we’ll understand why;
Cheer up, my brother, live in the sunshine,
We’ll understand it all by and by.
chorus2: Farther along we’ll know all about it,
Farther along we’ll understand why;
Cheer up, my brother, live in the sunshine,
We’ll understand it all by and by.
chorus3: Farther along we’ll know all about it,
Farther along we’ll understand why;
Cheer up, my brother, live in the sunshine,
We’ll understand it all by and by.
chorus4: Farther along we’ll know all about it,
Farther along we’ll understand why;
Cheer up, my brother, live in the sunshine,
We’ll understand it all by and by.

generalIndex.title: GHS 150
generalIndex.subtitle: PENTECOSTAL POWER
stanza1: Lord, as of old at Pentecost
Thou didst thy pow’r display,
With cleansing, purifying flame
Descend on us today.
stanza2: For mighty works for Thee prepare,
And strengthen ev’ry heart:
Come, take possession of Thine own,
And never-more depart.
stanza3: All self consume, all sin destroy!
With earnest zeal endue
Each waiting heart to work for Thee;
O Lord, our faith renew!
stanza4: Speak, Lord! before Thy throne we wait,
Thy promise we believe,
And will not let Thee go until
The blessing we receive!
chorus1: Lord, send the old-time pow’r.
The Pentecostal pow’r!
Thy floodgates of blessing on us Throw open
wide!
Lord, send the old-time pow’r, the
pentecostal pow’r,
That sinners be converted and Thy name
glorified!
chorus2: Lord, send the old-time pow’r.
The Pentecostal pow’r!
Thy floodgates of blessing on us Throw open
wide!
Lord, send the old-time pow’r, the
pentecostal pow’r,
That sinners be converted and Thy name
glorified!
chorus3: Lord, send the old-time pow’r.
The Pentecostal pow’r!
Thy floodgates of blessing on us Throw open
wide!
Lord, send the old-time pow’r, the
pentecostal pow’r,
That sinners be converted and Thy name
glorified!
chorus4: Lord, send the old-time pow’r.
The Pentecostal pow’r!
Thy floodgates of blessing on us Throw open
wide!
Lord, send the old-time pow’r, the
pentecostal pow’r,
That sinners be converted and Thy name
glorified!

generalIndex.title: GHS 151
generalIndex.subtitle: THERE SHALL BE SHOWERS OF BLESSING
stanza1: “There shall be showers of blessing:”
This is the promise of love;
There shall be seasons refreshing,
Sent from the Saviour above.
stanza2: “There shall be showers of blessing:”
Precious reviving again;
Over the hills and the valleys,
Sound of abundance of rain.
stanza3: “There shall be showers of blessing:”
Send them upon us, O Lord!
Grant to us now a refreshing;
Come, and now honour Thy Word.
stanza4: “There shall be showers of blessing:”
Oh, that today they might fall,
Now, as to God we’re confessing,
Now as on Jesus we call!
stanza5: “There shall be showers of blessing:”
If we but trust and obey;
There shall be seasons refreshing,
If we let God have His way.
chorus1: Showers of blessing,
Showers of blessing we need;
Mercy drops round us are falling,
But for the showers we plead.
chorus2: Showers of blessing,
Showers of blessing we need;
Mercy drops round us are falling,
But for the showers we plead.
chorus3: Showers of blessing,
Showers of blessing we need;
Mercy drops round us are falling,
But for the showers we plead.
chorus4: Showers of blessing,
Showers of blessing we need;
Mercy drops round us are falling,
But for the showers we plead.
chorus5: Showers of blessing,
Showers of blessing we need;
Mercy drops round us are falling,
But for the showers we plead.

generalIndex.title: GHS 152
generalIndex.subtitle: JOYS ARE FLOWING LIKE A RIVER
stanza1: Joys are flowing like a river
Since the Comforter has come;
He abides with us for ever,
Makes the trusting heart His home.
stanza2: Bringing life, and health, and gladness,
All around this heav’nly Guest;
Banish’d unbelief and sadness,
Chang’d our weariness to rest.
stanza3: Like the rain that falls from heaven,
Like the sunlight from the sky,
So the Holy Ghost is given,
Coming on us from on high.
stanza4: What a wonderful salvation,
Where we always see His face;
What a perfect habitation,
What a quiet resting-place.
chorus1: Blessed quietness, holy quietness,
What assurance in my soul !
On the stormy sea, He speaks peace to me,
How the billows cease to roll.
chorus2: Blessed quietness, holy quietness,
What assurance in my soul !
On the stormy sea, He speaks peace to me,
How the billows cease to roll.
chorus3: Blessed quietness, holy quietness,
What assurance in my soul !
On the stormy sea, He speaks peace to me,
How the billows cease to roll.
chorus4: Blessed quietness, holy quietness,
What assurance in my soul !
On the stormy sea, He speaks peace to me,
How the billows cease to roll.

generalIndex.title: GHS 153
generalIndex.subtitle: WITH SIGNS FOLLOWING
stanza1: When first the risen Lord of pow’r
His chosen ones sent forth,
A charge He gave, that solemn hour,
To preach His saving worth.
“Go ye,’’ said He, “to all mankind;
Declare My Word, and ye shall find:
These signs shall surely follow them
Who on My Name believe.’’
stanza2: “No demons shall before them stand,
No poison do them harm;
Nor subtle serpent in their hand
Cause pain or dread alarm.”
For Satan’s kingdom He o’ercame,
To give His people right to claim:
“These signs shall surely follow them
Who on My Name believe.”
stanza3: “They shall with other tongues declare
The wonders of their God:
The sick beneath their hands, by prayer,
Shall rise, to prove My Word,”
So let it be ! Firm as His Throne
Stands this clear promise to His own:
“These signs shall surely follow them
Who on My Name believe.”
stanza4: Crowned with the flame of Pentecost,
A faithful, fearless band
Proclaimed His Name: a ransomed host
Arose from every land.
The Lord worked with them from on High,
His proven Word could none deny:
“These signs shall surely follow them
Who on My Name believe.”
stanza5: No word of Thine is void of power;
No promise, Lord, is vain.
Be this a Pentecostal hour -
Confirm Thy Word again!
Nor can’st Thou fail! Thou art the same
As when of old Thou did’st proclaim:
“These signs shall surely follow them
Who on My Name believe.”

generalIndex.title: GHS 154
generalIndex.subtitle: GIVE ME A DOUBLE PORTION
stanza1: Long ago in days of old, stood a man of God we’re told,
As he talked to Elijah that day;
His request he did repeat, standing at Elijah’s feet,
“A double portion” I can hear him say.
stanza2: As Elijah stood that day, to Elisha he did say,
“Ask me what I shall do unto thee”
And Elisha then replied, walking at Elijah’s side,
“A double portion, let it fall on me.”
stanza3: Lord, I always to Thee pray, just for strength from day to day,
But I see there’s so much to be done,
That I have to kneel a new and this favour ask of You,
A double portion this fight must be won.
chorus1: Give me, Lord, a double portion,
pour Thy Spirit on me,
Thru eyes of faith Thy wondrous works I can see;
But I need Thy helping hand,
In this troubled, sinful land,
Give me, Lord, a double portion from Thee.
chorus2: Give me, Lord, a double portion,
pour Thy Spirit on me,
Thru eyes of faith Thy wondrous works I can see;
But I need Thy helping hand,
In this troubled, sinful land,
Give me, Lord, a double portion from Thee.
chorus3: Give me, Lord, a double portion,
pour Thy Spirit on me,
Thru eyes of faith Thy wondrous works I can see;
But I need Thy helping hand,
In this troubled, sinful land,
Give me, Lord, a double portion from Thee.

generalIndex.title: GHS 225
generalIndex.subtitle: BURN, FIRE OF GOD!
stanza1: Burn, fire of God! my ransomed soul possessing;
Pure fire Thou art, and I would dwell in Thee.
Light of my life, true source of ev’ry blessing,
Grant all my days one holy flame to be.
stanza2: Burn, fire of God! Thy grace and glory knowing,
My cleansed heart shall be all fire within:
Love all-constraining, tenderness o’erflowing,
One kindling passion other lives to win.
stanza3: Burn, fire of God! Thy cloven tongue bestowing,
Baptizing me with heavenly energy.
Touched with live coals from off Thine altar glowing,
My purged lips shall speak alone of Thee.
stanza4: Burn, fire of God! with seven-fold refining,
Till mirrored from my deeps Thine eyes shall see.
In purest gold Thy perfect image shining:
Thy Christ revealed in clear irradiancy.
stanza5: Burn, fire of God! by Thine own love transcending,
Let all I hold be Thine, and Thine alone!
Heart, mind and will, a sacrifice ascending,
Consumed by fire from out Thy fiery Throne.

generalIndex.title: GHS 230
generalIndex.subtitle: BRING YOUR VESSELS NOT A FEW
stanza1: Are you looking for the fullness of blessing
of the Lord
In your heart and life today?
Claim the promise of your Father,
come according to His word,
In the blessed old-time way.
stanza2: Bring your empty earthen vessels, clean thro’
Jesus’ precious blood,
And in human consecration wait before the
throne of God,
Till the Holy Ghost shall fall.
stanza3: Like the cruse of oil unfailing is His grace
forever more,
And His love unchanging still;
And according to His promise with the
Holy Ghost and power,
He will every vessel fill.
chorus1: He will fill your heart today to overflowing,
As the Lord commandeth you,
“Bring your vessels, not a few;”
He will fill your heart today to overflowing
With the Holy Ghost and power.
chorus2: He will fill your heart today to overflowing,
As the Lord commandeth you,
“Bring your vessels, not a few;”
He will fill your heart today to overflowing
With the Holy Ghost and power.
chorus3: He will fill your heart today to overflowing,
As the Lord commandeth you,
“Bring your vessels, not a few;”
He will fill your heart today to overflowing
With the Holy Ghost and power.

generalIndex.title: GHS 234
generalIndex.subtitle: O LORD, “WITH ONE ACCORD”.
stanza1: O Lord, “with one accord,”
We gather round Thy Throne,
To hear Thy holy Word,
To worship Thee alone.
Now send from heaven the Holy Ghost,
Be this another Pentecost!
stanza2: We have no strength to meet
The storms that round us lower,
Keep Thou our trembling feet
In every trying hour;
More than victorious shall we be
If girded with Thy panoply.
stanza3: Where is the mighty wind
That shook the holy place,
That gladdened every mind,
And brightened every face?
And where the cloven tongues of flame
That marked each follower of the Lamb?
stanza4: There is no change in Thee,
Lord God the Holy Ghost,
Thy glorious majesty
Is as at Pentecost!
O may our loosened tongues proclaim,
That Thou, our God, art still the same.
stanza5: And may that living wave,
That issues from on high,
Whose golden waters lave
Thy throne eternally:
Flow down in power on us to-day,
And none shall go unblessed away!
stanza6: Until we hear the Bridegroom say,
“Rise up my love, and come away”.

generalIndex.title: GHS 235
generalIndex.subtitle: THE HOLY SPIRIT’S POWER
stanza1: “The Holy Spirit’s power
Ye need,” the Master said;
“So wait till comes the hour
When on you He is shed.”
So praise did all their souls employ
As tarried they with fervent joy.
stanza2: And when ten days were passed
With one accord were they,
Heaven’s windows long closed fast,
Were opened on that day;
With rushing mighty wind and flame,
The promised Holy Spirit came.
stanza3: Their loosened tongues were filled
With strange and wondrous words;
Heaven’s life their hearts had thrilled,
God’s goodness they declared;
“And unto all,” th’ Apostle said,
“Is the like gift, since Christ has bled.”
stanza4: Come now, ye sons of men,
This message now receive,
The Holy Spirit’s given
To all who will believe;
Ye, too, may know His mighty power,
And speak with tongues this very hour.
stanza5: Then charity divine,
Your yearning hearts shall fill
T’wards those who now repine,
Held in sin’s bondage still;
For these your zeal shall never tire
To snatch them from th’ e’erlasting fire.

generalIndex.title: GHS 236
generalIndex.subtitle: LORD GOD, THE HOLY GHOST
stanza1: Lord God, the Holy Ghost,
In this accepted hour,
As on the day of Pentecost,
Descend in all Thy power!
stanza2: We meet with one accord
In our appointed place,
And wait the promise of our Lord,
The Spirit of all grace.
stanza3: Like mighty rushing wind
Upon the waves beneath,
Move with one impulse every mind,
One soul, one feeling breathe.
stanza4: The young, the old, inspire
With wisdom from above,
And give us hearts and tongues of fire
To pray, and praise, and love.
stanza5: Spirit of Light, explore
And chase our gloom away,
With lustre shining more and more
Unto the perfect day!
stanza6: In life and death our Guide!

generalIndex.title: GHS 255
generalIndex.subtitle: LET THE FIRE FALL
stanza1: They were gathered in the upper chamber,
As commanded by the risen Lord,
And the promise of the Father,
There they sought with one accord,
When the Holy Ghost from heaven descended,
Like a rushing wimd and tongues of fire:
So Dear Lord, we seek Thy blessing,
Come with Glory now our hearts Inspire.
stanza2: As Elijah we should raise the alter
For our testimony clear and true,
Christ the Saviour, Loving Healer,
Coming Lord, Baptizer too,
Ever Flowing grace and full salvation,
for a ruined race Thy love has plann'd;
For This blessed Revelation;
For Thy written word we dare to stand.
stanza3: 'Tis the covenanted promise given
To as many as the lord shall call,
To the fathers and their children,
To Thy people, one and all;
So rejoicing in thy word unfailing
We draw nigh in faith Thy power to know
Come, O Come, Thou burning Spirit,
Set our hearts with heavenly fire aglow.
stanza4: With a living coal from off Thy alter
Touch our lips to swell Thy wondrous praise,
To extol Thee, bless, adore Thee
And our songs of worship raise;
Let the cloud of glory now descending
Fill our hearts with holy ecstasy,
Come in all Thy glorious fullness,
Blessed Holy Spirit, have Thy way.
chorus1: Let the fire fall,Let the fire fall,
Let the fire from Heaven fall
We are waiting and expecting,
Now in faith, dear Lord, we call;
Let the Fire fall, let the fire Fall,
On Thy promise we depend;
From the glory of thy presence
Let the Pentecostal fire decend.
chorus2: Let the fire fall,Let the fire fall,
Let the fire from Heaven fall
We are waiting and expecting,
Now in faith, dear Lord, we call;
Let the Fire fall, let the fire Fall,
On Thy promise we depend;
From the glory of thy presence
Let the Pentecostal fire decend.
chorus3: Let the fire fall,Let the fire fall,
Let the fire from Heaven fall
We are waiting and expecting,
Now in faith, dear Lord, we call;
Let the Fire fall, let the fire Fall,
On Thy promise we depend;
From the glory of thy presence
Let the Pentecostal fire decend.
chorus4: Let the fire fall,Let the fire fall,
Let the fire from Heaven fall
We are waiting and expecting,
Now in faith, dear Lord, we call;
Let the Fire fall, let the fire Fall,
On Thy promise we depend;
From the glory of thy presence
Let the Pentecostal fire decend.

generalIndex.title: GHS 155
generalIndex.subtitle: LET JESUS COME INTO YOUR HEART
stanza1: If you are tired of the load of your sin,
Let Jesus come into your heart;;
If you desire a new life to begin,
Let Jesus come into your heart.
stanza2: If ’tis for purity now that you sigh,
Let Jesus come into your heart;
Fountains for cleansing are flowing nearby,
Let Jesus come into your heart.
stanza3: If there’s a temptest your voice cannot still,
Let Jesus come into your heart;
If there’s a void this world never can fill,
Let Jesus come into your heart.
stanza4: If you would join the glad songs of the blest,
Let Jesus come into your heart;
If you would enter the mansions of rest,
Let Jesus come into your heart.
chorus1: Just now, your doubtings give o’er;
Just now, reject Him no more;
Just now, throw open the door;
Let Jesus come into your heart.
chorus2: Just now, your doubtings give o’er;
Just now, reject Him no more;
Just now, throw open the door;
Let Jesus come into your heart.
chorus3: Just now, your doubtings give o’er;
Just now, reject Him no more;
Just now, throw open the door;
Let Jesus come into your heart.
chorus4: Just now, your doubtings give o’er;
Just now, reject Him no more;
Just now, throw open the door;
Let Jesus come into your heart.

generalIndex.title: GHS 156
generalIndex.subtitle: ROOM AT THE CROSS FOR YOU
stanza1: The cross upon which Jesus died
Is a shelter in which we can hide,
“And its grace so free is sufficient for me,”
And deep is its fountain; as wide as the sea.
stanza2: Tho’ millions have found Him a Friend
And have turned from the sins they have sinned,
The Saviour still waits to open the gates,
And welcome a sinner before it’s too late.
stanza3: The hand of my Saviour is strong,
And the love of my Saviour is long,
Through sunshine or rain through loss or in gain,
The blood flows from Calv’ry to cleanse ev’ry stain.
chorus1: There’s room at the cross for you,
There’s room at the cross for you,
Tho’ millions have come
There’s still room for one ,
Yes, there’s room at the cross for you.
chorus2: There’s room at the cross for you,
There’s room at the cross for you,
Tho’ millions have come
There’s still room for one ,
Yes, there’s room at the cross for you.
chorus3: There’s room at the cross for you,
There’s room at the cross for you,
Tho’ millions have come
There’s still room for one ,
Yes, there’s room at the cross for you.

generalIndex.title: GHS 157
generalIndex.subtitle: WANDERING CHILD, O COME HOME
stanza1: Have you wandered away from your Father’s care,
Heavy-hearted and sad do you roam?
There’s a sweet gentle voice calling now to you -
Wand’ring child, wand’ring child, O, come home.
stanza2: Is your frail bark adrift on life’s raging sea,
Are you tossed on its billows and foam?
There’s a safe harbour home, waiting now for you -
Wand’ring child, wand’ring child, O, come home.
stanza3: He is pleading today, heed His gentle voice,
As He bids you no longer to roam,
To that dear Father’s house haste without delay -
Wand’ring child, wand’ring child, O, come home.
chorus1: Child, come home, child, come home,
Wand’ring child, why longer roam?
’Tis thy Father entreats,
Wand’ring child, O, come home.
chorus2: Child, come home, child, come home,
Wand’ring child, why longer roam?
’Tis thy Father entreats,
Wand’ring child, O, come home.
chorus3: Child, come home, child, come home,
Wand’ring child, why longer roam?
’Tis thy Father entreats,
Wand’ring child, O, come home.

generalIndex.title: GHS 158
generalIndex.subtitle: COME BELIEVING
stanza1: Once again the Gospel message,
From the Saviour you have heard;
Will you heed the invitation?
Will you turn and seek the Lord?
stanza2: Many summers you have wasted,
Ripen’d harvests you have seen;
Winter snows by Spring have melted:
Yet you linger in your sin.
stanza3: Jesus for your choice is waiting;
Tarry not: at once decide!
While the Spirit now is striving,
Yield, and seek the Saviour’s side.
stanza4: Cease of fitness to be thinking;
Do not longer try to feel !
It is trusting, and not feeling,
That will give the Spirit’s seal.
stanza5: Let your will to God be given,
Trust in Christ’s atoning blood;
Look to Jesus now in heaven,
Rest on His unchanging word.
