chorus1: Come believing! come believing!
Come to Jesus! look and live!...
Come believing! come believing!
Come to Jesus! look and live!
chorus2: Come believing! come believing!
Come to Jesus! look and live!...
Come believing! come believing!
Come to Jesus! look and live!
chorus3: Come believing! come believing!
Come to Jesus! look and live!...
Come believing! come believing!
Come to Jesus! look and live!
chorus4: Come believing! come believing!
Come to Jesus! look and live!...
Come believing! come believing!
Come to Jesus! look and live!
chorus5: Come believing! come believing!
Come to Jesus! look and live!...
Come believing! come believing!
Come to Jesus! look and live!

generalIndex.title: GHS 159
generalIndex.subtitle: WHY DO YOU WAIT?
stanza1: Why do you wait, dear brother,
Oh, why do you tarry so long?
Your Saviour is waiting to give you
A place in His sanctified throng.
stanza2: What do you hope, dear brother,
To gain by a further delay?
There’s no one to save you but Jesus,
There’s no other way but His way.
stanza3: Do you not feel, dear brother,
His Spirit now striving within?
Oh, why not accept His salvation,
And throw off your burden of sin?
stanza4: Why do you wait, dear brother?
The harvest is passing away;
Your Saviour is longing to bless you,
There’s danger and death in delay!
chorus1: Why not? Why not?
Why not come to Him now? (2ce).
chorus2: Why not? Why not?
Why not come to Him now? (2ce).
chorus3: Why not? Why not?
Why not come to Him now? (2ce).
chorus4: Why not? Why not?
Why not come to Him now? (2ce).

generalIndex.title: GHS 160
generalIndex.subtitle: THE SHEPHERD OF LOVE
stanza1: The Shepherd of Love is seeking the lost
In paths that are rough and steep;
He’s calling the lambs that have gone astray,
He’s calling, calling His sheep.
stanza2: The Shepherd of Love knows His sheep by name,
And tenderly leads the way;
O weary one, come to the Shepherd’s fold,
He’s calling, calling today.
stanza3: The Shepherd of Love our ransom hath paid,
And offers salvation free;
He’s patiently waiting for thee to come,
He’s calling, calling for thee.
stanza4: The Shepherd of Love now seeketh His sheep,
He seeketh whate’er the cost;
Behold, He is calling the wand’rer home,
He’s calling, calling the lost.
chorus1: Out of your darkness of sin and shame,
Into His love, forever the same;
Come to Him now, believe on His name,
O answer the call today.
chorus2: Out of your darkness of sin and shame,
Into His love, forever the same;
Come to Him now, believe on His name,
O answer the call today.
chorus3: Out of your darkness of sin and shame,
Into His love, forever the same;
Come to Him now, believe on His name,
O answer the call today.
chorus4: Out of your darkness of sin and shame,
Into His love, forever the same;
Come to Him now, believe on His name,
O answer the call today.

generalIndex.title: GHS 161
generalIndex.subtitle: WHO’LL BE THE NEXT?
stanza1: Who’ll be the next to follow Jesus?
Who’ll be the next His cross to bear?
Someone is ready, someone is waiting,
Who’ll be the next a crown to wear?
stanza2: Who’ll be the next to follow Jesus?
Come and bow at His precious feet.
Who’ll be the next to lay every burden
Down at the Father’s Mercy seat?
stanza3: Who’ll be the next to follow Jesus?
Who’ll be the next to praise His name?
Who’ll swell the chorus1 of free redemption,
Sing, Hallelujah! Praise the Lamb?
chorus1: Who’ll be the next, who’ll be the next,
Who’ll be the next to follow Jesus?
Who’ll be the next to follow Jesus now? -
Follow Jesus now?
chorus2: Who’ll be the next, who’ll be the next,
Who’ll be the next to follow Jesus?
Who’ll be the next to follow Jesus now? -
Follow Jesus now?
chorus3: Who’ll be the next, who’ll be the next,
Who’ll be the next to follow Jesus?
Who’ll be the next to follow Jesus now? -
Follow Jesus now?

generalIndex.title: GHS 162
generalIndex.subtitle: ALMOST PERSUADED
stanza1: “Almost persuaded:” now to believe;
“Almost persuaded:” Christ to receive;
Seems now some soul to say,
“Go, Spirit, go Thy way:
Some more convenient day
On Thee I’ll call.’’
stanza2: “Almost persuaded:” come, come today!
“Almost persuaded:” turn not away!
Jesus invites you here,
Angels are lingering near,
Prayers rise from heart so dear,
O wanderer, come!
stanza3: “Almost persuaded:’’ harvest is past!
“Almost persuaded:’’ doom comes at last!
“Almost’’ cannot avail;
“Almost’’ is but to fail:
Sad, sad, that bitter wail -
“Almost’’ - but lost!

generalIndex.title: GHS 228
generalIndex.subtitle: O WHY NOT TONIGHT?
stanza1: O do not let the word depart,
And close thine eyes against the light;
Poor sinner, harden not your heart,
Be saved, O tonight
stanza2: Tomorrow’s sun may never rise,
To bless thy long deluded sight;
This is the time, O then be wise,
Be saved, O tonight.
stanza3: Our Lord in pity lingers still,
And with thou thus His love requite?
Renounce at once thy stubborn will,
Be saved, O tonight.
stanza4: Our blessed Lord refuses none
Who would to Him their souls unite;
Believe, obey, the work is done,
Be saved, O tonight.
chorus1: O why not to-night? O why not to-night?
Wilt thou be saved?
Then why not to-night?
chorus2: O why not to-night? O why not to-night?
Wilt thou be saved?
Then why not to-night?
chorus3: O why not to-night? O why not to-night?
Wilt thou be saved?
Then why not to-night?
chorus4: O why not to-night? O why not to-night?
Wilt thou be saved?
Then why not to-night?

generalIndex.title: GHS 260
generalIndex.subtitle: GRACIOUS SPIRIT, DWELL WITH ME
stanza1: Gracious Spirit, dwell with me!
I myself would gracious be,
And with words that help and heal
Would Thy life in mine reveal;
And with actions bold and meek
Would for Christ my Saviour speak.
stanza2: Truthful Spirit, dwell with me!
I myself would truthful be;
And with wisdom kind and clear
Let Thy life in mine appear;
And with actions brotherly
Speak my Lord's sincerity.
stanza3: Tender Spirit, dwell with me!
I myself would tender be;
Shut my heart up like a flower
In temptations darksome hour,
Open it when the sun shines,
And his love by fragrance own.
stanza4: Mighty Spirit, dwell with me!
I myself would mighty be;
Mighty so as to prevail,
Where unaided man must fail;
Ever, by a mighty hope,
Pressing on and bearing up.
stanza5: Holy Spirit, dwell with me!
I myself would holy be;
Seperate from sin, I would
Choose and cherish all things good,
And whatever I can be
Give to Him Who gave me Thee!

generalIndex.title: GHS 163
generalIndex.subtitle: MY GOD, IS ANY HOUR SO SWEET?
stanza1: My God, is any hour so sweet,
From blush of morn to evening star,
As that which calls me to Thy feet,
The hour of prayer?.
stanza2: Blest be that tranquil hour of morn,
And blest that hour of solemn eve,
When, on the wings of prayer upborne,
The world I leave.
stanza3: For then a day-spring shines on me,
Brighter than morn’s ethereal glow;
And richer dews descend from Thee
Than earth can know.
stanza4: Then is my strength by Thee renewed;
Then are my sins by Thee forgiven;
Then dost Thou cheer my solitude
With hope of heaven.
stanza5: No word can tell what blest relief,
There for my every want I find;
What strength for warfare, balm for grief;
What peace of mind.
stanza6: Hushed is each doubt, gone every fear;
My spirit seems in heaven to stay;
stanza7: Lord, till I reach Your blissful shore,
No privilege so dear shall be,
As thus my inmost soul to pour

generalIndex.title: GHS 164
generalIndex.subtitle: PRAYER IS THE SOUL’S SINCERE DESIRE
stanza1: Prayer is the soul’s sincere desire,
Uttered or unexpressed!
The motion of a hidden fire
That trembles in the breast.
stanza2: Prayer is the burden of a sigh,
The falling of a tear,
The upward glancing of an eye,
When none but God is near.
stanza3: Prayer is the simplest form of speech
That infant lips can try;
Prayer the sublimest strains that reach
The majesty on high.
stanza4: Prayer is the contrite sinner’s voice
Returning from his ways
While angels in their songs rejoice,
And cry; Behold he prays!
stanza5: Prayer is the Christian’s vital breath,
The Christian’s native air,
His watchword at the gates of death;
He enters heaven with prayer.
stanza6: O Thou by whom we come to God,
The Life, the Truth, the Way!
The path of prayer Thyself has trod:
Lord! teach us how to pray.

generalIndex.title: GHS 165
generalIndex.subtitle: GUIDE ME, O THOU GREAT JEHOVAH
stanza1: Guide me, O Thou Great Jehovah!
Pilgrim thro’ this barren land;
I am weak, but Thou art mighty,
Hold me with Thy pow’rful hand:
Bread of heaven! (2ce)
Feed me now and ever more. (2ce)
stanza2: Open now, the crystal fountain,
Whence the healing stream doth flow:
Let the fiery, cloudy pillar
Lead me all my journey through:
Strong Deliverer! (2ce)
Be Thou still my strength and shield.(2ce)
stanza3: If I tread the verge of Jordan,
Bid my anxious fears subside:
Bear me through the swelling torrent,
Land me safe on Canaan’s side:
Songs of praises! (2ce)
I will ever give to Thee. (2ce)
stanza4: Saviour, come! we long to see Thee,
Long to dwell with Thee above;
And to know in full communion,
All the sweetness of Thy love.
Come, Lord Jesus! (2ce)
Take Thy waiting people home.(2ce)

generalIndex.title: GHS 166
generalIndex.subtitle: DID YOU THINK TO PRAY?
stanza1: Ere you left your room this morning
Did you think to pray?
In the name of Christ, our Saviour,
Did you sue for loving favour,
As a shield today?
stanza2: When you met with great temptation
Did you think to pray?
By His dying love and merit
Did you claim the Holy Spirit
As your guide and stay?
stanza3: When your heart was overburdened
Did you think to pray?
Did you plead for grace, my brother,
That you might forgive another
Who had crossed your way?
stanza4: When sore trials came upon you
Did you think to pray?
When your soul was bowed in sorrow,
Balm of Gilead did you borrow
At the gates today?
chorus1: O how praying rests the weary!
Prayer will change the night to day,
So, when life seems dark and dreary,
Don’t forget to pray.
chorus2: O how praying rests the weary!
Prayer will change the night to day,
So, when life seems dark and dreary,
Don’t forget to pray.
chorus3: O how praying rests the weary!
Prayer will change the night to day,
So, when life seems dark and dreary,
Don’t forget to pray.
chorus4: O how praying rests the weary!
Prayer will change the night to day,
So, when life seems dark and dreary,
Don’t forget to pray.

generalIndex.title: GHS 167
generalIndex.subtitle: I MUST TELL JESUS
stanza1: I must tell Jesus all of my trials;
I cannot bear these burdens alone;
In my distress He kindly will help me;
He ever loves and cares for His own.
stanza2: I must tell Jesus all of my troubles;
He is a kind, compassionate Friend;
If I but ask Him, He will deliver,
Make of my troubles quickly an end.
stanza3: Tempted and tried I need a great Saviour,
One who can help my burdens to bear;
I must tell Jesus, I must tell Jesus;
He all my cares and sorrows will share.
stanza4: O how the world to evil allures me!
O how my heart is tempted to sin!
I must tell Jesus, and He will help me
Over the world the vict’ry to win.
chorus1: I must tell Jesus! I must tell Jesus!
I cannot bear my burdens alone:
I must tell Jesus! I must tell Jesus!
Jesus can help me, Jesus alone.
chorus2: I must tell Jesus! I must tell Jesus!
I cannot bear my burdens alone:
I must tell Jesus! I must tell Jesus!
Jesus can help me, Jesus alone.
chorus3: I must tell Jesus! I must tell Jesus!
I cannot bear my burdens alone:
I must tell Jesus! I must tell Jesus!
Jesus can help me, Jesus alone.
chorus4: I must tell Jesus! I must tell Jesus!
I cannot bear my burdens alone:
I must tell Jesus! I must tell Jesus!
Jesus can help me, Jesus alone.

generalIndex.title: GHS 168
generalIndex.subtitle: I NEED THEE EVERY HOUR
stanza1: I need Thee ev’ry hour,
Most gracious Lord;
No tender voice like Thine
Can peace afford.
stanza2: I need Thee every hour,
Stay Thou near by;
Temptations lose their power
When Thou art nigh.
stanza3: I need Thee every hour,
In joy or pain;
Come quickly and abide,
Or life is vain.
stanza4: I need Thee every hour,
Teach me Thy will;
And Thy rich promises
In me fulfil.
stanza5: I need Thee every hour,
Most Holy One;
Oh, make me Thine indeed,
Thou blessed Son!
chorus1: I need Thee, oh, I need Thee,
Ev’ry hour I need Thee;
Oh, bless me now, my Saviour,
I come to Thee!
chorus2: I need Thee, oh, I need Thee,
Ev’ry hour I need Thee;
Oh, bless me now, my Saviour,
I come to Thee!
chorus3: I need Thee, oh, I need Thee,
Ev’ry hour I need Thee;
Oh, bless me now, my Saviour,
I come to Thee!
chorus4: I need Thee, oh, I need Thee,
Ev’ry hour I need Thee;
Oh, bless me now, my Saviour,
I come to Thee!
chorus5: I need Thee, oh, I need Thee,
Ev’ry hour I need Thee;
Oh, bless me now, my Saviour,
I come to Thee!

generalIndex.title: GHS 169
generalIndex.subtitle: WHAT A FRIEND WE HAVE IN JESUS
stanza1: What a Friend we have in Jesus,
All our sins and griefs to bear;
What a privilege to carry
Ev’rything to God in prayer.
O, what peace we often forfeit,
Oh, what needless pain we bear -
All because we do not carry
Ev’rything to God in prayer.
stanza2: Have we trials and temptations?
Is there trouble anywhere?
We should never be discouraged,
Take it to the Lord in prayer.
Can we find a Friend so faithful,
Who will all our sorrows share?
Jesus knows our every weakness,
Take it to the Lord in prayer.
stanza3: Are we weak and heavy laden,
Cumbered with a load of care?
Precious Saviour, still our refuge, -
Take it to the Lord in prayer.
Do thy friends despise, forsake thee?
Take it to the Lord in prayer;
In His arms He’ll take and shield thee,
Thou wilt find a solace there.

generalIndex.title: GHS 170
generalIndex.subtitle: SWEET HOUR OF PRAYER
stanza1: Sweet hour of prayer! sweet hour of prayer!
That calls me from a world of care
And bids me at my Father’s throne
Make all my wants and wishes known;
In seasons of distress and grief,
My soul has often found relief,
And oft escaped the tempter’s snare
By thy return, sweet hour of prayer.
stanza2: Sweet hour of prayer! sweet hour of prayer!
Thy wings shall my petition bear
To Him whose truth and faithfulness
Engage the waiting soul to bless;
And since He bids me seek His face,
Believe His Word and trust His grace,
I’ll cast on Him my every care,
And wait for thee, sweet hour of prayer.
stanza3: Sweet hour of prayer! sweet hour of prayer!
May I thy consolation share,
Till, from Mount Pisgah’s lofty height,
I view my home, and take my flight:
This robe of flesh I’ll drop, and rise
To seize the everlasting prize;
And shout, while passing through the air,
Farewell, farewell, sweet hour of prayer.

generalIndex.title: GHS 171
generalIndex.subtitle: PASS ME NOT
stanza1: Pass me not, O gentle Saviour,
Hear my humble cry;
While on others Thou art calling,
Do not pass me by.
stanza2: Let me at Thy throne of mercy,
Find a sweet relief;
Kneeling there in deep contrition,
Help my unbelief.
stanza3: Trusting only in Thy merit,
Would I seek Thy face;
Heal my wounded, broken spirit,
Save me by Thy grace.
stanza4: Thou the spring of all my comfort,
More than life to me,
Whom have I on earth beside Thee?
Whom in heaven but Thee?
chorus1: Saviour, Saviour,
Hear my humble cry;
While on others Thou art calling,
Do not pass me by.
chorus2: Saviour, Saviour,
Hear my humble cry;
While on others Thou art calling,
Do not pass me by.
chorus3: Saviour, Saviour,
Hear my humble cry;
While on others Thou art calling,
Do not pass me by.
chorus4: Saviour, Saviour,
Hear my humble cry;
While on others Thou art calling,
Do not pass me by.

generalIndex.title: GHS 258
generalIndex.subtitle: OH,TO BE LIKE THEE
stanza1: Oh, to be like Thee, blessed Redeemer,
This is my onstant longing and prayer;
Gladly I'll forfiet all of earth's treasures,
Jesus, Thy perfect likeness to wear.
stanza2: Oh, to be like Thee, full of compassion,
Loving, forgiving, tender and kind,
Helping the helpless, cheering the fainting,
Seeking the wand'ring sinner to find.
stanza3: Oh, to be like Thee, lowly in spirit,
Holy and harmless, paient and brave;
Meekly enduring cruel reproaches,
Willing to suffer, others to save.
stanza4: Oh, to be like Thee, Lord I am coming,
Now to recieve th' anointing divine;
All that I am and have I am bringing,
Lord, from this moment all shall be Thine.
stanza5: Oh, to be like Thee, while I am pleading,
Pour out Thy spirit, fill with Thy love,
Make me a temple meet for Thy dwelling,
Fit me for life and Heaven above.
chorus1: Oh, to be like Thee, oh! to be like Thee,
Blessed Redeemer, pure as Thou art;
Come in Thy sweetness, come in Thy fullness,
Stamp Thine own image deep on my heart.
chorus2: Oh, to be like Thee, oh! to be like Thee,
Blessed Redeemer, pure as Thou art;
Come in Thy sweetness, come in Thy fullness,
Stamp Thine own image deep on my heart.
chorus3: Oh, to be like Thee, oh! to be like Thee,
Blessed Redeemer, pure as Thou art;
Come in Thy sweetness, come in Thy fullness,
Stamp Thine own image deep on my heart.
chorus4: Oh, to be like Thee, oh! to be like Thee,
Blessed Redeemer, pure as Thou art;
Come in Thy sweetness, come in Thy fullness,
Stamp Thine own image deep on my heart.
chorus5: Oh, to be like Thee, oh! to be like Thee,
Blessed Redeemer, pure as Thou art;
Come in Thy sweetness, come in Thy fullness,
Stamp Thine own image deep on my heart.

generalIndex.title: GHS 172
generalIndex.subtitle: WHEN THE ROLL IS CALLED UP YONDER
stanza1: When the trumpet of the Lord shall sound,
and time shall be no more,
And the morning breaks, eternal, bright and fair;
When the saved of earth shall gather over on the
other shore,
And the roll is called up yonder, I’ll be there.
stanza2: On that bright and cloudless morning
when the dead in Christ shall rise,
And the glory of His resurrection share;
When His chosen ones shall gather to their
home beyond the skies,
And the roll is called up yonder, I’ll be there.
stanza3: Let us labour for the Master from the dawn
till setting sun,
Let us talk of all His wondrous love and care,
Then, when all of life is over, and our work
on earth is done,
And the roll is called up yonder, I’ll be there.
chorus1: When the roll... is called up yon... der,
When the roll... is called up yon... der,
When the roll... is called up yon... der,
When the roll is called up yonder, I’ll be there.
chorus2: When the roll... is called up yon... der,
When the roll... is called up yon... der,
When the roll... is called up yon... der,
When the roll is called up yonder, I’ll be there.
chorus3: When the roll... is called up yon... der,
When the roll... is called up yon... der,
When the roll... is called up yon... der,
When the roll is called up yonder, I’ll be there.

generalIndex.title: GHS 173
generalIndex.subtitle: IS IT THE CROWNING DAY?
stanza1: Jesus may come today, Glad day! Glad day!
And I would see my Friend;
Dangers and troubles would end
If Jesus should come today.
stanza2: I may go home today, Glad day! Glad day!
Seemeth I hear their song;
Hail to the radiant throng!
If I should go home today.
stanza3: Why should I anxious be? Glad day! Glad day!
Lights appear on the shore,
Storms will affright nevermore,
For He is ‘‘at hand” today.
stanza4: Faithful I’ll be today, Glad day! Glad day!
And I will freely tell
Why I should love Him so well,
For He is my all today.
chorus1: Glad day! Glad day!
Is it the crowning day?
I’ll live for today, nor anxious be,
Jesus, my Lord, I soon shall see;
Glad day! Glad day!
Is it the crowning day?
chorus2: Glad day! Glad day!
Is it the crowning day?
I’ll live for today, nor anxious be,
Jesus, my Lord, I soon shall see;
Glad day! Glad day!
Is it the crowning day?
chorus3: Glad day! Glad day!
Is it the crowning day?
I’ll live for today, nor anxious be,
Jesus, my Lord, I soon shall see;
Glad day! Glad day!
Is it the crowning day?
chorus4: Glad day! Glad day!
Is it the crowning day?
I’ll live for today, nor anxious be,
Jesus, my Lord, I soon shall see;
Glad day! Glad day!
Is it the crowning day?

generalIndex.title: GHS 174
generalIndex.subtitle: JESUS IS COMING AGAIN
stanza1: Marvelous message we bring,
Glorious carol we sing,
Wonderful word of the King:
Jesus is coming again!...
stanza2: Forest and flower exclaim,
Mountain and meadow the same,
All earth and heaven proclaim:
Jesus is coming again!...
stanza3: Standing before Him at last,
Trial and trouble all past,
Crowns at His feet we will cast:
Jesus is coming again!...
chorus1: Coming again, coming again;
May be morning, may be noon,
May be evening and may be soon!
Coming again, coming again;
O what a wonderful day it will be!
Jesus is coming again!
chorus2: Coming again, coming again;
May be morning, may be noon,
May be evening and may be soon!
Coming again, coming again;
O what a wonderful day it will be!
Jesus is coming again!
chorus3: Coming again, coming again;
May be morning, may be noon,
May be evening and may be soon!
Coming again, coming again;
O what a wonderful day it will be!
Jesus is coming again!

generalIndex.title: GHS 175
generalIndex.subtitle: HE IS COMING AGAIN
stanza1: Lift up your heads, pilgrims aweary,
See day’s approach now crimson the sky;
Night shadows flee, and your Beloved,
Awaited with longing, at last draweth nigh.
stanza2: Dark was the night, sin warred against us!
Heavy the load of sorrow we bore;
But now we see signs of His coming; -
Our hearts glow within us, joy’s cup runneth o’er!
stanza3: O blessed hope! O blissful promise!
Filling our hearts with rapture divine;
O day of days! hail Thy appearing!
Thy transcendent glory forever shall shine!
stanza4: Even so, come, precious Lord Jesus;
Creation waits redemption to see;
Caught up in clouds, soon we shall meet Thee;
O blessed assurance, forever with Thee!
chorus1: He is coming again, He is coming again,
The very same Jesus, rejected of men;
He is coming again, He is coming again,
With pow’r and great glory, He is coming again!
chorus2: He is coming again, He is coming again,
The very same Jesus, rejected of men;
He is coming again, He is coming again,
With pow’r and great glory, He is coming again!
chorus3: He is coming again, He is coming again,
The very same Jesus, rejected of men;
He is coming again, He is coming again,
With pow’r and great glory, He is coming again!
chorus4: He is coming again, He is coming again,
The very same Jesus, rejected of men;
He is coming again, He is coming again,
With pow’r and great glory, He is coming again!

generalIndex.title: GHS 176
generalIndex.subtitle: CHRIST RETURNETH
stanza1: It may be at morn, when the day is awaking,
When sunlight thro’ darkness and shadow is breaking,
That Jesus will come in the fulness of glory,
To receive from the world “His own.”
stanza2: It may be at mid-day, it may be at twilight,
It may be, per chance, that the blackness of midnight
Will burst into light in the blaze of His glory,
When Jesus receives “His own.”
stanza3: While its hosts cry Hosanna, from heaven descending,
With glorified saints and the angels attending,
With grace on His brow, like a halo of glory,
Will Jesus receive “His own.”
stanza4: Oh, joy! oh, delight! should we go without dying,
No sickness, no sadness, no dread and no crying,
Caught up thro’ the clouds with our Lord into glory,
When Jesus receives “His own.”
chorus1: O Lord Jesus, how long, how long,
Ere we shout the glad song,
Christ returneth!
Hallelujah! hallelujah! Amen,
Hallelujah! Amen.
chorus2: O Lord Jesus, how long, how long,
Ere we shout the glad song,
Christ returneth!
Hallelujah! hallelujah! Amen,
Hallelujah! Amen.
chorus3: O Lord Jesus, how long, how long,
Ere we shout the glad song,
Christ returneth!
Hallelujah! hallelujah! Amen,
Hallelujah! Amen.
chorus4: O Lord Jesus, how long, how long,
Ere we shout the glad song,
Christ returneth!
Hallelujah! hallelujah! Amen,
Hallelujah! Amen.

generalIndex.title: GHS 177
generalIndex.subtitle: SEARCH ME, O GOD
stanza1: Search me, O God, and know my heart today;
Try me, O Lord, and know my thoughts I pray;
See if there be some wicked way in me,
Cleanse me from ev’ry sin and set me free.
stanza2: I praise Thee, Lord for cleansing me from sin;
Fulfil Thy Word, and make me pure within;
Fill me with fire, where once I burned with shame
Grant my desire to magnify Thy name.
stanza3: Lord, take my life, and make it wholly Thine;
Fill my poor heart with Thy great love divine;
Take all my will, my passion, self and pride;
I now surrender - Lord, in me abide.
stanza4: O Holy Ghost, revival comes from Thee;
Send a revival - start the work in me:
Thy Word declares Thou wilt supply our need;
For blessing now, O Lord, I humbly plead.

generalIndex.title: GHS 178
generalIndex.subtitle: FILL MY CUP, LORD
stanza1: Like the woman at the well I was seeking
For things that could not satisfy;
And then I heard my Saviour speaking:
“Draw from My well that never shall run dry.”
stanza2: There are millions in this world who are craving
The pleasure earthly things afford;
But none can match the wondrous treasure
That I find in Jesus Christ my Lord.
stanza3: So, my brother, if the things this world gave you
Leave hungers that won’t pass away;
My blessed Lord will come and save you,
If you kneel to Him and humbly pray:
chorus1: Fill my cup, Lord, - I lift it up, Lord!
Come and quench this thirsting of my soul;
Bread of heaven, feed me till I want no more -
Fill my cup, fill it up and make me whole!
chorus2: Fill my cup, Lord, - I lift it up, Lord!
Come and quench this thirsting of my soul;
Bread of heaven, feed me till I want no more -
Fill my cup, fill it up and make me whole!
chorus3: Fill my cup, Lord, - I lift it up, Lord!
Come and quench this thirsting of my soul;
Bread of heaven, feed me till I want no more -
Fill my cup, fill it up and make me whole!

generalIndex.title: GHS 179
generalIndex.subtitle: HIGHER GROUND
stanza1: I’m pressing on the upward way,
New heights I’m gaining ev’ry day;
Still praying as I onward bound,
“Lord, plant my feet on higher ground.”
stanza2: My heart has no desire to stay
Where doubts arise, and fears dismay;
Though some may dwell where these abound,
My constant aim is higher ground.
stanza3: Beyond the mist I fain would rise,
To rest beneath unclouded skies,
Above earth’s turmoil peace is found,
By those who dwell on higher ground.
stanza4: I long to scale the utmost height,
Though rough the way, and hard the fight,
My song, while climbing, shall resound,
Lord, lead me on to higher ground.
stanza5: Lord, lead me up the mountain side,
I dare not climb without my Guide;
And, heaven gained, I’ll gaze around,
With grateful heart from higher ground.
chorus1: Lord, lift me up and let me stand,
By faith, on heaven’s table-land;
Where love, and joy, and light abound,
Lord, plant my feet on higher ground.
chorus2: Lord, lift me up and let me stand,
By faith, on heaven’s table-land;
Where love, and joy, and light abound,
Lord, plant my feet on higher ground.
chorus3: Lord, lift me up and let me stand,
By faith, on heaven’s table-land;
Where love, and joy, and light abound,
Lord, plant my feet on higher ground.
chorus4: Lord, lift me up and let me stand,
By faith, on heaven’s table-land;
Where love, and joy, and light abound,
Lord, plant my feet on higher ground.
chorus5: Lord, lift me up and let me stand,
By faith, on heaven’s table-land;
Where love, and joy, and light abound,
Lord, plant my feet on higher ground.

generalIndex.title: GHS 180
generalIndex.subtitle: SINCE THE SON HATH MADE ME FREE
stanza1: Since the Son hath made me free,
Let me taste my liberty;
Thee behold with open face,
Triumph in Thy saving grace,
Thy great will delight to prove,
Glory in Thy perfect love.
stanza2: Abba, Father, hear Thy child,
Late in Jesus reconciled;
Hear, and all the graces shower,
All the joy, and peace, and power,
All my Saviour asks above,
All the life and heaven of love.
stanza3: Heavenly Adam, Life divine,
Change my nature into Thine;
Move and spread throughout my soul,
Actuate and fill the whole;
Be it I no longer now
Living in the flesh, but Thou.
stanza4: Holy Ghost, no more delay;
Come, and in Thy temple stay;
Now Thine inward witness bear,
Strong, and permanent, and clear;
Spring of life, Thyself impart,
Rise eternal in my heart.
Amen.

generalIndex.title: GHS 181
generalIndex.subtitle: ALL THINGS ARE POSSIBLE
stanza1: All things are possible to him
That can in Jesus’ name believe;
Lord, I no more Thy name blaspheme,
Thy truth I lovingly receive.
I can, I do believe in Thee;
All things are possible to me.
stanza2: ’Twas most impossible of all
That here sin’s reign in me should cease;
Yet shall it be, I know it shall;
Jesus, I trust Thy faithfulness!
If nothing is too hard for Thee,
All things are possible to me.
stanza3: Though earth and hell the Word gainsay,
The Word of God shall never fail;
The Lord can break sin’s iron sway;
’Tis certain, though impossible.
The thing impossible shall be,
All things are possible to me.
stanza4: All things are possible to God;
To Christ, the power of God in man;
To me when I am all renewed,
In Christ am fully formed again.
And from the reign of sin set free, -
All things are possible to me.
stanza5: All things are possible to God;
To Christ, the power of God in me;
Now shed Thy mighty Self abroad,
Let me no longer live, but Thee;
Give me this hour in Thee to prove
The sweet omnipotence of love.

generalIndex.title: GHS 182
generalIndex.subtitle: BLESSED ARE THE PURE IN HEART
stanza1: Blessed are the pure in heart,
They have learned the angel art,
While on earth in heaven to be,
God, by sense unseen, to see.
Cleansed from sin’s offensive stain,
Fellowship with Him they gain;
Nearness, likeness to their Lord,
Their exceeding great reward.
stanza2: Worshipping in spirit now,
In His inner court they bow-
Bow before the brightening veil,
God’s own radiance through it hail.
Serious, simple of intent,
Teachably intelligent,
Rapt, they search the written Word
Till His very voice is heard.
stanza3: In creation Him they own,
Meet Him in its haunts, alone;
Most amidst its Sabbath calm,
Morning light and evening balm.
Him they still through busier life
Trust in pain, and care, and strife;
These, like clouds, o’er noontide blaze,
Temper, not conceal, His rays.
stanza4: Hallowed thus their every breath:
Dying, they shall not see death,
With the Lord in paradise,
Till, like His, their bodies rise.
Nearer than the seraphim
In their flesh shall saints see Him,
With the Father, in the Son,
Through the Spirit, ever one.

generalIndex.title: GHS 183
generalIndex.subtitle: COME, O MY GOD, THE PROMISE SEAL
stanza1: Come, O my God, the promise seal,
This mountain, sin, remove;
Now in my fainting soul reveal
The virtue of Thy love.
stanza2: I want Thy life, Thy purity,
Thy righteousness brought in;
I ask, desire, and trust in Thee,
To be redeemed from sin.
stanza3: Anger and sloth, desire and pride,
This moment be subdued;
Be cast into the crimson tide
Of my Redeemer’s blood!
stanza4: Saviour, to Thee my soul looks up,
My present Saviour Thou!
In all the confidence of hope,
I claim the blessing now.
stanza5: ’Tis done! Thou does this moment
With full salvation bless;
Redemption through Thy blood I have,
Save, and spotless love and peace.

generalIndex.title: GHS 184
generalIndex.subtitle: SAVIOUR FROM SIN, I WAIT TO PROVE
stanza1: Saviour from sin, I wait to prove
That Jesus is Thy healing name;
To lose, when perfected in love,
Whate’er I have, or can, or am
I stay me on Thy faithful word:
The servant shall be as his Lord.
stanza2: Answer that gracious end in me
For which Thy precious life was given;
Redeem from all iniquity;
Restore, and make me meet for heaven:
Unless Thou purge my every stain,
Thy suffering and my faith are vain.
stanza3: Didst Thou not die that I might live
No longer to myself, but Thee,
Might body, soul, and spirit give
To Him who gave Himself for me?
Come then, my Master and my God,
Take the dear purchase of Thy blood.
stanza4: Thy own peculiar servant claim,
For Thy own truth and mercy’s sake;
Hallow in me Thy glorious name;
Me for Thine own this moment take,
And change, and throughly purify;
Thine only may I live and die.

generalIndex.title: GHS 185
generalIndex.subtitle: THE THING MY GOD DOTH HATE
stanza1: The thing my God doth hate
That I no more may do,
Thy creature, Lord, again create,
And all my soul renew.
stanza2: My soul shall then, like Thine,
Abhor the thing unclean,
And, sanctified by love divine,
For ever cease from sin.
stanza3: That blessed law of Thine,
Jesus, to me impart;
The Spirit’s law of life divine,
O write it in my heart!
stanza4: Implant it deep within,
Whence it may ne’er remove,
The law of liberty from sin,
The perfect law of love.
stanza5: Thy nature be my law,
Thy spotless sanctity,
And sweetly every moment draw
My happy soul to Thee.
stanza6: In me, O Lord, fulfil again

generalIndex.title: GHS 186
generalIndex.subtitle: GOD OF ALL POWER, AND TRUTH, & GRACE
stanza1: God of all power, and truth, and grace,
Which shall from age to age endure,
Whose word, when heaven and earth shall pass,
Remains and stands for ever sure.
stanza2: That I Thy mercy may proclaim,
That all mankind Thy truth may see,
Hallow Thy great and glorious name,
And perfect holiness in me.
stanza3: Purge me from every evil blot;
My idols all be cast aside;
Cleanse me from every sinful thought,
From all the filth of self and pride.
stanza4: Give me a new, a perfect heart,
From doubt, and fear, and sorrow free;
The mind which was in Christ impart,
And let my spirit cleave to Thee.
stanza5: O that I now, from sin released,
Thy word may to the utmost prove,
Enter into the promised rest,
The Canaan of Thy perfect love! Amen.

generalIndex.title: GHS 187
generalIndex.subtitle: JESUS, ALL-ATONING LAMB
stanza1: Jesus, all-atoning Lamb,
Thine, and only Thine, I am:
Take my body, spirit, soul;
Only Thou possess the whole.
stanza2: Thou my one thing needful be;
Let me ever cleave to Thee;
Let me choose the better part;
Let me give Thee all my heart.
stanza3: Fairer than the sons of men,
Do not let me turn again,
Leave the fountain-head of bliss,
Stoop to creature-happiness.
stanza4: Whom have I on earth below?
Thee, and only Thee, I know;
Whom have I in heaven but Thee?
Thou art all in all to me.
stanza5: All my treasure is above,
All my riches is Thy love:
Who the worth of love can tell?
Infinite, unsearchable.

generalIndex.title: GHS 188
generalIndex.subtitle: O LORD, HOW HAPPY SHOULD WE BE
stanza1: O Lord, how happy should we be
If we could cast our care on Thee,
If we from self could rest,
And feel at heart that One above,
In perfect wisdom, perfect love
Is working for the best.
stanza2: How far from this our daily life,
Ever disturbed by anxious strife,
By sudden wild alarms.
O could we but relinquish all
Our earthly props, and simply fall
On Thine almighty arms.
stanza3: Could we but kneel and cast our load,
E’en while we pray, upon our God,
Then rise with lightened cheer,
Sure that the Father, who is nigh
To still the famished raven’s cry,
Will hear, in that we fear.
stanza4: Lord, make these faithless hearts of ours
Thy lessons learn from birds and flowers:
Make them from self to cease,
Leave all things to a Father’s will,
And taste, before Him lying still,
E’en in affliction, peace.

generalIndex.title: GHS 189
generalIndex.subtitle: TAKE TIME TO BE HOLY
stanza1: Take time to be holy, speak oft with thy Lord;
Abide in Him always, and feed on His Word;
Make friends of God’s children help those who are weak;
Forgetting in nothing, His blessing to seek.
stanza2: Take time to be holy, the world rushes on;
Spend much time in secret with Jesus alone-
By looking to Jesus, like him thou shalt be;
Thy friends in thy conduct His likeness shall see.
stanza3: Take time to be holy, let Him be thy Guide;
And run not before Him, whatever betide;
In joy or in sorrow still follow thy Lord,
And, looking to Jesus, still trust in His word.
stanza4: Take time to be holy, be calm in thy soul;
Each thought and each temper beneath His control:
Thus led by His Spirit to fountains of love,
Thou soon shalt be fitted for service above.

generalIndex.title: GHS 190
generalIndex.subtitle: “CALLED UNTO HOLINESS”
stanza1: “Called unto holiness,” Church of our God,
Purchased of Jesus, redeemed by His blood;
Called from the world and its idols to flee,
Called from the bondage of sin to be free.
stanza2: “Called unto holiness,” children of Light,
Walking with Jesus in garments of white;
Raiment unsullied, nor tarnished with sin,
God’s Holy Spirit abiding within.
stanza3: “Called unto holiness,” praise His dear name,
This blessed secret to faith now made plain,
Not our own righteousness, but Christ within,
Living and reigning, and saving from sin.
stanza4: “Called unto holiness,” glorious thought!
Up from the wilderness wanderings brought
Out from the shadows and darkness of night
Into the Canaan of perfect delight.
stanza5: “Called unto holiness,” Bride of the Lamb,
Waiting the Bridegroom’s returning again;
Lift up your heads, for the day draweth near.
When in His beauty the King shall appear.
chorus1: “Holiness unto the Lord,” is our
watchword and song,
“Holiness unto the Lord,” as we’re
marching along:
Sing. . . it, shout it, loud . . .and long,
“Holiness unto the Lord,” now and for ever.
chorus2: “Holiness unto the Lord,” is our
watchword and song,
“Holiness unto the Lord,” as we’re
marching along:
Sing. . . it, shout it, loud . . .and long,
“Holiness unto the Lord,” now and for ever.
chorus3: “Holiness unto the Lord,” is our
watchword and song,
“Holiness unto the Lord,” as we’re
marching along:
Sing. . . it, shout it, loud . . .and long,
“Holiness unto the Lord,” now and for ever.
chorus4: “Holiness unto the Lord,” is our
watchword and song,
“Holiness unto the Lord,” as we’re
marching along:
Sing. . . it, shout it, loud . . .and long,
“Holiness unto the Lord,” now and for ever.
chorus5: “Holiness unto the Lord,” is our
watchword and song,
“Holiness unto the Lord,” as we’re
marching along:
Sing. . . it, shout it, loud . . .and long,
“Holiness unto the Lord,” now and for ever.

generalIndex.title: GHS 191
generalIndex.subtitle: COME, HOLY GHOST, ALL-QUICKENING FIRE!
stanza1: Come Holy Ghost, all-quickening fire!
Come, and my hallowed heart inspire,
Sprinkled with the atoning blood;
Now to my soul Thyself reveal,
Thy mighty working let me feel,
And know that I am born of God.
stanza2: Humble, and teachable, and mild,
O may I, as a little child,
My lowly Master’s steps pursue!
Be anger to my soul unknown,
Hate, envy, jealousy, be gone;
In love create Thou all things new.
stanza3: Let earth no more my heart divide,
With Christ may I be crucified,
To Thee with my whole soul aspire;
Dead to the world and all its toys,
Its idle pomp, and fading joys,
Be Thou alone my one desire.
stanza4: My will be swallowed up in Thee;
Light in Thy light still may I see,
Beholding Thee with open face,
Called the full power of faith to prove,
Let all my hallowed heart be love,
And all my spotless life be praise.

generalIndex.title: GHS 192
generalIndex.subtitle: O FOR A HEART TO PRAISE MY GOD
stanza1: O for a heart to praise my God,
A heart from sin set free,
A heart that always feels Thy blood
So freely spilt for me.
stanza2: A heart resigned, submissive, meek,
My great Redeemer’s throne,
Where only Christ is heard to speak,
Where Jesus reigns alone.
stanza3: A humble, lowly, contrite heart,
Believing, true, and clean;
Which neither life nor death can part
From Him that dwells within.
stanza4: A heart in every thought renewed,
And full of love divine;
Perfect, and right, and pure, and good,
A copy, Lord, of Thine.
stanza5: Thy nature, gracious Lord, impart;
Come quickly from above,
Write Thy new name upon my heart,
Thy new, best name of love. Amen.

generalIndex.title: GHS 219
generalIndex.subtitle: MORE HOLINESS GIVE ME, MORE STRIVING WITHIN
stanza1: More holiness give me, More striving within;
More patience in suffering, More sorrow for sin;
More faith in my Saviour, More sense of His care;
More joy in His service, More purpose in prayer.
stanza2: More gratitude give me, More trust in the Lord;
More pride in His glory, More hope in His Word;
More tears for His sorrows, More pain at His grief;
More meekness in trial, More praise for relief.
stanza3: More purity give me, More strength to o’ercome;
More freedom from earth-stains, More longings for home;
More fit for the kingdom, More used would I be;
More blessed and holy, More, Saviour, like Thee.

generalIndex.title: GHS 193
generalIndex.subtitle: ANOTHER YEAR
stanza1: Another year is dawning-
A path unknown, untried,
’Twould fill me with foreboding,
Had I no hand to guide;
But He who walked beside me
All through the yesteryear,
Whatever may betide me,
Has promised to be near.
stanza2: Another year with Jesus!
Ah, then, no dread I know.
His love is ever precious,
Howe’er the winds may blow.
E’en when the storm is fiercest,
In Him my soul may rest,
And find sweet peace and comfort
'Upon his loving breast.
stanza3: Another year to trust Him -
Yes, I can trust Him still,
Who never yet has failed me
As I have sought His will.
His rod and staff He giveth
To be my strength and stay,
And tenderly He leadeth
Along the homeward way.
stanza4: Another year to serve Him,
To labour for Him here,
E’en while the shadows lengthen
And night is drawing near.
I know not when He’ll call me
To lay my sickle by-
Oh, may I then be faithful,
While now the moments fly!
stanza5: Another year to love Him,
Whom I have loved so long;
Another year to praise Him
In glad triumphant song.
Whate’er the future holdeth,
Of sorrow, toil, or pain;
His precious Love endureth
Forevermore the same.
stanza6: Teach me to do Thy will,.

generalIndex.title: GHS 194
generalIndex.subtitle: O DAY OF REST AND GLADNESS
stanza1: O day of rest and gladness,
O day of joy and light,
O balm of care and sadness,
Most beautiful, most bright!
On thee the high and lowly,
Through ages joined in tune,
Sing: holy, holy, holy,
To the great God Tribune.
stanza2: On thee, at the creation,
The light first had its birth;
On thee, for our salvation,
Christ rose from depths of earth;
On thee, our Lord victorious
The Spirit sent from Heaven:
And thus on thee most glorious
A triple light was given.
stanza3: Thou art a port protected
From storms that round us rise;
A garden intersected
With streams of paradise;
Thou art a cooling fountain
In life’s dry dreary sand;
From thee, like Pisgah’s mountain,
We view our promised land.
stanza4: Thou art a holy ladder,
Where angels go and come;
Each Sunday finds us gladder,
Nearer to heaven, our home;
A day of sweet reflection,
Thou art a day of love;
A day of resurrection
From earth to things above.
stanza5: Today on weary nations
The heavenly manna falls;
To holy convocations
The silver trumpet calls,
Where gospel light is glowing
With pure and radiant beams.
And living water flowing
With soul-refreshing streams.
stanza6: From, this our day of rest,
To Thee, blest Three in One.

generalIndex.title: GHS 195
generalIndex.subtitle: ANOTHER YEAR IS DAWNING
stanza1: Another year is dawning!
Dear Father, let it be,
In working or in waiting,
Another year with Thee;
Another year of progress,
Another year of praise,
Another year of proving,
Thy presence all the days.
stanza2: Another year of mercies,
Of faithfulness and grace;
Another year of gladness
The glory of Thy face;
Another year of leaning
Upon Thy loving breast;
Another year of trusting,
Of quiet, happy rest;
stanza3: Another year of service,
Of witness for Thy love;
Another year of training
For holier work above.
Another year is dawning!
Dear Father, let it be,
On earth, or else in heaven,
Another year for Thee.

generalIndex.title: GHS 215
generalIndex.subtitle: O HAPPY DAY, THAT FIXED MY CHOICE
stanza1: O happy day, that fixed my choice,
On Thee, my Saviour and my God!
Well may this glowing heart rejoice,
And tell its raptures all abroad.
stanza2: ‘‘Tis done, the great transactions done!
I am my Lord’s and He is mine:
He drew me and I followed on,
Charmed to confess the voice divine.
stanza3: Now rest, my long-divided heart,
Fixed on this blissful centre, rest:
Nor ever from thy Lord depart,
With Him of every good possessed.
stanza4: High heaven, that heard the solemn vow,
That vow renewed shall daily hear,
Till in life’s latest hour I bow,
And bless in death a bond so dear.
chorus1: Happy day, happy day,
When Jesus washed my sins away!
He taught me how to watch and pray,
And live rejoicing ev’ry day,
Happy day, happy day,
When Jesus washed my sins away!
chorus2: Happy day, happy day,
When Jesus washed my sins away!
He taught me how to watch and pray,
And live rejoicing ev’ry day,
Happy day, happy day,
When Jesus washed my sins away!
chorus3: Happy day, happy day,
When Jesus washed my sins away!
He taught me how to watch and pray,
And live rejoicing ev’ry day,
Happy day, happy day,
When Jesus washed my sins away!
chorus4: Happy day, happy day,
When Jesus washed my sins away!
He taught me how to watch and pray,
And live rejoicing ev’ry day,
Happy day, happy day,
When Jesus washed my sins away!

generalIndex.title: GHS 196
generalIndex.subtitle: DOES JESUS CARE?
stanza1: Does Jesus care when my heart is pained
Too deeply for mirth and song;
As the burdens press, and the cares distress,
And the way grows weary and long?
stanza2: Does Jesus care when my way is dark
With a nameless dread and fear?
As the daylight fades into deep night shades,
Does He care enough to be near?
stanza3: Does Jesus care when I’ve tried and failed
To resist some temptation strong;
When for my deep grief I find no relief,
Tho’ my tears flow all the night long?
stanza4: Does Jesus care when I’ve said goodbye,
To the dearest on earth to me,
And my sad heart aches till it nearly breaks,
Is it aught to Him, does He see?
chorus1: O yes, He cares, I know He cares!
His heart is touched with my grief;
When the days are weary, the long nights dreary,
I know my Saviour cares.
chorus2: O yes, He cares, I know He cares!
His heart is touched with my grief;
When the days are weary, the long nights dreary,
I know my Saviour cares.
chorus3: O yes, He cares, I know He cares!
His heart is touched with my grief;
When the days are weary, the long nights dreary,
I know my Saviour cares.
chorus4: O yes, He cares, I know He cares!
His heart is touched with my grief;
When the days are weary, the long nights dreary,
I know my Saviour cares.

generalIndex.title: GHS 197
generalIndex.subtitle: LOVE FOUND A WAY
stanza1: Wonderful love that rescued me,
Sunk deep in sin,
Guilty and vile as I could be -
No hope within;
When ev’ry ray of light had fled,
O glorious day!
Raising my soul from out the dead,
Love found a way.
stanza2: Love bro’t my Saviour here to die
On Calvary,
For such a sinful wretch as I,
How can it be?
Love bridged the gulf ’twixt me and heav’n,
Taught me to pray;
I am redeemed, set free, forgiv’n,
Love found a way.
stanza3: Love opened wide the gates of light
To heav’n’s domain,
Where in eternal pow’r and might
Jesus shall reign;
Love lifted me from depths of woe
To endless day,
There was no help in earth below,
Love found a way.
chorus1: Love found a way.... to redeem my soul,...
Love found a way ... that could make me whole;...
Love sent my Lord ... to the cross of shame,
Love found a way, O praise His holy name!
chorus2: Love found a way.... to redeem my soul,...
Love found a way ... that could make me whole;...
Love sent my Lord ... to the cross of shame,
Love found a way, O praise His holy name!
chorus3: Love found a way.... to redeem my soul,...
Love found a way ... that could make me whole;...
Love sent my Lord ... to the cross of shame,
Love found a way, O praise His holy name!

generalIndex.title: GHS 198
generalIndex.subtitle: HIS LOVE CAN NEVER FAIL
stanza1: I do not ask to see the way
My feet will have to tread;
But only that my soul may feed
Upon the living Bread.
’Tis better far that I should walk
By faith close to His side -
I may not know the way I go,
But oh, I know my Guide.
stanza2: And if my feet would go astray,
They cannot, for I know,
That Jesus guides my falt’ring steps.
As joyfully I go,
And tho’ I may not see His face,
My faith is strong and clear,
That in each hour of sore distress
My Saviour will be near.
stanza3: I will not fear, tho’ darkness come
Abroad o’er all the land,
If I may only feel the touch
Of His own loving hand.
And tho’ I tremble when I think
How weak I am, how frail,
My soul is satisfied to know
His love can never fail.
chorus1: His love ..... can never fail,
His love ..... can never fail;
My soul is satisfied to know
His love can never fail.
chorus2: His love ..... can never fail,
His love ..... can never fail;
My soul is satisfied to know
His love can never fail.
chorus3: His love ..... can never fail,
His love ..... can never fail;
My soul is satisfied to know
His love can never fail.

generalIndex.title: GHS 199
generalIndex.subtitle: RESTING IN HIS LOVE
stanza1: God has shown His loving face
From His throne in heav’n above:
And I’ve found a resting-place,
In the shelter of His love.
stanza2: When the cares of life oppress,
When the sky is dark above;
I can always find a rest,
In the shelter of His love.
stanza3: O, if you were never blest,
With this peace from heav’n above;
There’s for you a wondrous rest,
In the shelter of His love.
chorus1: I am resting, resting,
Resting sweetly resting in His love;
I am resting in His love,
Resting in the shelter of His love.
chorus2: I am resting, resting,
Resting sweetly resting in His love;
I am resting in His love,
Resting in the shelter of His love.
chorus3: I am resting, resting,
Resting sweetly resting in His love;
I am resting in His love,
Resting in the shelter of His love.

generalIndex.title: GHS 200
generalIndex.subtitle: THE NINETY AND NINE
stanza1: There were ninety and nine that safely lay
In the shelter of the fold,
But one was out on the hills away,
Far off from the gates of gold -
Away on the mountains wild and bare,
Away from the tender Shepherd’s care,
Away from the tender Shepherd’s care.
stanza2: “Lord, Thou hast here Thy ninety and nine;
Are they not enough for Thee?”
But the Shepherd made answer:
“This of Mine has wandered away from Me;
And although the road be rough and steep,
I go to the desert to find My sheep,
I go to the desert to find My sheep,
stanza3: But none of the ransomed ever knew
How deep were the waters crossed;
Nor how dark was the night that the Lord passed thro’
Ere He found His sheep that was lost;
Out in the desert He heard its cry -
Sick and helpless, and ready to die,
Sick and helpless, and ready to die,
stanza4: “Lord, whence are those blood-drops all the way
That mark out the mountain’s track?”
“They were shed for one who had gone astray
Ere the Shepherd could bring him back.”
“Lord, whence are Thy hands so rent and torn?”
“They’re pierced tonight by many a thorn;
They’re pireced tonight by many a thorn.”
stanza5: But all thro’ the mountains, thunder-riven,
And up from the rocky steep.
There arose a glad cry to the gate of heaven,
“Rejoice! I have found my sheep!”
And the angels echoed around the throne,
“Rejoice, for the Lord brings back His own!
“Rejoice, for the Lord brings back His own!

generalIndex.title: GHS 201
generalIndex.subtitle: LOVE LIFTED ME
stanza1: I was sinking deep in sin,
Far from the peaceful shore,
Very deeply stained within,
Sinking to rise no more;
But the Master of the sea
Heard my despairing cry,
From the waters lifted me,
Now safe am I.
stanza2: All my heart to Him I give,
Ever to Him I’ll cling,
In His blessed presence live,
Ever His praises sing.
Love so mighty and so true
Merits my soul’s best songs;
Faithful, loving service, too,
To Him belongs.
stanza3: Souls in danger, look above,
Jesus completely saves;
He will lift you by His love
Out of the angry waves.
He’s the Master of the sea,
Billows His will obey;
He your Saviour wants to be -
Be saved today.
chorus1: Love lifted me! Love lifted me!
When nothing else could help, Love lifted me.
Love lifted me! Love lifted me!
When nothing else could help, Love lifted me.
chorus2: Love lifted me! Love lifted me!
When nothing else could help, Love lifted me.
Love lifted me! Love lifted me!
When nothing else could help, Love lifted me.
chorus3: Love lifted me! Love lifted me!
When nothing else could help, Love lifted me.
Love lifted me! Love lifted me!
When nothing else could help, Love lifted me.

generalIndex.title: GHS 202
generalIndex.subtitle: WONDERFUL STORY OF LOVE
stanza1: Wonderful story of love; tell it to me again;
Wonderful story of love; wake the immortal strain!
Angels with rapture announce it,
Shepherds with wonder receive it;
Sinner, O won’t you believe it?
Wonderful story of love.
stanza2: Wonderful story of love; though you are far away;
Wonderful story of love; still He doth call to-day;
Calling from Calvary’s mountain,
Down from the crystal bright fountain,
E’en from the dawn of creation,
Wonderful story of love.
stanza3: Wonderful story of love; Jesus provides a rest;
Wonderful story of love; for all the pure and blest,
Rest in those mansions above us,
With those who’ve gone on before us,
Singing the rapturous chorus1,
Wonderful story of love.
chorus1: Won. . . . der . . .. ful!
Won. . . . der . . .. ful!
Won. . . . der . . .. ful!
Wonderful story of love!
chorus2: Won. . . . der . . .. ful!
Won. . . . der . . .. ful!
Won. . . . der . . .. ful!
Wonderful story of love!
chorus3: Won. . . . der . . .. ful!
Won. . . . der . . .. ful!
Won. . . . der . . .. ful!
Wonderful story of love!

generalIndex.title: GHS 203
generalIndex.subtitle: THERE IS NO LOVE LIKE THE LOVE OF JESUS
stanza1: There is no love like the love of Jesus -
Never to fade or fall,
Till into the fold of the peace of God
He has gather’d us all.
stanza2: There is no eye like the eye of Jesus,
Piercing so far away;
Ne’er out of the sight of its tender light
Can the wanderer stray.
stanza3: There is no voice like the voice of Jesus.
Tender and sweet its chime,
Like musical ring of a flowing spring,
In the bright summer time.
stanza4: There is no heart like the heart of Jesus,
Filled with a tender love:
No throb nor throe that our hearts can know,
But He feels it above.
chorus1: Jesus’ love, precious love,
Boundless and pure and free;
Oh, turn to that love, weary wand’ring soul:
Jesus pleadeth with thee!
chorus2: Jesus’ love, precious love,
Boundless and pure and free;
Oh, turn to that love, weary wand’ring soul:
Jesus pleadeth with thee!
chorus3: Jesus’ love, precious love,
Boundless and pure and free;
Oh, turn to that love, weary wand’ring soul:
Jesus pleadeth with thee!
chorus4: Jesus’ love, precious love,
Boundless and pure and free;
Oh, turn to that love, weary wand’ring soul:
Jesus pleadeth with thee!

generalIndex.title: GHS 209
generalIndex.subtitle: I WILL NOT FORGET THEE
stanza1: Sweet is the promise “I will not forget thee,”
Nothing can molest or turn my soul away;
E’en though the night be dark within the valley,
Just beyond is shining an eternal day.
stanza2: How can I show my gratitude to Jesus,
For His love unfailing and His tender care?
I will proclaim to others His salvation,
That they may accept Him and His promise share.
stanza3: Trusting the promise “I will not forget thee,”
Onward will I go with songs of joy and praise;
Tho’ earth despise me, tho’ my friends forsake me,
Jesus will be near me gladdening my days.
stanza4: When at the golden portals I am standing,
All my tribulations, all my sorrows past,
How sweet to hear the blessed proclamation:
“Enter, faithful servant, welcome home at last!”
chorus1: I...will not forget thee or leave thee;
In My hands I’ll hold thee, in My arms I’ll fold thee;
I...will not forget thee or leave thee -
I am thy Redeemer, I will care for thee.
chorus2: I...will not forget thee or leave thee;
In My hands I’ll hold thee, in My arms I’ll fold thee;
I...will not forget thee or leave thee -
I am thy Redeemer, I will care for thee.
chorus3: I...will not forget thee or leave thee;
In My hands I’ll hold thee, in My arms I’ll fold thee;
I...will not forget thee or leave thee -
I am thy Redeemer, I will care for thee.
chorus4: I...will not forget thee or leave thee;
In My hands I’ll hold thee, in My arms I’ll fold thee;
I...will not forget thee or leave thee -
I am thy Redeemer, I will care for thee.

generalIndex.title: GHS 218
generalIndex.subtitle: LOVE DIVINE, ALL LOVES EXCELLING
stanza1: Love divine, all loves excelling,
Joy of heav’n, to earth come down!
Fix in us Thy humble dwelling;
All Thy faithful mercies crown.
Jesus, Thou art all compassion,
Pure, unbounded love Thou art;
Visit us with Thy salvation;
Enter every trembling heart.
stanza2: Breathe, O, breathe Thy loving Spirit
Into every troubled breast!
Let us all in Thee inherit,
Let us find that second rest.
Take away our bent to sinning;
Alpha and Omega be;
End of faith, as its beginning,
Set our hearts at liberty.
stanza3: Come, Almighty to deliver,
Let us all Thy life receive;
Suddenly return, and never,
Never more Thy temples leave:
Thee we would be always blessing,
Serve Thee as Thy hosts above.
Pray, and praise Thee without ceasing,
Glory in thy perfect love.
stanza4: Finish then Thy new creation,
Pure and spotless may we be;
Let us see our whole salvation,
Perfectly secured by Thee:
Changed from glory into glory,
Till in heaven we take our place,
Till we cast our crowns before Thee,
Lost in wonder, love, and praise.

generalIndex.title: GHS 204
generalIndex.subtitle: YE MUST BE BORN AGAIN
stanza1: A ruler once came to Jesus by night,
To ask Him the way of salvation and light;
The Master made answer in words true and plain,
“Ye must be born again!”
stanza2: Ye children of men attend to the word
So solemnly uttered by Jesus the Lord,
And let not this message to you be in vain,
“Ye must be born again!”
stanza3: O ye who would enter that glorious rest,
And sing with the ransomed the song of the blest;
The life everlasting if ye would obtain,
“Ye must be born again.”
stanza4: A dear one in heaven thy heart yearns to see,
At the beautiful gates may be watching for thee;
Then list to the note of this solemn refrain,
“Ye must be born again.”
chorus1: “Ye must be born again!”
“Ye must be born again!”
I verily, verily say unto thee -
“Ye must be born again!”
chorus2: “Ye must be born again!”
“Ye must be born again!”
I verily, verily say unto thee -
“Ye must be born again!”
chorus3: “Ye must be born again!”
“Ye must be born again!”
I verily, verily say unto thee -
“Ye must be born again!”
chorus4: “Ye must be born again!”
“Ye must be born again!”
I verily, verily say unto thee -
“Ye must be born again!”

generalIndex.title: GHS 205
generalIndex.subtitle: HAVE YOU COUNTED THE COST?
stanza1: There’s a line that is drawn by rejecting our Lord,
Where the call of His Spirit is lost,...
And you hurry along with the pleasure-mad throng -
Have you counted, have you counted the cost?
stanza2: You may barter your hope of eternity’s morn,
For a moment of joy at the most,...
For the glitter of sin and the things it will win-
“Have you counted, have you counted the cost?
stanza3: While the door of His mercy is open to you,
Ere the depth of His love you exhaust,...
Won’t you come and be healed, won’t you whisper, I yield -
I have counted, I have counted, the cost.
chorus1: Have you counted the cost, if your soul should be lost,
Tho’ you gain the whole world for your own? ...
Even now it may be that the line you have crossed,
Have you counted, have you counted the cost?
chorus2: Have you counted the cost, if your soul should be lost,
Tho’ you gain the whole world for your own? ...
Even now it may be that the line you have crossed,
Have you counted, have you counted the cost?
chorus3: Have you counted the cost, if your soul should be lost,
Tho’ you gain the whole world for your own? ...
Even now it may be that the line you have crossed,
Have you counted, have you counted the cost?

generalIndex.title: GHS 206
generalIndex.subtitle: WHERE WILL YOU SPEND ETERNITY?
stanza1: Where will you spend eternity?
This question comes to you and me!
Tell me, what shall your answer be?
Where will you spend, eternity?
stanza2: Many are choosing Christ today,
Turning from all their sins away;
Heav’n shall their happy portion be;
Where will you spend eternity?
stanza3: Leaving the strait and narrow way,
Going the downward road today,
Sad will their final ending be,
Lost thro’ a long eternity!
stanza4: Repent, believe, this very hour,
Trust in the Saviour’s grace and power;
Then will your joyous answer be,
Saved through a long eternity!

generalIndex.title: GHS 207
generalIndex.subtitle: THERE’S A GREAT DAY COMING
stanza1: There’s a great day coming,
A great day coming,
There’s a great day coming by and by;
When the saints and the sinners shall be
parted right and left,
Are you ready for that day to come?
stanza2: There’s a bright day coming,
A bright day coming,
There’s a bright day coming by and by;
But its brightness shall only come
to them that love the Lord,
Are you ready for that day to come?
stanza3: There’s a sad day coming,
A sad day coming,
There’s a sad day coming by and by;
When the sinner shall hear his doom
“Depart, I know ye not,”
Are you ready for that day to come?
chorus1: Are you ready? Are you ready?
Are you ready for the judgment day?
Are you ready? Are you ready?
For the judgment day?
chorus2: Are you ready? Are you ready?
Are you ready for the judgment day?
Are you ready? Are you ready?
For the judgment day?
chorus3: Are you ready? Are you ready?
Are you ready for the judgment day?
Are you ready? Are you ready?
For the judgment day?

generalIndex.title: GHS 208
generalIndex.subtitle: THE GREAT JUDGMENT MORNING
stanza1: I dreamed that the great judgment morning
Had dawned and the trumpet had blown;
I dreamed that the nations had gathered
To judgment before the white throne;
From the throne came a bright shining angel,
And stood on the land and the sea,
And swore with his hand raised to heaven,
That time was no longer to be.
stanza2: The rich man was there, but his money
Had melted and vanished away;
A pauper he stood in the judgment,
His debts were too heavy to pay;
The great man was there, but his greatness,
When death came, was left far behind!
The angel that opened the records,
Not a trace of his greatness could find.
stanza3: The widow was there with the orphans,
God heard and remembered their cries;
No sorrow in heaven for ever,
God wiped all the tears from their eyes;
The gambler was there and the drunkard,
And the man that had sold them the drink,
With the people who gave him the license,
Together in hell they did sink.
stanza4: The moral man came to the judgment,
But his self-righteous rags would not do;
The men who had crucified Jesus
Had passed off as moral men, too;
The soul that had put off salvation,
“Not tonight; I’ll get saved by and by,
No time now to think of religion!”
At last they had found time to die.
chorus1: And O, what a weeping and wailing,
As the lost were told of their fate;
They cried for the rocks and the mountains,
They prayed, but their prayer was too late.
chorus2: And O, what a weeping and wailing,
As the lost were told of their fate;
They cried for the rocks and the mountains,
They prayed, but their prayer was too late.
chorus3: And O, what a weeping and wailing,

They cried for the rocks and the mountains,
